loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 41 years old, married, and has four children.  She practices dairy farming to earn a living.  She has ten years of experience in the business.  With her experience, she has learned new farming methods.  This has helped her to improve her business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented.  Her desire is to expand her business and become more financially stable.
Getrude has requested  20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Liza Joy

texts.en: Liza Joy  is 54 years old, married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a private employee.  Liza Joy manages their snack vending business. She is a pioneering member of Paglaum MPC.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.  She hopes that her snack vending business will grow, and she will be able to sell and deliver to her customers in future.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es: Delmy D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo D. 45 años y sus dos hijas D. 19 y 17 años. Delmy ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su querida familia la cual cada día le demanda más. Ella se dedica al comercio. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado establecer una tiendita en el mercado central D. la zona donD. ella habita, en la que venD. diferentes productos como: arroz, frijoles, pan dulce, golosinas, detergente, papel, aceite, etc. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. sus vecinos y estos cada día la prefieren más ya que siempre encuentran lo que buscan. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder colaborar con la economía del hogar y así poder aspirar a un mejor futuro. Su sueño es seguir manteniendo su tiendita en marcha ya que esta le brinda los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento del hogar. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. artículos (frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, golosinas, leche, pan dulce, papel, detergente, etc.) al por mayor para surtir su tienda y así seguir trabajando por lograr un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en: Delmy is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her family: her husband who is 45 years old and her 2 daughters who are 19 and 17 years old. Delmy has worked her whole life to take care of her beloved family which each days demands more. By means of a lot of effort and dedication she has managed to establish a small shop at the central market of the area in which she lives, where she sells different products such as: rice, beans, pastries, candies, detergent, paper, oil, etc. Thanks to her charisma she has managed to gain her neighbours' trust and these days they prefer her store as they always find what they need. The most important for her is her family, working hard to contribute to the household expenses and thus aspiring to a better future. For this reason she has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in the purchase of products (beans, rice, sugar, coffee, oil, candies, milk, pastries, paper, detergent, etc.) wholesale to stock her store and so continue to work towards a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, oil, candies, milk, bread, pastries, paper, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, beverages, soaps, shampoos, noodles and splash product to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  She runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  She has employed one person in the business.  Besides this, she does farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances. This is because she has been trained on financial management through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  
Jane hopes to expand her business premises so as to accommodate more customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, maize, beans and milk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, maize, beans and milk.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 27 years old, married to Gilbert, and blessed with two children who are ten and three years old.  She has been running a beauty salon for the past seven years.   

She has good credit history with KADET LTD, and after repaying the previous loans successfully, she is applying for her third loan of KES. 50,000.  She hopes to use the loan amount to purchase cosmetics for her salon and buy a new blow drier.

With the anticipated profits she will save and meet her family's needs.  She hopes to grow her business, and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a blow drier and other cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is widowed with 3 adult children. 

Rosenda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 3000PHP to purchase fertilizer for her corn production.  Rosenda has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Rosenda hopes to expand her business and be the supplier to a large corn manufacturer in the country.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn production

loans.name: Roxana Esperanza

texts.es: Roxana Esperanza  vive en casa propia junto a sus queridos hijos y se caracteriza por ser una mujer valiente, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora. Ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos como: ropa, calzado y electrodomésticos. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo los resultados del mismo han sido muy favorables. Últimamente ha notado un incremento en la demanda de sus artículos y muchas veces se queda sin mercadería para ofrecer y esto para Roxana es triste ya que ella siempre le gusta estar al día con su mercadería y siempre tener contentos a sus clientes. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su valioso negocio en la compra de: diferentes estilos de ropa, zapatos y electrodomésticos. De tal manera que pueda lograr abarcar  una mayor demanda de sus productos con el fin de mejorar su nivel de ventas y de  ingresos y por consecuencia mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Roxana Esperanza lives in her own house with her beloved children and describes herself as being a brave, hardworking and above all else enterprising woman. She sells different kinds of articles such as: clothes, shoes and electrical appliances. She has been doing this work for a long time and thanks to God and her hard work the results have been very favourable. Recently she has noticed an increase in demand for her products and she often runs out of merchandise. Roxana is saddened by this as she always likes to be up-to-date with her products and keep her clients happy. This is why she has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in her valauble business by buying: different styles of clothing, shoes and electrical appliances. In this way she can achieve a greater demand for her products, improve her sales and income and so improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and electrical appliances.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.en:
40-year-old Reinerio has been a fisherman for almost 20 years. He is married and has 4 children.  Reinerio owns a fishing boat that he uses to catch fish. He hopes to acquire another fishing boat in the future.

Reinerio has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and crab traps.  Reinerio hopes to continue earning from his business and providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and crab traps

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married man, father of four lovely children. Mohamad has been working in construction for 28 years. He was only 12 years old when he started working, in order to help his family in making a living.
This long experience gives him customers' trust and a wide knowledge in all construction fields.
Mohamad has been with Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for three consecutive loan cycles. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his social and financial situation, and in providing his children a healthier and more educated living. 
His goal is to prevent his children from experiencing the type of childhood he had, because he believes that a child is brought to life in order to be cherished not to be used.
This time, Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools required in his business, since he is involved in all construction fields like plumbing, electricity, painting, and pasting tiles.
He hopes to buy a shop in the future to sell all necessary construction tools.

loans.use: To buy new construction tools necessary for his business

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak was born in Sarigyugh village, in the Ijevan area, in 1966. He is married and has three children. His two daughters are married and live separately from their parents, and his son lives with him and helps him with farming. Arshak’s parents also live with him.  

For a long time Arshak has been engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. On his farm he breeds cows, calves, pigs and chickens. Every summer Arshak transports his farm animals to the mountains for grazing and rents a plot of land where he does hay mowing to accumulate fodder for his farm animals.

During this time he has been able to keep his family, repair his apartment, pay for his elder daughter’s education and organize his daughters’ weddings.

Arshak’s first Kiva loan allowed him to transport his farm animals to the mountains and pay rent for a plot of land. Now he is asking for a 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) loan to buy two more pigs for his farm and also to buy additional fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy two more pigs for his farm and to buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 49 years old, married and has three sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a farmer by profession and works in the field. He works very hard and grows different seasonal crops to earn income for his family. 
Salma operates a dairy business and sells buffalo milk to clients in her community. Besides her business, she also performs her household duties very well.

Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for further expansion of her milk selling business. With the loan she will buy another buffalo that will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk to sell and increase her profits. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that a loan investment will be productive for her and will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a milk selling business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
The primary source of income for the village where Carmelita and her family resides is through rice farming. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She helps her husband manage the rice field. 

Carmelita hopes to improve their farming practices, which is why she is asking for a loan of P30,000 as an additional capital in buying fertilizers and pesticides for her rice seedlings. She is hoping that through the help of this loan shew will increase crop production to increase her profits.

Carmelita aims to continuously provide a good education for her three children. Two of them attend college and one is in high school. She hopes that someday they will live progressively.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and lives in Zamora Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
To earn a living, Rosita sells fish. She earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Rosita has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosita would like to have a fishing boat in order to earn more money because she wants  to send their children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emberg

texts.es: Emberg habita en su propia casa junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y tres hijos. Emberg se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, dedicado y responsable. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al comercio. Él se dedica a la venta de variedad de calzado. En su negocio los clientes pueden encontrar todo lo que buscan relacionado con calzado. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a la ayuda de Dios y a sus esfuerzo a logrado mantenerlo vivo durante estos años. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que se encuentra sobre la carretera principal de la zona donde el habita. Es una zona muy concurrida y visitada sobre todo el negocio de Emberg que siempre se encuentra a la vista. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de variedad de calzado para todas las edades, gustos y preferencias. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Emberg lives in his own house with his family group which is made up of his wife and three children. Emberg is a very hardworking man who is dedicated and responsible. He has been a merchant for a long time. He sells a variety of footwear. In his business his customers can find everything they are looking for related to footwear. He has been in this business for a long time and thanks to God's help and his hard work he has been able to keep it going all of these years. The location of his business is very strategic since it is on the main roadway of the area where he lives. It is a well trafficked and frequented area, especially Emberg's business which is visible. He has decided to ask for this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying a variety of footwear for all ages, tastes and preferences. In this way, he hopes to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of footwear such as: sandals, loafers, tennis shoes, etc.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  He supplies bread and milk to retail shops and hotels to earn a living.  He has two employees in his business.  He also does farming in small-scale.  He is able to provide for his family including educating his three children.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business hence his living standards.  He needs 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike for transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his transport business

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 56 years old and lives in Tubod, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with four children.

Constancia has a general store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Constancia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 months. In the future, Constancia hopes to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is guided him by his favorite quotation, "some people dream of success…while others wake up and work hard at it." That’s how Marlon is living now to succeed in his dream. Marlon dreams to have a stable source of income to give quality living for his family.
Marlon is 39 years old, married, and blessed with five children. His wife is a housekeeper and vends vegetables. Marlon manages his two hectares rice field. His earnings from the business was used to pay for his obligation to the private traders whom he got financial support for farming. 
Marlon doesn’t want to get financial support anymore from the private traders because the interest is costly. He desires to borrow P40,000 to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. The loan will make a big contribution for him to stop getting financial support from the traders. He will do his best to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
Algin is a 27-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband is a fisherman. For the past four years, Algin has run a sari-sari (retail) store where she sells items like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and soap to people in her community. She earns 15,000 PHP per month with her business. Algin also supports her husband by selling his catch at the market.

Algin is requesting a loan to buy both fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice. She hopes to achieve her future goals of sending her children to college and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and items to sell at her store

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 52 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past 11 years, Nilda has sold noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and other items to earn a living. She earns 3,000 PHP each month. Nilda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  

Nilda is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase additional goods such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and other items to sell. In the future, she hopes to finish building a residential house.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia  de 60 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su madre. Ella  se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ha trabajado toda su vida para ganarse el pan de cada día. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar de habitación.  Alicia se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy carismática. Tiene muy buenas referencia de sus clientes ya que para ella lo más importante es tener satisfechos a los clientes por lo que siempre trata de mantener todo tipo de frutas y verduras de tal manera que en el momento que los clientes busquen sus productos los puedan encontrar. Además ofrece un buen servicio, su rostro siempre muestra una sonrisa a la hora de realizar su trabajo. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito  a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de frutas y verduras ( manzanas, guineos, sandía, papas, cebollas, zanahorias, güisquiles, tomates, etc.) con el objetivode mejorar el servicio a los clientes y por consecuencia mejorar el nivel de ventas y de ingresos que permitan  tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alicia is 60 years old and lives in her own house with her mother.  She dedicates herself to selling fruits and vegetables.  She has worked her entire life to earn her daily bread.  The business is located in her home.  Alicia is characterized by being a fighter, a hard worker and for her charisma.  She has very good references from her customers given that, for her, it is of utmost importance to have satisfied clients.  This is why she always tries to maintain all types of fruits and vegetables so that when her customers look for products, they can find what they need.  In addition, she offers an excellent level of service, and always has a smile on her face while carrying out her work.

Her dream is to see her business flourish, which is why she has decided to take out this loan from INTEGRAL to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables (apples, bananas, watermelon, potatoes, onions, carrots, chayote, tomatoes, etc.)  Her goal is to improve her services and, as a result, her sales and income, to allow her access to a higher quality of life.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables such as: apples, bananas, watermelon, potatoes, onions, carrots, chayote, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. She operates a piggery in her backyard and earns approximately 2,500 PHP for this work. Alma has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than a year.   

Alma is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs. In the future, she dreams of having savings for her child’s future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch is 47 and is married with three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian sites. Toch is a farmer and her husband works in road construction. The couple works so hard every day to earn income to help cover the family’s expenses. 

Toch is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to increase its income. This will be her first loan through KREDIT, a longstanding KIVA partner. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is 26 years old and married. Her husband runs a business selling buffalo milk. Mehwish is a housewife and performs her household duties by staying at home. She is very efficient at her work and performs her duties very well. She doesn’t have children yet.

Mehwish is requesting a loan from the KIVA partner Asasah to expand her husband’s milk-selling business. Her husband will buy another buffalo to produce a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits. Mehwish’s husband is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for many years. She is very confident that this loan will improve his business and allow her family to enjoy a better life.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 47 years old and married with 6 children. With two children in school, Ninfa works very hard to provide for her family.

Ninfa runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Ninfa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sardines, oil, spices, and eggs.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell such as soap, sardines, oil, spices, and eggs

loans.name: Keny Edilia

texts.es: Keny Edilia D. 35 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa y a la elaboración y venta D. pupusas. Estos negocios  los tiene ubicados en su hogar D. residencia los cuales le han ayudado por mucho tiempo a colaborar con la economía del hogar.  Tiene mucha  clientela y cada día crece más ya que ella siempre mantiene variedad D. prendas D. vestir. Además   los clientes la prefieren ya que en el mismo lugar los clientes pueden comer deliciosas pupusas preparadas con mucho amor por las manos D. Keny. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para invertir en sus negocios en la compra D. los productos necesarios para poder mantener activo el negocio. El crédito lo piensa invertir en la compra D. variedad D. prendas D. vestir (blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisetas, etc.) y en los insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. pupusas (maíz, arroz, gas propano, queso, chicharon, etc.). Tiene mucha confianza que D. esta manera logrará salir adelante y podrá tener acceso a mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Keny Edilia is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She dedicates herself to selling clothing, and to making and selling pupusas (a stuffed tortilla traditional of her country).  These businesses are located in her home, and have helped her contribute toward the household’s finances for a long time.  She has many customers, and her business grows every day since she carries a large selection of clothing.  In addition, customers prefer her since, at the same location, they can also eat the delicious pupusas prepared by Keny’s own hand with much love.

She has maD. the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her enterprises and buy the necessary products to support them.  She’s thinking about investing the funds into the purchase of a variety of clothing (blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, etc.) and in the ingredients necessary for making the pupusas (corn, rice, propane gas, cheese, sausage, etc.)  She is very confident that, in this manner, she will get ahead and be able to have access to better conditions in life.

loans.use: buy items such as:  blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, corn, rice, propane gas, cheese, sausage, etc.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang, 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. Sang and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses.

Sang is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her son to travel to sell food. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to sell food

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosie is 45 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Rosie has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Rosie requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 59 years old and married.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Thelma has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice business for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 54-year-old married woman with six children. 

Violeta has a fermented shrimps and fish business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her fermented shrimps business.

Violeta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her fermented shrimps.

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 34 years old and lives in Basac, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married and has two children. Emy is engaged in the purchasing of coconut and charcoal to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  

She has requested a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP  to purchase coconuts and charcoal to sell.

Emy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five months.  She hopes to grow her business and to have more customers. She hopes that she will have more savings for her children's future education.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Alicia is a seaweed farmer. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. Alicia also sells fish at her town's market. She plans to use her loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs. She will also buy fishing nets for her husband's fishing.

Alicia hopes to send her children to college, pay her obligations and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, wooden pegs and fishing nets.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Kheng and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Kheng is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase recyclable materials to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials to resell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 42 years old and married with one child.  She works very hard to provide for her family.

Sandra runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her grocery store.

Sandra has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee and more.

In the future, Sandra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a married lady with two children ages 9 and 14.  She runs a grocery to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  Her husband also supports her in the business with financing.  Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to her business because she has learned how to save money and access business loans easily.
Doreen has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to extend her business premise and sell cooked food.

loans.use: To extend her business premise and sell cooked food.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
As a responsible housewife, Pacita finds her way of gaining income. She engaged herself in selling Splash products like lotions, body sprays, whitening creams, soaps and rollons in her community. She has operated this business for almost three years and earns a profits of P9,000 a month. She utilized her income for food, clothing and allowances for her three children. Despite many competitors in the area, she still manages the business. She mentioned that being friendly is the best way to win customers.

She aims to increase her product offerings to meet her customers demand, but due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional of P50,000 to buy additional stocks of splash products like lotions, body sprays, whitening creams and roll ons to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to improveme her business. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continue to manages her business well.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of splash products like lotions, body sprays, whitening creams and rollons to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells sea shells in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Nida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more sea shells to sell.

Nida has been sustaining her business and paid back 16 loans from NWTF.  

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sea shells to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Norberto

texts.es: Nelson Norberto de 34 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su madre. Él se dedica a la venta de diversos productos de manera ambulante en el mercado central de la zona donde el habita.  Los productos que él vende van de acuerdo a la temporada, por lo que no se dedica a vender un producto determinado. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y es su principal fuente de ingresos. El se encarga de llevar el pan de cada día a su casa ya que su madre ya está bastante mayor y no puede realizar un trabajo en el cual pueda recibir un ingreso. Para Nelson su madre lo es todo y es por ella que lucha día con día para poder llevar la comidita que de otra forma no la tendría. Ha decidido solicitar nuevamente un crédito a INTEGRAL ya que la temporada Navideña esta próxima y no quiere perder la oportunidad de hacer sus ventas en esa época. Anteriormente ya tuvo crédito con INTEGRAL y posee buenas referencias crediticias, además está muy agradecido  con la institución  ya que le ha brindado la mano cuando más lo ha necesitado. El crédito lo quiere para invertirlo en productos navideños. Tiene plena confianza que al igual que en el pasado los resultados serán favorables y podrá seguir dando a su madre el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Nelson Norberto is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his mother.  He dedicates himself to selling a variety of products as a traveling salesman at the central market in the zone where he lives.  The types of products he sells are seasonal, which is why he doesn’t specialize in any particular items.  He has dedicated himself to this work for many years, and it is his primary source of income.  He is charged with earning the daily bread for his household, as his mother is now elderly and cannot work to generate income.  For Nelson, his mother is everything, and it is for her that he fights each and every day to provide the food that she would otherwise not have.

He has decided to request another loan from INTEGRAL because Christmas is approaching, and he doesn’t want to miss the opportunity to make his sales during the holiday season.  He has had previous loans with INTEGRAL, and has good credit references.  In addition, he is very grateful to the institution for lending a hand when he has most needed it.  He would like to invest the loan into seasonal Christmas products.  He has all the confidence that, as in the past, the results will be favorable and he will be able to continue providing for his mother on a daily basis.

loans.use: buy a variety of products for the holiday season.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Saem, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known as a pre-Angkorean site. 

Saem sells food.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase groceries to resell at her home. 

By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income.  In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. 

This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 51 years old and married with six children.

Narcisa works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari sari (general) store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her sari sari (general) store.

Narcisa has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari sari (general) store for 15 years and also earns an income from her buy and sell tuna fish business.

Narcisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her sari sari (general) store.

loans.name: Irshaad

texts.en:
Irshaad is 57 years old and married.  Her husband operates a dairy business and has some buffaloes for that purpose. He takes their milk and sells to his community clients every day.  His business is going well and due to good quality milk, its demand is increasing day by day.

Irshaad has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to support her husband.  With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to fulfill the milk requirement of his clients and increase his sales and profits.

He has operated his business for many years and is very hopeful that an investment will help him earning more profits.

Irshaad is a housewife, but in her spare time she provides full support to her husband, by milking the buffaloes and keeping their place clean.

She is also a mother of one son who is unmarried.  He too supports his father's business.

Irshaad is confident about her family's bright financial future.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 24 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Renalyn runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Renalyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as powder, soap, eggs, vinegar, spices, etc.. 

In the future, Renalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and her 3 children are in school.

Rosana has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Rosana has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosana has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she can build a house for her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 46 years old. She lives in Cho town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has two children. She has a general store. She sells groceries. She has had this job for 10 years. 

She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnam dong (VND). This is the 6th time she has had a loan from SEDA. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time she wants to borrow 9.632.000 VND to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things for her general store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things for her general store.

loans.name: Celina Estela

texts.es: Celina Estela D. 46 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y dos hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado dar el estudio a sus hijas que por el momento ya asisten a la Universidad. El sueño D. Celina es ver a sus hijas convertidas en todas unas profesionales.  Celina se dedica a la venta D. productos D. librería. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer una pequeña librería en la cual venD. diversidad D. productos. Tiene mucha clientela ya que en su negocio la amabilidad es lo principal. Tiene muchos años D. dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya posee mucha experiencia.  Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, dedicada y sobre todo responsable. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeña librería en la compra D. diversidad D. artículos como: cuadernos, colores, reglas, papel, tijeras, pega, y D. mas productos que sean atractivos para los clientes. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que pueda lograr su sueño D. aumentar el nivel D. ventas así como el D. ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Celina Estela is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her family, which is comprised of her husband and two daughters who are studying.  With a great deal of effort and dedication, she has managed to proviD. an education for her daughters who are currently at the University.  Celina’s dream is to see her daughters become professionals.  Celina dedicates herself to selling bookstore items.  With hard work, she has managed to establish a small bookstore where she sells a variety of products.  She has many customers since, in her business, friendliness comes first.  She has dedicated herself to this enterprise for many years, which is why she now has a lot of experience.  She is characterized by being a woman who is hard working, dedicated, and, most of all, responsible.

She has maD. the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small bookstore and buy a diverse range of products such as:  notebooks, colored pencils, rulers, paper, scissors, glue, and other products that her customers will find attractive.  She trusts in all mighty God that she will be able to realize her dream of augmenting sales, as well as her income, which will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy items such as:  notebooks, colored pencils, rulers, paper, scissors, glue, etc.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, 38, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Phalla and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family's expenses. Phalla is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a machine that squeezes sugarcane so she can produce sugar palm juice to sell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane squeezer to produce sugarcane juice to sell.

loans.name: Jerecson

texts.en: Jerecson is a young father to two children. He is 20 years old and married. Jerecson is a fisherman and has been engaged in fishing for five years. He earns about 4000 PHP per month from his business. Jerecson works hard to improve his earnings and provide for his family. He has requested this loan to purchase a fishing boat. Jerecson hopes for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 36 years old, a mother of three children. She has owned a tailoring shop in Kilifi for the last 10 years and earns a good income. 

She has good credit history with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her third loan, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She hopes to use the loan to purchase cloth for making dresses and school uniforms. Her clients are mainly from schools around Kilifi.

With the anticipated profits she plans to start a green grocer business and also to meet her family's needs. She desires to grow her business and to own rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for making dresses and school uniforms.

loans.name: Cherry-Ann

texts.en:
Chery-ann's family lives comfortably at the barrio though they are less fortunate. At her young age of 21 she had already been blessed with two children. She only finished high school so Cherry-ann has not able to seek for employment. Cherry-ann helps her husband manage a farming business in the barrio. They had been doing this for almost three years to make a living and earns about P12,000 every harvest season. The harvest season falls during the month of April and November. 

Cherry-ann is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

She hopes to produce plentiful harvest and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is 21 years old and married. He has a 5-month-old baby. Joselito has been a fisherman for two years. He earns 5000 PHP per month. He is able to provide for his family through fishing. Joselito works hard to save for his family's future. He plans to use his loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. This will help improve Joselito's business.

In the future, Joselito hopes to acquire more fishing boats and build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Babie Rose

texts.en:
Babie Rose is 40 years old and single. She's from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Babie Rose owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as canned goods, instant noodles, diapers, and cotton in the local community. Babie Rose has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Babie Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Babie Rose is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
From Kampong Chhnang province, Mrs. Chan, 36, the mother of 4 single children, has been raising pigs for some time. Since she started this business she’s had good results and the income she generated has helped her support her family.

At present, Mrs. Chan wants to request a $500 loan to purchase piglets and feeds that she needs for her pig raising project. She hopes that with this her micro business will grow and generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Borey (pictured here) is a security guard, while his wife, Saren is now a garment worker. Borey and Saren live in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two young children:one son and one daughter. 

The couple had already asked for a loan through Kiva to purchase a new motorbike. Unhappily, the motorbike was stolen, so Borey is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy one more motorbike to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom (in the photo) is 44 years old and her husband Nov is 52 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children-three sons and two daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment worker, another one is a driver and another one sells chinese noodles. 

Sokhom stays at home. Her husband is a construction worker. Sokhom wants to launch a business selling groceries, but she does not have the capital. Hence she decided to request a loan in the amount of $300 to buy grocery items for sale.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado has been managing his rice field for three years. He is 50 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children. Amado’s earning last crop went to his household expenses. Some of the amount was used to pay for the labor costs of farming.

Amado is facing a financial shortage to maintain his rice fields. In this regard, he is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides needed for plant care of rice fields. He knows that his requested loan will help him to maintain his farming business. Amado believes that he can make his business grow. This will allow him to improve his living conditions and save some money for security when he gets weak.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides needed for plant care of rice fields.

loans.name: Luzbe

texts.en:
Luzbe is a 29-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband run a fishing business. Luzbe sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys from other fishermen to have more fish to sell. Luzbe said they earn about 8000 PHP per month from this business.

Luzbe has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell. Luzbe hopes for their business to grow and for their children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and is engaged in buying and selling coconuts in her village. She used to make these coconuts into copra and then sell them at higher prices. Her business runs this way and with the help of her loan amount P13,000, she could buy more coconuts to make a higher profit.

She was blessed with three children but unfortunately her youngest died due to severe enlargement of the heart. One of the reasons why she was not able to survive is their unprivileged living. Teresita was not be able to afford sending her child to the hospital. Teresita feels extremely sad about what happened. This has made her strive harder to avoid not repeating history and also improve her family's living condition. She hopes through her unending patience and hard work, she will be able to lift her family from poor living conditions with of course the help of her husband.

loans.use: buy more coconuts to make a higher profit.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has been unsuccessful in finishing her education because of poverty. Consequently, a 46 year old is not privileged to find a high standard job. Despite that, she thought of a business that would be able to lift her living condition. So Zenaida built her own business where she cooks peanuts and eggs and then packs them into plastic. She also makes coco juice as additional good for sale. Her husband is the one who sell her processed food every day. Her business usually goes this way.

Because she wants to earn a higher income, this has caused her to ask for a loan amount P12,000 to buy peanuts, eggs, plastic cups and coconut. She hopes through this business, they will improve their poor living condition.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, eggs, plastic cups and coconut.

loans.name: Bup

texts.en:
Bup lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She lives with her husband and two children. Bup runs a small food stall in front of her house selling meals to her customers in her local community. She started this business seven years ago. 

Bup intends to expand her business by taking a loan to buy more kinds of food and ingredients to make better meals. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education

loans.use: To buy more kinds of food and ingredients to make better meals.

loans.name: Egrah

texts.en:
Egrah is 25 years old, married, and has three children in school. She sells charcoal to earn a living.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has witnessed a lot of growth in her business. This is because she has been able to access loans to boost her business. Now, she hopes to expand her business and open other outlets for her business.
Egrah has requested for 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu is 57 years old and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with two children. Her husband is retired.

To earn a living, Hieu has a business selling soft drinks from her door. She has run this activity for fifteen years. Hieu would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees is the mother of three children, all of whom are illiterate and stay at home. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is very supportive and receives a good number of orders every month, which earn her a good income.

Her husband sells buffalo milk. He is very fair in his rates and sells high-quality milk to his customers. Due to the good quality of milk he sells, customer demand is increasing, and he needs to buy another buffalo.

Bilqees has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to help her husband with his business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to produce a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits. He is very experienced and has been operating his business for many years. Bilqees is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's milk business.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is a 42-year-old married woman with a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

For the past three years, Chau has been supporting her family by selling fried dough with eggs and other food. Now she plans to buy more food and ingredients for her food stall to increase her income. 

She hopes that this investment will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses. In the future, she hopes to save more money to improve her family's living conditions and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy more food and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Sokoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun and his wife, Pich, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Two of the children are security guards and other five attend school. 

Sokhoeun is a wooden-house builder and a farmer. Pich sells vegetables and she is also a farmer. Sokhoeun is asking for a loan of $500 to continue his farming and buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. He will also use a part of the loan to fill in the land behind his house. There are some tiny ponds behind his house, so he needs to fill it in. 

Photo: Sokhoeun is pictured at his brother’s house.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm and fill in the land behind his house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter a 29 year old man who is married and has two children ages three and seven.  He sells clothes, mainly jean trousers, to earn a living.  He has two years of experience in the business.  Besides this, he does farming for extra income.  Even though he runs his business in a competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good customer care skills.  He thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care. Peter hopes to own a permanent business premise in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy jean trousers.

loans.use: To buy jean trousers to sell.

loans.name: Carpo

texts.en:
Carpo is a 46-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He runs a machine repair shop. Carpo also hauls scrap materials to sell. Carpo earns 10,000 PHP per month from his business. He has requested this loan to buy vulcanizing gums, welding materials, and more scrap to recycle and sell.

In the future, Carpo hopes to expand his business and to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy vulcanizing gums, welding materials, and scrap materials to recycle and sell.

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Ramel is 31 years old, married, with one kid. Ramel describe himself as a kind and hard working person. He is willing to do everything just to provide for the needs of his family. Ramel has been running a rice farming business for 10 years. He has a one hectare rice field. 
To minimize his labor cost, Ramel and his wife are doing some field activities to lessen their expense for farm labor. Because the couple can do some farm activities, they will be to save some of their farming expenses. 
Ramel wants to continue operating his farming business. He is asking for a loan of P40,000 to pay for the labor of land preparation, transplanting and buying seeds to grow. He looks toward to the positive impact of the loan for him, his family, and his crops.

loans.use: to pay for the labor needed for land preparation, transplanting, and buying seeds to grow.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh, 30 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver.

Linh earns a living running a general store at her house, which she has done for three years. Linh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, to stock her general store. She hopes that this investment will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that the loan will help her generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: To purchase products and foods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Chérif  Dié

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié qui a à sa charge ses deux enfants et sa femme.Il exerce le métier de charpentier.Il achéte des troncs d'arbres aux bucherons et fabrique des objets d'art, des mortiers et divers autres outils qu'il vend sur le marché local.Son activité lui permet d'entretenir sa petite famille et de subvenir à ses propres besoins.Il sollicite un prêt de 200000f de l'UIMCEC pour renforcer son fonds de commerce.Il compte acheter avec ce montant 4 troncs d'arbres morts et du vernis.Son ambition est d'exporter ses produits vers les marchés de la sous- région et en occident.
texts.en:
Chérif Dié is a married carpenter with 2 dependent children. He buys tree trunks from woodcutters and makes sculptures, mortarboards and other tools which he then sells at the local market. His income allows him to take care of his little family and cover his own needs.

Chérif Dié is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs from UIMCEC to boost his working capital. He will use the money to buy 4 tree trunks and some varnish. He would eventually like export his products to sub-regional and western markets.

loans.use: to buy 4 tree trunks and some varnish.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years old and engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business in her village. She has spent eight years in this kind of business. She sells biscuits, noodles, candies, and sugar. Through this business, she has been able to send four children to school. Her two youngest stay at home due to naivety about reality. She wants to send them all to school and that is why she is striving hard to earn a higher income. She aims to see her children as degree holders.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan amount P13,000 to buy additional grocery items such as vinegar, cooking oil, powdered milk, and coffee. Hopefully, her sacrifices and patience in striving hard will encourage her children to finish their education and also lift the family out of poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell such as vinegar, cooking oil, powdered milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en:
Sabas is 47 years old, married and blessed with five children. For his family to live, he built up his own business. He has a stand in the market where he sells meat. He has been operating this business for three years. Within these years of operating his business, he has been able to send his five children to school. He knows that as time come along they will need more schooling. 

Now, he is asking a loan amount P15,000 to buy pork, car beef and beef as additional goods to sell in his stand. Through this loan amount, he is expecting to earn a higher profit, which he will use to save for the educational needs of his children. He pursues his business for the sake of the bright future of his children. 

The thought that there are a lot of competitors in the market makes him aggressive and alert to sell. He offers good quality products. This is his advantage and lead against others. Hopefully, he will help his five children finish their education as well as lift his family up from a poor lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pork, car beef and beef as additional goods to sell in his stand.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 30 years old, single, and a college graduate, but she has not been fortunate to find better sources of income like a white collar job due to the current employment crisis. So instead of suffering from the difficulty of life, she has built her own business. She is now earning income from buying and selling rice. She has been in this business five years and is slowly reaching progress. To continue this operation, she is asking for a loan amount P13,000 to buy rice as an additional goods to sell. She hopes with the help of this loan she will be able to earn a higher income to improve her underprivileged living.

loans.use: to buy rice as an additional good to sell.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 41 years old, married with two children. She and her husband have been in the business of silkscreen printing for the last ten years. 

Lan plans to use her loan to buy ink and materials in order to make a better quality and greater quantity of products in preparation for the end of the year, when sales increase.

Through the loan she hopes her income will increase, helping her to improve the family's living conditions and enabling her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy ink and materials for her silkscreening business.

loans.name: Karani

texts.en:
Karani is a 36-year-old father of three children. He is a poultry farmer in Mariakani, who has practiced this farming for the last four years. He has been doing great.

This marks his fifth borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to expand the chicken house and buy additional chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. His clients are majorly from Mombasa and Mariakani hotels.

With the anticipated profits he hopes to repay KADET loans and expand his business. He hopes to have his poultry farm be prosperous and sustainable.

loans.use: to expand the chicken house and buy additional chicks

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s milk selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to serve more clients by getting a larger quantity of milk.
He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years.
Samina is hopeful that the investment will be a productive one for him and will increase his profits.
She is a housewife as well as a working lady, she sews clothes for her neighboring clients which earns her a reasonably good income every month.
She is very supportive, in her spare time she also provides support to her husband and takes care of the cattle.
She is the mother of four children, three of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
She is confident about her husband's business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
This is Filipina, 50, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Lito, a carpenter. She is a mother of eight children, some are married and the remaining ones are still in high school. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide additional income for everyday expenses.  

Filipina buys and sells biscuits and dried fish. What she basically does is buy biscuits in bulk direct from the factory and repackages them in 500 and 1,000 grams. She sells them with a little profit. She sells a variety of biscuits like soda crackers, wafers, and chocolate coated biscuits. The dried fish that she sells comes from Visayas and Mindanao, and most of the dried fish that she sells are Dilis (tiny fish), Danggit (well known dried fish in Cebu) and Salinas. Her regular customers are the office employees of different companies where she regularly delivers her items every payday (15th and 30th of the month). She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Filipina is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 28,000 that will help as additional capital. She will use it to buy additional products she needs for her business. Aside from biscuits and dried fish, she plans to add frozen meat products to her goods. It was her customers who have requested that she deliver frozen meats. Her profits allows her family to enjoy some comforts in life and secure their future.

Filipina dreams of becoming successful in her business and hopes that someday she will be able to purchase a lot as an investment. A harmonious relationship with her husband and a good education and life for their children is her dream for her family. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of biscuits and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sampous

texts.en:
Sampous, age 24, is single. He lives with his widow mother on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sampous is a garment worker. He is asking for a loan of $500 to repair his house, because the house where he lives breaks in some parts. 

Photo: Sampous is not pictured at his home, which is a pagoda.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 29 years old. He is married to and blessed with two children. He is a farmer, and he has been doing this for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds, fertilizers, and to hire manpower to aid in land preparation 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children. His hope and dream is to educate his children. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds, fertilizers, and hire manpower to aid in land preparation

loans.name: Sreysor

texts.en:
Sreysor is 21 years old and her husband, Pav (pictured together) is 23 years old. They have been married since 2009 and have one young son. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sreysor works for a beauty salon, while her husband is an auto repairman. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to assist in her husband’s auto repair business by buying additional spare auto parts.

loans.use: To help get capital for her husband to buy additional auto spare parts.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, aged twelve and one. Divina has had a sari-sari (convenience store) store business for five years. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, eggs, and canned goods to the people in her community. Divina earns 8,000 PHP per month with her business.

Divina has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, and rice. She hopes this loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, and rice

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband lives with her and supports the family by running a cafe and selling mobile phones.

Le earns an income by selling newspapers and magazines. She has done this for 10 years. Le is asking for a loan because she intends to buy a display case from which to sell her papers and related products. She hopes this will enable her to attract additional customers and generate a higher income. She hopes that this will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a display case from which to sell her papers and related products.

loans.name: Harapan 3 Group

texts.en:
Suryati is 39 years old and married with two children. Her children are going to school. She has been selling "nasi uduk" (Indonesian coconut rice) in front of her house for three years. Her husband helps her run this business. The business is going well but she needs more capital to increase the sales volume. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she plans to use this loan to buy more rice and coconut to produce more "nasi uduk". Also she wants to provide more variation of dishes. 

In the future she wants to have a restaurant so she can have a better income to continue giving her children a good education.

Other group members plan to use their loan to sell clothes on credit, sell snacks and sell mobile phone minute refills.

loans.use: to pay for more rice and coconut to produce more "nasi uduk" (Indonesian coconut rice) to sell.

loans.name: Yieng

texts.en:
Yieng and her husband, Pao (pictured together), live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1986 and have five children - one son and four daughters. 

Yieng is a weaver and her husband is a fisherman who raises cows at home. She is requesting a loan of $700 to help get capital for her son to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

Yieng’s son wants to launch a farming business, so she has decided to pay off her previous loan and is asking for another loan.

loans.use: To help get capital that her son needs to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram is 33 and lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi M. city. Her husband makes money by repairing vehicles. 

Tram earns a living running a general store, which she has done for five years. Tram would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soft drinks, instant food and noodles, to stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soft drinks, instant food and noodles, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun (in the photo) is 49 years old and his wife, Sam ol is 42 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have six children--two sons and four daughters. Three of his children attend school. Two are in high school, one is in a university, one is a hair dresser, and the others are still young.
 
Thoeun and his wife are farmers and they also raise pigs at home. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his son, who is in the university, to get to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to get to school.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old and married.  He is a father of a two year old child.  He does welding to earn a livng.  He has been in the business for ten years. Throughout the ten years, he has developed a good relationship with his customers.  This has helped him to retain his customers.  
Since Michael joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and get enough income to educate his children.  He hopes to grow his business so as to generate more income.
He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy metal bars.

loans.use: To buy metal bars.

loans.name: Tieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Tieng is 51 years old and is a villager who has been residing in Kampong Chhnang province. She is the mother of two single children, both of whom are working in a garment factory in the province. 

Tieng earns a livelihood by cultivating rice crops on existing farmland, while her husband works as a construction foreman to support the family. 

Currently, Tieng has been concerned about some funds that she’ll need to purchase necessary things for the funeral of her mother. Therefore, she is asking for help from Kiva’s funders. She is very grateful to those who generously help relieve her worries.

loans.use: to purchase necessary things for the funeral of her mother.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, who is 49 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Enrique, 50, who is a driver. She is a mother of three children: Her eldest has just graduated from college; the second one is still in college; and the youngest is in high school. She keeps herself busy attending to the needs of her family and attending to her business.

Teresita has a car wash. She has three car-wash boys who cater to their numerous customers. Their rate for a car wash depends upon the type of the vehicle. Car owners pay 60 Philippines pesos (Php), Jeepneys are Php 80, and delivery trucks are Php 100–150. Her regular customers are the owners of the vehicles that reside within her community, and some are drivers who regularly pass by their busy area. She also sells different car accessories as additional income. She earns a minimum of 500 Php in sales every day.

Teresita is requesting a loan amounting to 8,000 Php that will serve as additional capital. She will spend it to buy additional car accessories and tires for her business. She believes that different designs of car accessories will definitely help her boost her income. Her profits help her to pay water and electricity bills, and some are saved for future expenditures.  

Teresita dreams of having another car wash in another area. She wants her children to become degree holders. She never fails to attend the fellowship* meeting every week as it inspires her to become a better person by studying the word of God and sharing His goodness with everyone.
  
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of car accessories and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 50 years old and a mother of three children. She operates an M-Pesa shop (mobile phone based money transfer) in Mtopanga, Mombasa. The business that has been in operation for the last three years and is doing well.

This marks Lilian’s second loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to use the money to add float (stored-value credits) to Safaricom M-pesa to enable her to serve more customers and increase her profit. 

With the anticipated profits she wants to expand her M-pesa business to another business location. Lilian hopes to own a several M-pesa shops in and around Mombasa and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to add float (stored-value credits) to her M-pesa shop (mobile phone based money transfer).

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida's husband sells buffalo milk. He is very good in his customer dealings and provides good quality milk to his customers. Sajida provides full support to her husband, milks the buffaloes and keeps their place clean. In addition to supporting her husband's business, she also performs her household duties very well. She is the mother of 3 children, all of them are getting their education at a local school.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to produce more milk and of a good quality.

He has good experience of his business and has been running it for many years. 

Sajida hopes that by purchasing another buffalo he will successfully be able to improve his business and his profits.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. 

Nguyet earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 4 years. Nguyet would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Edlene

texts.en:
This is Edlene, 27, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Hadjie, 34, her business partner. She is the mother of four children, two are in in high school and her twins are both in elementary school. She enjoys being a mother a mother and businesswoman. Her husband helps her manage their business.

Edlene has a barbeque stall business. She buys raw pork, chicken and fish.  She prepares and cooks different barbequed dishes and sells them in her neighborhood, to passers-by, tricycle drivers and other people in her local community.  Her store is located near the street. She earns 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from her business daily.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 that will give her additional capital. She will be using the loan to set up a variety store just next to her barbeque stall business. She believes that the variety store will surely attract her regular customers to buy the commodities they need at home. Selling food and the variety store she believes will let her make more profit that she can save for the future of her children.
  
Edlene hopes that her businesses will grow and she will have more profit that will enable her to send her children to school until they reach college. Her ultimate dream for her children is that they get diplomas.  She hopes and prays that the aspirations and dreams of her children will come true someday.  She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* that helps her to gain more knowledge about the goodness of God to everyone.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  products she needed in starting her variety store business

loans.name: The

texts.en:
The is 57 and lives with her two children and husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a security guard. She earns a living by running a general store from her house. She began this business seven years ago.
