The would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, will help her to improve her family's living conditions, and will enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Eutychus

texts.en:
Eutychus is 50 years old and married with three children ages 20, 25 and 26.  To earn a living he sells spare parts.  He was previously employed before he went into this business.  Even though he runs his business in a competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good reputation.
Eutychus hopes to expand his business into a wholesale business.  He has requested for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy oil filters.

loans.use: To buy oil filters.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Mme Coumba, âgée de 59 ans, mariée, est une femme au foyer très active. Elle habite dans un quartier qui se trouve à 500 m du guichet situé à 70 km de Dakar.
Elle est marchande ambulante et possède une expérience de plus de 30ans; en plus de cela elle adore ce métier.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire un petit voyage en Gambie afin de renforcer son activité de ventes de tissus, chaussures, sacs.
Elle est soutien de famille et avec les bénéfices acquis elle aide dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
texts.en:
Coumba is 59 years old, married and a very active housewife. She lives near a branch of UIMCEC located 70 kms from Dakar. She is a travelling saleswoman with over 30 years of experience and a great love for her job.

Coumba is the family's main breadwinner and uses her income to cover the family's household expenses. She will use this loan to make a business trip to Gambia in order to restock on items like fabric, shoes and bags.

loans.use: to restock on fabric, shoes, bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase earrings and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 54 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is separated and a mother of two children. Her children are both married and have families and businesses of their own. She has kept herself busy in her business. She wants to save money for herself and her grandchildren. 

Juanita owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 650 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items, which will enable her to have more stock. She also plans to make her store a little bit bigger. She believes that this will help her to gain income and profit, as it will definitely attract more customers to buy in her store. It will help her to save more money for the expenses of her grandchildren in school. 

Juanita hopes that her business will continue to grow and sustain her daily expenses. She wants to have more profit in order to help her family more. She hopes that all her grandchildren will be able to finish their studies and have good lives once they settle down. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship*, as the sharing inspires her to be full of joy everyday. She believes that having God as the center of her life helps a lot. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en: Nihad is a 36 years old young man. He is married with two sons and two daughters. He is a taxi driver with low income. Nihad wants to repairs to his taxi such as: painting, changing the engine, changing the tires, etc, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for all of this, so he needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Nihad gets the loan from FATEN, he will be able to make all the necessary repairs his taxi needs, the taxi efficiency will increase, and Nihad will work extra hours to increase and improve his income. All of this will enable Nihad to provide better living conditions for his family. Nihad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize and fish in bulk for the preparation of the food (banku and fish) for sale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working in construction for 16 years, especially in the electricity sector.

He is a hard worker, liked by most of his customers who admire his work a lot and his good personality. Ali is a clever man who works hard to improve his business as much as he can, through updating his tools and machines.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools for his business, in addition to closing his house's porch with special glass curtains to give extra space for his kids to share at home. He has received an Al Majmoua loan before, and it had a positive effect on both his social and financial situations. This time he hopes that through the requested loan, he will be capable of handling big projects requested of him. He also hopes he can provide his family with the best living ever.

loans.use: to buy new and improved tools necessary for his business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica sells saucepasn at Kokoado in Elmina.  She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Veronica has been selling saucepans for 10 years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy saucepans. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a store for her business.

loans.use: to buy saucepans

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 32-year-old mother of one child. She is a proprietor of a salon and beauty shop in Changamwe, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last 11 years and the business is doing well.

This marks Anna’s third loan from KADET to finance her business. With the money she plans to purchase beauty soaps, hair and beauty oil, nail polish, shampoos and hair creams. 

With the anticipated profits, she hopes to expand her business and improve her living standards. Anna hopes to open several outlets of her salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soaps, hair and beauty oil, nail polish, shampoos and hair creams

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is married and has four children. Vida is a baker in Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done for 11 years. Her husband is a teacher. Vida uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their home. 

Vida will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to expand her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 53, she is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is widowed and a mother of six children. By the grace of God, Yolanda has managed to support their daily expenses. 

Yolanda operates a fruit and vegetable stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells green and ripe mangoes, peanuts, coconuts, banana, and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Yolanda dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo forma parte de la familia de fundación paraguaya desde el año 2008, el cual tuvo sus orígenes gracias a que una de las miembros contacto con una de las asesoras y esta le comento de la forma de trabajar de los comités, con lo que ella quedo encantada y decidió organizar a sus amigas y vecinas. Actualmente está integrado por 14 mujeres, y están ya en el noveno ciclo del programa. 
Una de las miembros es la señora Grisel, quien por medio de la venta de prendas de todo tipo ha logrado ayudar a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus miembros. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, sacrificada y muy emprendedora, quien no se cansa de luchar por los suyos, pues no quiere que ellos pasen por privaciones. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, pues se acerca el tiempo del calor y es en esta época donde tiene más pedidos.
texts.en:
This group has been part of the Fundación Paraguaya since the year 2008.  It originated thanks a members’ contact with one of the advisors, who told her about how the committees worked.  She was delighted by the information, and decided to organize her friends and neighbors.  Currently, the group is comprised of 14 women and they are in their ninth cycle of the program.

One of the members is Grisel who, through selling a variety of clothing, has managed to help her family and improve the standard of living of its members.  She defines herself as a woman who is hard working, willing to sacrifice and very entrepreneurial, who never tires of struggling for her own since she doesn’t want them to be in need of anything.

She requests this loan to purchase summer clothing, as the hot season is approaching and it is the time when she has the most demand for her products.

loans.use: buy summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kaitikei

texts.en:
Kaitikei is 32-years-old. He is married and together they have two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twelve years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. He has been a good client, he repaid his previous loan well and this will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells banku and fish at Kokoado in Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works at the Railways. Ekua has been selling banku and fish for 15 years. She assists her husband in order to educate their children. She will use her loan to buy maize and fish in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix who is 47 and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Agitina, a frozen food dealer, and father to their three children. One of is children is already working; one is in college, and the other is in elementary grade. By the grace of God, Felix has managed to support his older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, he is working hard to send his two youngest children to college. 

Felix operates a processed meat store. It is where one can buy processed and frozen meat like hotdogs, ham, and the like, near your home. Felix earns an income by buying processed meat at wholesale prices and selling them by the kilo. Aside from this he also manage their farm. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 206 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 17, 000 loans. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more frozen foods like, hotdogs and ham. He will also buy fertilizers for his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands the business.  

Felix dreams to be able to give all his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He also hopes to have his family and community with him as he continues to serve the Lord Almighty through his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of products needed in his business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a responsible housewife who takes the initiative to help her husband in meeting their children's needs in school, Imelda has found a way that she will help her husband. Imelda is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Imelda’s children are in college and high school level.
Imelda’s husband is a farmer. They plant rice in their village. With the earnings that come from farming, Imelda could send her children to school and could be able to meet the needs of her children in school. Despite the calamity that hits Imelda's crops, she is still continuing her business because she has no other source of income.
Imelda is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy farm inputs needed for farming. She will buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds to grow. She hopes to gain higher income and be able to continue sending her children to school where they pursue their degree.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed for farming.

loans.name: 17 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité 17 de mayo está integrado por 10 mujeres que son todas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de cada una, por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. 
Una de las miembros es la señora Patricia, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, como ser whiskys, vinos, cervezas y demás tipos de bebidas, trabajo gracias al cual puede mantener a sus casas y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. 
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para abastecer su negocio con más variedad de productos, como ser cervezas, vinos, sidras y demás, ya que se acercan las fiestas y es cuando más demandas tiene. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que se le está brindando.
texts.en:
The communal bank "17 de Mayo" consists of 10 women who are friends and neighbours in the city of Caacupé. They got together with the aim of improving conditions for each member, by working all together. They are in the first program cycle for the entrepreneural women of the Fundacion. 

One of the members is Señora Patricia who sells all kinds of drinks such as whisky, wine, beer and other.beverage types. Thanks to this work she is able to maintain her houses and cover the daily living expenses. 

She is asking for the Fundacion's and Kiva's help to stock her business with a wider variety of products such as beer, wine, cider and other beverages as the holiday season is approaching and it is when there is more demand for her products. She is very grateful for the opportunity that is being given her.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, cider and other products.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 2 children. Ekua sells costmetics at Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done for 12 years. Her husband is a business man. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to buld a store for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 41-years-old, married and doesn’t have any children. Her husband has a dairy business while she stays at home and does her household duties. In her spare time she also supports her husband by milking the buffaloes and giving them food.

Her husband has been selling buffalo milk for the past many years. He is very good in his business dealings and provides fresh quality milk to his customers at low rates. Kosar has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah due to the increasing demand for milk by the community customers. Her husband wants to buy another buffalo. This will allow him fulfilling the orders on time and increase his sales and profits.

Koasr is very confident that after the loan investment, her husband will be able to improve his income and she will be able to save some profits for her older age.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
16 integrantes tiene este grupo D. la ciudad D. Caacupé, el cual está integrado por vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, las cuales luchan diariamente por el sustento D. su familia. Son mujeres luchadoras, sacrificadas, quienes ven en el programa D. la fundación una gran oportunidad D. progreso. 
Una D. esas mujeres luchadoras es Norma, quien se dedica a la venta D. joyas, trabajo gracias al cual pueD. crecer como profesional y como persona. Comenta que tiene ya una clientela que siempre prefiere comprar D. ella lo que venD.. Tiene mucha demanda y es por ello que solicita el crédito para poder cumplir con ellas. 
Desea comprar pulseras, anillos, aros, tobilleras y otros tipos D. joyas. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta les fa, pues es muy importante para el crecimiento D. todas.
texts.en: This group in the city of Caacupé consists of 16 women who are neighbours and friends, who struggle on a daily basis to take care of their families,They are determined, self-sacrificing women who see in the Fuindacion's program a great opportunity for progress. One of these determined women is Norma who sells jewelry. Thanks to this work she is able to grow professionally and personally. She says that she already has a clentele that always buys what she sells. Her products are in high demand which is why she is asking for a loan to meet the demand. She wants to buy bracelets, rings, earrings, anklets and other types of jewelry. She is grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity they are giving her as it is very important for the growth of all of them.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, rings, earrings, anklets and other products.

loans.name: Chagan

texts.en:
Chagan is the mother of four children, all of whom left school without completing their educations. Instead, they started working with their father, who has a dairy business and sells buffalo milk. The quality of milk he provides is very good, so he receives a good number of orders every day.

Chagan is 56 years old and supports her husband in his business. She is also a very good housewife and performs her duties very well. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband to buy another buffalo due to the increasing demand for milk from his community clients. By purchasing another buffalo he will be able to fulfill the orders on time and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business, which he has been operating for many years. Chagan is hopeful that a loan will help her husband to earn more profits and improve the lifestyle of their family.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase materials for sewing.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells cloth at Kokoado in Elmina. She is a widow and has seven dependents. She is responsible for caring for her children. Mercy has been selling cloth for 12 years. She will use her loan to buy cloth and materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy cloth and materials.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is married and has six children. Hannah has been selling maize at Kokoado in Elmina for 15 years. Her husband is a pastor. Hannah uses her income to assist her husband in educating their children. She will use the loan to purchase bulk maize. With the new profits, Hannah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bulk maize.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a widow and has four children. Elizabeth sells clothes and materials at Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Elizabeth uses her income for her children’s upkeep. Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase more clothes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete finishing his house.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells maize and cassava at Eguafo, and she has been in this business for 12 years. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. She is responsible for assisting her husband in educating their children. Adjoa will use her loan to buy maize and cassava in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize and cassava in bulk.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 47 years old. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school while the others are helping their father in his business. Her husband operates a dairy business and sells buffalo milk to his community clients at low rates. He has a good relationship with his customers and makes good sales every month.

Zubaida is a housewife. She stays at home to do her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also supports her husband in his business by feeding the cattle and by keeping their quarters clean. Zubaida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy another buffalo to increase his milk production in order to serve more clients and increase his income. He has operated his business for many years, and Zubaida is hopeful that an investment will help him to increase his profitability.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's milk business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua Aya sells eggs, bread, and secondhand clothes at Eguafo, which she has done for the past five years. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She is responsible for assisting her husband in caring for their children. Efua Aya will use her loan to buy eggs and secondhand clothes. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy eggs and secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Mujeres Unidas forma parte D. la fundación desD. el año 2007, está integrado por  20  mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación. Es un grupo que se destaca por trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realizan. 
Una D. las señoras es Olga, quien se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, negocio gracias al cual pueD. sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar en los gastos D. la casa. Ella comenta que tiene buena venta, en especial los fines D. semana, que es cuando la mayoría D. las personas no trabaja y está libre. 
Debido a que le va muy bien, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en du negocio, y es por eso que piD. el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, vinos, licores y demás bebidas con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes, además ya se acercan las fiestas D. fin D. año y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
The committee of women, called Mujeres Unidas, or “United Women” has been part of the foundation since 2007. The committee is composed of 20 women who are working very happily. They are already in their 6th loan cycle. They work together and in solidarity within the foundation’s program for women entrepreneurs. The group stands out for working together and cooperatively. 
 
One of the women is Olga, who sells drinks. Her business allows her to help her family get ahead and contribute to the household expenses. She says that she has good sales, especially on the weekends, which is when most people don’t work and are free. 

Since it’s going really well, she wants to continue investing in the business, which is why she is requesting the loan to purchase beers, wines, liquors, and other drinks, which she will use to meet the demands of her customers. Additionally, the end of the year parties are coming up and she wants to be ready.

loans.use: purchase beer, wine, liquor, and other drinks

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa has been selling pure water at Eguafo for 10 years. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in caring for their children. She will use the loan to purchase more pure water for sale. With the new profits, Adjoa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pure water for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of kernel nuts for producing oils.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is single and has three children. Adjoa sells kernel oil and operates a chop bar in Eguafo, which she has done for 9 years. Adjoa uses her income to care for her children. Adjoa will use this loan to purchase kernel nut and cassava for the preparation of fufu [starchy dumpling made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice that is eaten with soup or stew]. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to educate her children to the college level.

loans.use: to purchase kernel nut and cassava for the preparation of fufu.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju se llama el comité formado por 15 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Luque, quienes se unieron con mucho entusiasmo y ganas D. progresar y salir adelante. Ellas son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, son muy conocidas en el barrio por la unión y el entusiasmo que muestran a la hora D. trabajar. 
La Sra. Maria, está acompañada con el señor Roberto hace más D. 18 años, con el tiene 3 hijos menores que aun van a la escuela. Nos comenta que tiene un copetín, en el cual venD. toda variedad D. alimentos y bebidas, gracias a su trabajo y a la buena atención que le da a sus clientes, ella ya pudo formarse una buena clientela, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos.
Ella quiere seguir en su negocio y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra D. insumos, los cuales utilizará para elaborar los alimentos que venD.. Esos insumos consisten en carne, panificados, verduras, condimentos y demás lo cual le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Koeju is the name of the communal bank which consists of 15 women from the city of Luque. These women came together with a lot of enthusiasm and the desire to progress and get ahead. They are very hardworking and determined. They are well-known in the neighbourhood for their untiy and enthusiasm when it comes time to work.

Sra. Maria has lived with Señor Roberto for more than 18 years. With him, she has 3 children, all  minors, who still attend school. She tells us that she has a small food stall where she sells all kinds of food and drink. Thanks to this work and the good service she provides her clients with, she already has a very good clent base which generates a very good income.

She wants to carry on with the business and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients which she will use to make the food she sells. These ingredients consist of meat, bread, vegetables, seasonings and other products which will a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, vegetables, seasonings and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm fruit for the preparation of the oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Loukiatou

texts.fr:
Loukiatou est une femme de 35 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant. Elle 02 enfants.
Loukiatou prépare et commercialise des jus de fruits et du yaourt depuis 1996. Elle vend à toute personne dans son petit stand sis au premier étage du marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Loukiatou a requis son deuxième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter 02sacs de lait, 02sacs de riz, 01carton de Milo, 01 boîte d’arôme à la vanille. 
Dans les prochaines années, Loukiatou voudrait infiltrer d’autres points de vente et avoir une situation financière imposante.
texts.en:
Loukiatou is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a shopkeeper. She has two children. Loukiatou has been making and selling fruit juices and yogurt since 1996. She sells to everyone in her little stand located on the 1st floor of the Hédzranawoé market. She buys the products in Lomé. 

Loukiatou asked for her second loan with WAGES to buy 2 bags of milk, 2 bags of rice, 1 box of Milo, and 1 bottle of vanilla flavoring. 

In the next few years, Loukiatou would like to start selling in other locations and have an impressive financial status.

loans.use: to buy bags of milk, sugar, and flavoring

loans.name: Harapan 2 Group

texts.en:
Yusriati (wearing the red patterned scarf) is pictured above with her fellow group members. She has been running a general store since 2009 from her house.  Business has been going smoothly and the income has allowed her to help make a better life for her family.  She is 51 years old and her four children are already grown up, with a couple already having married.  

She is now taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to help restock her store by buying things such as rice, sugar, oil and eggs.  In the future she would like to run the general store from an actual shop rather than from inside her home.  She hopes that she can eventually earn enough income and have savings to renovate her home.

Other group members will use their loans to help their businesses which include selling fish and selling snacks.

loans.use: to pay for items such as rice, sugar, oil and eggs to restock her general store.

loans.name: Armonia Group

texts.es:
Este Comité está integrado por 15 mujeres, todas trabajadoras y muy luchadoras; tienen como nombre grupo “Armonía”, todas son amigas y vecinas del barrio. Ellas hacen reuniones cada cierto tiempo para que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas sueñan con tener sus negocios creciendo cada vez más, y por ello trabajan arduamente para cumplir con sus objetivos. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca, quien gracias a la venta de carbón que hace, puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa. Este ha sido su medio de subsistencia y de ayuda para con sus familiares. Comenta que tiene beuna venta, pues el carbón ultimente ha sido el medio más utilizado para elaborar los alimentos. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más carbón, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más stock para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is composed of 15 women, all fighters and hard workers. The name of their group is Armonia, or “Harmony.” They are all friends and neighbors in the same neighborhood. They have regular meetings so that through working together, they can help one another. Their dream is to see their businesses continue to grow. They work arduously to achieve that goal. 

One of the members is Ms. Blanca who, thanks to selling charcoal, can help her family with the household expenses. This has been her means of subsistence and of helping out her family. She says that she has good sales since lately charcoal has been the most common way to cook food. 

She is requesting for the loan to purchase more charcoal so she can be well stocked and have more charcoal to provide to her clients.

loans.use: purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase rubber bowls

loans.name: Rostom

texts.en:
Rostom is from Khelvachauri district, West Georgia. He is 42 years old and is married. He lives with his family: his wife Nana, his 76-year-old mother, and 3 sons aged 11, 10, and 5 years old. The elder children go to school. Rostom leads the family's agricultural activities, which are their main source of income. Nana works as a saleswoman in a store in a nearby town.

Rostom raises fruits and vegetables on the family-owned 0.3 hectare farm. He sells the harvest to retailers on the local market. He also runs a beekeeping business. The family currently has 30 beehives with bee colonies. They harvest honey twice a year, which Rostom sells on the same market. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Georgian laris (GEL), including the pension of Rostom’s mother.

Rostom has requested a loan to expand the beekeeping business. He will purchase additional beehives with bee colonies. He will also use a small portion of the loan to purchase sugar to feed the bees in the winter months. As a result of the loan, the family will have more honey for sale and thus more income to meet the family's needs and improve their living conditions, especially those of the children.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and bee colonies

loans.name: Thérése

texts.fr:
Thérèse est une femme âgé(e) de 44ans. Elle est épouse d’un architecte. Elle a 06enfants.
Thérèse travaille comme revendeuse de haricot  depuis 11 ans. Elle vend à toutes sortes de client qui s’approchent de son étalage. Elle achète les produits au marché local. Deux personnes l'aident dans l'exercice de son activité.
Thérèse a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter 100litres de palme, 04bidons d’huile d’arachide et 06sacs de haricots. 
Dans les prochaines années, Thérèse voudrait renforcer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer le bien-être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a 44-year-old woman. She is married to an architect and has six children.
Thérèse has worked as a retailer of beans for 11 years. She sells to all types of customers, who come to her stand located behind the Bè-Adido catholic church. She buys her products at the local market. Two people help her in running her business.
Thérèse has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy 100 litres of palm oil, four cans of peanut oil, and six bags of beans.
In the coming years, Thérèse would like to strengthen her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to ensure the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peanut oil, and beans.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña katupyry se llama el comité integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de encarnación, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, cuyo objetivo principal es la ayuda a sus hijos y familiares. Quieren un futuro mejor para ellos y es por eso que se esfuerzan al máximo. 
Una de ellas es la señora Nancy, quien  es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella trabaja como peluquera hace ya un buen tiempo. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa y de esa forma puede sentirse útil. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tijeras, peines, tintes, esmalte para uñas y otros insumos, los cuales son indispensables para su trabajo. Está muy agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues la ayuda es muy importante.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry communal bank is comprised of ten women from the city of Encarnación.  They are hard-working and tenacious women whose main objective is to help their children and their relatives.  They want a better future for them, and that is why they put forth their maximum efforts.

Nancy is one of the members.  She is single and has no children.  She has worked as a hairdresser for some time now.  Thanks to this work she is able to help with the household expenses.  That way she is able to feel useful.

She is requesting the loan to buy scissors, combs, dyes, nail polish, and other supplies that are indispensable for her work.

She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving her.  This help is very important.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs, dyes, nail polish, and other supplies.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is a 48-year-old farmer from the village of Ukaneti, in the Imereti region of West Georgia. He lives with his big family: his wife Lile, his 23-year-old son, his daughter-in-law, his 3-year-old granddaughter, and his retired parents. All of the adult family members are involved in farming, which is their main source of income. In particular, the family grows vegetables on a family-owned, 0.2-hectare plot of agricultural land. They also have a greenhouse, which is in use year-round. From October–May, the greenhouse is used to grow greens, and in the summer months to grow tomatoes and cucumbers. Akaki sells the harvest himself, on the local open market. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Georgian laris (GEL), including the pensions of Akaki’s parents.

Akaki requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for the greenhouse. After fertilizing the land, he can count on a larger and better harvest during the coming year, which will enhance the family's income. Akaki plans to reinvest the increased income in the family farm in order to make it more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his greenhouse

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is a joiner. He has a small workshop in the village of Ivandidi in the Imereti Region of West Georgia, where he lives with his big family: his wife Tsiala, their 34-year-old daughter, their son-in-law, and their two grandchildren, an eight-year-old boy and a one-year-old girl. Akaki studied joinery 20 years ago, and since then it has been the main source of income for him and his family. In his workshop, Akaki produces wooden doors and windows on order. His average monthly income is 800 laris. He loves his work and his workshop. Akaki’s son-in-law works as a night watchman for a local company. Tsiala and her daughter are housewives.
 
Akaki has requested a loan to purchase wooden raw materials. He will use the raw materials to complete orders from customers in Ivandidi and nearby villages. As usual, his profits will be used to satisfy the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for his joiner's workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Itatí Group

texts.es:
Virgen D. Itati es el grupo integrado por 21 mujeres, todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras. Ellas día a día trabajan por salir adelante y D. esa forma ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
La señora Miguelina es una D. las miembros, quien se dedica a la costura, trabajo con el cual mantiene a su familia y a todos quienes D. ella dependen. Comenta que siempre tiene muchos pedidos y trabajo, por lo que le va muy bien, su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y tener un gran taller D. costura donD. pueda emplear a otras personas. 
Ella solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y D. Kiva, para la compra D. telas, hilos, agujas y demás insumos necesarios para su taller, lo cual le será D. mucha ayuda para cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. Itati communal bank is comprised of 21 women.  All of them are hard-working and tenacious women.  They work day to day to get ahead in order to help their children and their relatives.  They want a better future for them, and that is why they put forth their maximum efforts.

Miguelina is one of the members.  She is a seamstress, and this work supports her family and everyone who is dependent upon her.

She says that she always has a lot of orders and work.  Therefore it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to be able to continue growing and to have a large seamstress shop where she would be able to employ other people.

She is requesting the help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other needed supplies for her workshop.  The loan will be a big help in completing her orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 37-year-old father of four children. He is a proprietor of a bicycle repair shop in Buguta, Voi, that has been in operation for the last nine years. The business is doing well.

Jackson has requested a second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the money, he plans to purchase spare bicycle parts to make his business a one-stop shop for repairs and spares.

With the anticipated profits, he will expand his business and educate his children. Jackson hopes to purchase a commercial plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 31-year-old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is dealing in cocoa buying and selling and wants more capital to invest into his business. He is faced with hardships such as price fluctuations, the high costs of transport and bad weather. His dream is educate his children to the university level and build a permanent house. Godfrey wants money to buy cocoa to sell In order to gain the confidence of the client, the loans officer who is putting on a blue jacket had to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from Tskaltubo District, West Georgia. He is unmarried and lives with his family including his elder brother Avtandil, his sister in law, his nephew, the wife of the nephew and their four-year-old daughter. 

The main source of the income for the family is two greenhouses owned by the family. The greenhouses are busy during the whole year. In the period of October – May, it is used for greens growing and in summer months, it is used for cucumber and tomato growing. David and Avtandil sell harvested greens to the wholesaler exporters locally, as tomatoes and cucumbers are sold by David at the local open market. 

David requested credit to purchase fertilizers for the greenhouse. After fertilizing the land, he can count on more and better harvest during the coming year. It will positively influence the income of the family. David and Avtandil will use the received profit for purchasing additional household goods, in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old dairy farmer. She is a single mother of one and a grandmother of two orphan children. She has been in dairy rearing as the primary business and poultry rearing as the secondary for the past 12 years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her seventh loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy animal feeds and poultry feeds. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her grandchildren. Her hope and dream is go open a butchery shop, which will cater to her grandchildren’s needs.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a hardworking man living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He is 49 years old and married with 10 children. For 10 years he has been dealing in local gin, commonly known as waragi. He started by buying one jerrycan, but now he sells up to 50 jerrycans of gin per month. In the future, he hopes to buy his own lorry for transporting the gin instead of having to hire one. He intends to use the loan to buy local gin to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy local gin to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new phones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme  de 31ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de friperie. Elle a 02 enfants.
Ablavi travaille comme couturière depuis 03ans. Elle fait la couture, les plinthes et les merceries à toute personne désireuse dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Ablavi a requis son deuxième cycle de prêt  à WAGES afin d’acheter une machine à plinthe, 01carton de fermeture, 10 douzaine de fil à plinthe, 06 rouleaux de popelines, 02cartons de boutons puis de divers matériels de couture. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait pérenniser son activité.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer of second-hand clothing. She has two children.
Ablave has worked as a dressmaker for three years. She makes clothing, skirting, and haberdashery articles for anyone who wants them at her store. She buys her products in Lomé.
Ablavi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy a "plinthe" sewing machine, one box of closures, ten dozen sets of plinthe thread, six rolls of poplin, two boxes of buttons, and various other sewing materials. She wants to reinvest her supplementary profits in her business.
In the coming years, Ablavi would like to perpetuate her business.

loans.use: To buy equipment, a seam closing machine, and poplin.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara Akhmadova is a 51 years old cattle breeder who sells milk and milk products.  She is IDP. She has more than 20 years of experience in this field. Milk and dairy products are in high demand among Azerbaijani people and they use them in everyday cuisine. Sara is married and has two sons.  Her monthly income is 200 AZN.  This is the only financial source for her family. She applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase one milkier cow and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and an enterprising businessman. His wife Mary is a farmer. The couple is blessed with two children. Samuel's primary business is charging batteries. He has also had a barber shop for the past six years. His monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan shilings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Samuel is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by a staff member. He will use the loan to buy a shaving machine for his barber shop and a solar panel for his charging business.

He plans to use the anticipated profit from the two businesses to boost his wife’s business. His hope and dream is to buy a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine for his barber shop and a solar panel for his charging business

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is a 42-year-old married man and father of four lovely children. He has been working in electronics repair for 23 years. He is an expert in his field, and most of his customers admire his good personality and his talent.

Farid is a talented man with a good reputation. His work is commended by most of his clients, so he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new, up-to-date tools for his business. He also hopes to improve his family's standard of living and to expand his house to fit his family in a very good way.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence wants a loan to buy beer and soft drinks for her bar. She has been in this business for 10 years. Florence lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow charged with the sole responsibility of taking care of her six children. She desires to educate her children and buy a car for transport. She dreams of moving her business to a permanent location and buying land to raise crops.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks for her bar.

loans.name: Lonkisa

texts.en:
Lonkisa is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. He has been a good client for KADET. With this loan, his third, he plans to buy wheat seeds, chemicals and fertilizer. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

Lonkisa's hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is an industrious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “La Esperanza” está integrado por 21 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, actualmente están  en el Cuarto Ciclo. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas  y responsables, tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, pues no temen a ningún desafío. 
Una D. ellas es la señora Nancy, ella se dedica a la venta D. joyas D. todo tipo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, tanto hombres como mujeres, lo cual le trae buenos ingresos.  Ella comenta que por medio D. este trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, unos D. sus sueños es poder tener una joyería bien abastecida donD. pueda tener todo tipo D. joyas, lo cual le permitirá atraer a más clientes. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cadenas, anillos, pulseras, aros y otro tipo D. joyas, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad D. joyas. Gracias a la oportunidad que le da kiva y la fundación, ella se encuentra a un paso más D. cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
The committee called La Esperanza, or “Hope,” is composed of 21 hardworking, enterprising women. They are currently in their fourth cycle. This group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united and responsible. They have a great entrepreneurial spirit. They are not afraid of any challenges. 

One of the members is Nancy. She sells all kinds of jewelry. She says that she has a lot of customers, as many men as women, which brings her a good income. She says that through this work, she has been able to get ahead and help her family. One of her dreams is to have a well stocked jewelry store where she can have all kinds of jewelry, which would allow her to attract more customers. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase rings, bracelets, chains, earrings, and other kinds of jewelry that she will use to offer a greater selection of jewelry. Thanks to the opportunity provided to her by Kiva and the foundation, she finds herself a step closer to realizing her dreams.

loans.use: Purchase rings, bracelets, chains, earrings, and more

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Christine est une femme  âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée à un maçon. Elle a 02enfants.
Christine travaille comme revendeuse de produit d’alimentation générale (boîte de conserve, spaghetti, détergents…) depuis 2005. Elle vend à toute personne dans sa boutique sise non loin de l’église Catholique. Elle achète les produits au grand marché d’Adawlato à Lomé. Christine a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 04cartons de lait Peak, 01carton de détergent et 01carton de spaghetti. Les profits supplémentaires serviront au renforcement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Christine voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’investir dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Christine is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a mason and has two children.
Christine has worked as a retailer of general food products (canned goods, spaghetti, detergents, etc.) since 2005. She sells to all types of customers at her store located not far from the Catholic church. She buys her products at the Adawlato grand market in Lomé. Christine has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy four cartons of 'Peak' milk, one carton of detergent, and one carton of spaghetti. The supplementary profits will serve to strengthen her business.
In the coming years, Christine would like to enlarge her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is from the village of Partskhanakanebi in West Georgia. He is 35 years old, married and lives with his family – his wife Khatuna, their 7 year-old daughter and 6 year-old son. The children go to the village school. 

The main source of income for the family is 2 greenhouses, with a total area of 600 square meters. The greenhouses are busy during the whole year. lIn the fall, winter and spring, greens are grown there.  In summer months, the greenhouses are used for tomato and cucumber growing. Gocha sells the harvested products himself on the local wholesale market.  The family also has a milk cow and 2 calves. Khatuna produces cheese and Gocha sells it on the same market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Gocha also has a wood framework for a third greenhouse. With the requested loan, he will purchase polyethylene to cover the construction and in December he will launch the third greenhouse. The family will harvest 50% more greengrocery products, which will significantly increase the income of the family. Gocha and Khatuna will be able to purchase additional household goods, as well as new books and toys for their children, in order to make their lives happier.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene to cover the greenhouse construction

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a 28 year-old man living in Masindi,Uganda. He operates a butcher shop.  He started with one cow which he bought with his salary savings; now, he can sell three cows in a week.  Theft, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital hinder his business. He hopes to enhance his education and acquire a ranch. Innocent wants a loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Khocharoy

texts.ru: Хочарой проживает в районе Яван. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У них шестеро детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Хочарой занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом пшеницы. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 11 лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Khocharoy lives in the Yavan district.  She is 51 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Khocharoy is involved in growing vegetables and planting wheat.  She has been in this business for 11 years.  She is requesting this loan to sow wheat.

loans.use: to sow wheat

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en: Ramathan wants a loan to buy more cows for resale. He operates  a butcher shop in Masindi, Uganda.  Limited capital is his challenge.  His desire is to educate his children and expand his business into new areas. He is a 37 year-old single father with four children.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Sitara

texts.en: Sitara is a 52 year old woman who breeds cattle and sells them for meat products and also milk and dairy products.  Sitara is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and four children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She has eight cattle including three cows. Her monthly profit from this business is 200 AZN. She applied for 1000 AZN to purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and one calf

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob wants a loan to buy films and pay rent. He runs a video library and has been in business for three years. His desire is build a permanent home and expand his business into new areas. However, inconsistency in electricity supply hinders his business.

loans.use: to buy films and pay rent

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 46 años, está casada, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores y cada uno ya cuenta con una profesión y una vida ya hecha. 
María se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras en general, trabajo gracias al cual ella logra mantener a su familia y darles lo mínimo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. 
Comenta que su marido la ayuda D. la Argentina, donD. el tuvo que irse a vivir por las duras condiciones que había en el país. Ella dice que tiene buena clientela, ya que siempre ha tenido buenos productos, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra D. más frutas y verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes. 
Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que se le está brindando, pues le será D. mucha ayuda en su microempresa.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old, married, and has two adult children with their own careers and on their own.

María sells fruits and vegetables, a job which thankfully allows her to support her family and proviD. what they need to have a dignified and respectful life.

She says that her husband helps her from Argentina, where he had to go because of the difficult conditions in [the economy of] her country.  She says that she has good customers because she has always sold good quality products.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her business and meet her customer demand.

She is grateful for the opportunity given to her and it will be of great help to her small business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 32 years old. He lives in a small village in the Imereti region in West Georgia. Levan married a short time ago and lives with his wife Natela and his parents. Levan works as a tractor driver. He tills agricultural plots in the village and performs various agricultural works with his tractor as a source of  income. Natela is pregnant and in a month she is expecting a baby. 

Levan requested a loan to purchase wood for heating the oven, in order to keep house warm for the newborn. Also, part of the loan will be used to purchase a bed and some hygiene supplies for the baby. Levan says he will work hard to create good living conditions for his family and will do his best to be a good father.

loans.use: to purchase wood for heating the oven, a bed and some hygiene goods for a newborn.

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh is 41 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his retired mother, jobless wife and young son, who studies at school.

Mushegh has re-equipped one room of his house into a workshop where he engages in jeweler’s art. He sells the jewelry he produces to a jeweler’s shop and he also he fulfills private orders. Mushegh has run his business for more than 10 years and thus he provides for his family. During this period he was able to buy all necessary equipment for his occupation. Mushegh does his work very neatly and thanks to that he has a lot of regular customers. 
 
This is Mushegh’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a loan of 700,000 AMD to buy necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Nigbéri

texts.fr:
Nigbéri est une femme de 24ans. Elle est mariée à un policier. Elle a 01 enfant.
Nigbéri travaille comme revendeuse de prêt à porter depuis 2005. Elle a son lieu de vente dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Nigbéri a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter 30 pièces de porte monnaie, 15pièces de pantalon et 15pièces de T-shirt.
Dans les prochaines années, Nigbéri voudrait ouvrir une boutique de référence dans sa région.
texts.en:
Nigbéri is a 24-year-old woman. She is married to a policeman and has one child.
Nigbéri has worked as a ready-to-wear clothing retailer since 2005. She makes her sales at the local market across from the women who sell jewelry. She buys her products in Lomé.
Nigbéri has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy 30 sets of purses, 15 sets of pants, and 15 sets of T-shirts.
In the coming years, Nigbéri would like to open a reference shop in her area.

loans.use: To buy pants, T-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en: Vuqar KH. is 39 years old and has been engaged in the cattle breeding business and milk sales. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is married and has two daughters. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field. His wife actively helps him run the business.  His monthly income is 250 AZN. Vuqar is successful because the product he sells is very popular and in the high demand. People in Azerbaijan use milk and meat in everyday cuisine. He would like to expand his business and for this purpose he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan. He will use the loan to purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement used his previous loan well, as he bought additional stock of spare parts. His  business has actually improved and his monthly income is KES 13,000.

He is applying for a second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Clement will use the loan to buy more spare auto parts for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Clement will expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to buy a commercial plot that will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To add a stock of spare parts to his business inventory.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señorita Veronica es soltera. Es comerciante con 3 años de experiencia en el rubro, cuenta con una verdulería que está ubicado en el predio del mercado Municipal de la comunidad de Curuguaty. 
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada, con ganas de superación, trabaja desde muy temprano en su negocio, ya que se va en busca de productos muy frescos. Quiere poder creciendo en du negocio, es por eso que solicite el crédito para la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, cebolla, locotes, papas y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. 
Una de sus metas es tener un negocio bien amplio donde pueda tener un lugar en el cual ofrecer la variedad de productos que tiene.
texts.en:
Señorita Veronica is single. She has three years’ experience running a fruit and vegetable store in the municipal market of the community of Curuguaty. She is a hardworking person, keen to overcome any difficulties. She starts work very early since she has to find fresh produce  for her store.

Veronica wants to expand her business so she is seeking a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, and potatoes to stock her store and respond to her customers’ requests. One of her goals is to have a spacious store where she can display all the produce.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, and potatoes etc.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 43-year-old married man and father of six children. He has owned a van since 2006.  He uses the van to make his living.  Husein transports people to and from business and work as well as touring all through Lebanon.

His business is doing fine but his van is getting old, that's why he requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.  This is Husein's second cycle as an Al Mjamoua borrower.  His previous loan was very effective and he hopes this one will help in changing the old engine to a newer one that is capable of handling all the different geographical terrains within Lebanon. 

Husein hopes to improve his only source of living to keep on providing a good and healthy living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his van.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El sr. Carmelo está, casado. Es de profesión Fotógrafo. Nos comenta que lleva en el negocio alrededor de 20 años, es uno de los fotógrafos pioneros de la comunidad de Curuguaty. 
Actualmente está actualizando su taller de fotografía  por lo que ya cuenta con maquinas digitales con lo cual facilita todo tipo de trabajo, pues lo que antes le llevaba algunas horas, ahora es todo cuestión de minutos.
El señor solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas, lo cual le son para elaborar marcos para encuadrar las fotos que saca. El está muy contento por esta oportunidad que se le está brindando, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Carmelo is married. He is a photographer and has run his business for about twenty years. He was one of the first photographers in the community of Curuguaty. He is currently in the process of updating his studio with digital cameras which will enable him to take on all kinds of projects. What used to take him hours, now only takes minutes.

Carmelo is seeking a loan to buy wood to make frames for his photos. He is very happy to have this opportunity which will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy wood to make photograph frames

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 72 years old and he runs a dairy farming business. He has had the business for the past ten years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family.  He is married to Lucy, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with nine children.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will boost the farming business for his wife. His hopes and dreams are to open a milk bar.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy old clothes

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells cocked rice and stew at Eguafo. She is married and has three children  Her husband is a farmer. Abena has been selling cocked rice and stew for the last five years. She is responsible for caring for her children. She will use her loan to buy rice and fish in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and fish in bulk

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en:
Kevina is 38 years old, married and a mother of five children living in Karuguuza, Uganda. She has no other dependents and lives with seven family members. Her family goal is to educate her children up to university.

For the past 15 years, she has been operating a retail shop. She faces the challenge of customers who don't pay her back after buying on credit, however she is optimistic that her business will grow and start dealing in wholesale. Kevina intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is married and blessed with three children and two of them are in school. She has been running a retail shop for the last ten years to support her family. She also does farming to increase her income. Dorothy has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She has employed two people to assist in the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is a 44 year old woman who has been selling and breeding sheep for the last 20 years. She is an IDP (internally displaced person). Arzu buys lambs, raises them, and fattens and resells them for a profitable price within 6-7 months. Arzu usually sells sheep in the central bazaar.  She is married and has three children. Her husband actively helps her to run this business. Her monthly income is 200 AZN, but this is not enough to cover the needs of her beloved children. Arzu applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Liela

texts.en: Liela is a married woman with five sons and two daughters. She is a Web Page designer and wants to purchase a new laptop for business purposes to increase and improve her income. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the laptop, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Liela gets the loan, she will be able to purchase the new laptop and improve her work and increase her income. This will help her provide better living conditions for the family. Liela is a conservative woman, so her son who is 18 years old is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase new a laptop for business purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Gregoria tiene 51 años D. edad, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, quienes son todos ya mayores e independientes.
La Sra. Gregoria tiene una despensa en su casa, hace 13 años aproximadamente. Comenta que se inicio con ventas ambulantes D. productos D. primera necesidad en su barrio, luego con un pequeño ahorro inicio un kiosco y D. a poco lo convirtió en una despensa. En la actualidad ya tiene una clientela formada y ofrece variedad D. productos a todos sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. productos tales como tales como azúcar, yerba, arroz, fideos, cárnicos, panificados y bebidas en general. Está agradecida a Fundación paraguaya y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
51-year old Sra. Gregoria is single and has three children who are now adults and live away from home. She has run a small store out of her home for thirteen years. She started out selling basic necessities in the streets of her neighbourhood, and then used her savings to buy a stall, which later became a store. She now has a regular clientele and sells a variety of products.

Gregoria is seeking a loan to buy items such as sugar, tea, rice, pasta, meat, baked goods, and drinks. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea, rice, pasta, meat, baked goods, and drinks

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana  sells banku at Eguafo. She is a widow and has 6 dependents.  Nana has been selling banku for 15 years. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to buy bulk maize for the preparation of the banku . She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bulk maize for the preparation of the banku

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 60 years old and a mixed crop farmer who is married to Gabriel. They are blessed with four adult children. 

She has been in the farming business as the primary business and fish rearing as the secondary business for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Esther will use the loan to buy fish food and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand the fishpond. Her hopes and dreams are to buy commercial land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fish food and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sausages for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty sells banku at Eguafo. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is in security. Aunty has been selling banku for 10 years. She assists her husband in providing for their family. She will use her loan to buy maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lydia Wairimu

texts.en: Lydiah Wairimu, 39 years old, is single and has two children. She has been selling clothes to businesswomen for the last fifteen years. Her business is faced with the problem of high prices of the materials, which she imports from the neighboring country, Uganda.  She wants a loan of Kshs.25,000 to buy more materials.  Lydiah sees herself in five years operating a boutique and being a wholesaler.  She describes herself as a determined, obedient, trustworthy and God-fearing person.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji is a 22-year-old hardworking father of 1 child living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been a farmer for 8 years and he faces the challenges of seasonal weather changes and high transportation costs for bringing his produce to the markets. 

His goal is to buy a motorcycle for a transport business in order to diversify his business risks. Siraji needs a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Arnaldo tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Delia hace 26 años, tienen ocho hijos: Andrés, Lida, Griselda, Karina, Hugo, Ronaldo, Iván, Juan, todos viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace más de 7 años.
El Sr. Arnaldo se dedica a la serigrafía hace 5 años. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque tiene muchos hijos y tuvo que criarlos a todos gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su señora,. Su sueño es comprar más maquinarias para trabajar y así progresar cada día mas. Está muy contento por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, pues la ayuda es muy importante para el.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, pinturas y remeras para hacer las impresiones, pues de esa forma va a cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 44 years old and has been married to Delia for 26 years.  They have eight children: Andrés, Lida, Griselda, Karina, Hugo, Ronaldo, Iván, Juan and all have been living in the city of Coronel Oviedo for the past seven years.

Arnaldo has been doing silk screening for the past five years and says that his work requires a lot of sacrifice because he has many children and he raised them through his and his wife’s hard work.  His dream is to buy more machines so that he can work and get ahead more each day.  He is happy about the opportunity he has gotten through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  The assistance is very important to him.

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy fabric, paints, and t-shirts to make the screenings.  In this way he can satisfy his customers.

loans.use: Comprar telas, pinturas, remeras para impresiones.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih is a 48-year-old married man and father of eight children. This big family needs a lot of care and high income to cover their expenses. Nazih works in doing necessary maintenance to all types of cars but has specialized in changing fuel oil and lubricants for 30 years.

Nazih is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start a new business that will help in increasing his income and in covering his family's requests. He will open a Hookah shop and he will let his son manage it. He believes that his son is big enough to take the responsibility of improving and expanding such a business.

This is his second experience with Al Majmoua and he is a good standing borrower. He hopes to expand both businesses in the future as much as he can.

loans.use: To open a hookah shop

loans.name: Hannah Wambui

texts.en: Hannah Wambui is 38 years old and married with three children. She has been selling charcoal for the last five years. The business is faced with the problem of the rainy season, which makes it hard for her to get charcoal from the forest, as vehicles can't enter there due to the poor road network. She wants a loan of KSHS 50,000 to add more stock of charcoal. Hannah describes herself as a God-fearing person and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has four children.  Abena operates a chop bar (where African dishes are sold) at Eguafo, which she has done forseven years. Her husband is a machine operator. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in caring for their children. Abena will use the loan to purchase foodstuffs for her dishes. With the new profits, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 25 years old and single. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past seven months. His monthly income is 8,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to meet his basic needs. He is applying for his fifth loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. John will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his farm. His hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming to support his future family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Tülay

texts.en:
Tülay is 36 years old and married with no children. She joined a Maya business development training meeting about a year and half ago. After the meeting she asked herself, "What can I do for myself?" She spent about 6 months researching and then applied to Maya for individual credit. With the credit she received, she rented a little shop where she sells bulk wholesale and retail cleaning supplies as well as some household brand name supplies, hygienic products and gift items. Most of her clients are housewives. She has been operating her shop for one year. She says the first 6 months were very hard and she didn’t make much money. She was new to the neighborhood and the neighborhood was slow to start doing business with her. They wanted to see what kind of person she is, if her business was solid or would she be gone in 6 months, and what kind of prices she had before they would do business with her. 

Tülay did not ask her husband for support to start her business and, in turn, he wasn’t very supportive. He kept saying and thinking that she wasn’t going to succeed. She wanted to show him she could succeed and after 6 months her business started making money and she paid off her first loan early. Tülay says that to show him she could succeed from her own efforts was very satisfying. She wants to grow her business but did some additional research before taking out her second loan with Maya and her first on Kiva.

From the market research she has done, she will make agreements with two companies in order to buy bulk wholesale cleaning products from them. This is why she needs capital and how she will use her loan. She believes that by working with these two companies she can increase her profits. In the future, she wants to transition her business focus from retail sales to wholesale and expand the types of cleaning products she offers to customers.
