For example, instead of only selling household cleaning products to housewives, she would like to offer cleaning products for industrial workplaces, such as factories, restaurants, and car dealerships. Tülay is ambitious but plans her business in small steps after careful research.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Tülay 36 yaşında evli ve çocuğu yok.

Maya’nın eğitim toplantısına katıldı.  Kendi adına ne yapabilirim dedi.Önce 6 ay araştırma yaptı ve bireysel kredi için Maya’ya başvurdu.  Kredi ile küçük bir dükkan kiraladı ,burada toptan perakende satışı ve temizlik malzemeleri,çocuk bezleri,kadın pedleri ve hediyelik eşyalar satmaya başladı.Müşterilerinin çoğu ev hanımıydı.  Dükkanını 1 yıldır işletiyor.  İlk altı ayın çok zor olduğunu söylüyor ve bu sure zarfında hiç para kazanamamış.  Başarabildiğini eşine göstermek istiyordu ve 6 ay sonra para kazanmaya başladı ve kredisini erken ödedi.

Çevrede dükkanı kimse tanınmıyordu ve çevredekiler zamanla tanıyıp,dükkana gelip gitmeye başladılar.  Nasıl bir insan olduğunu öğrenmek istiyorlardı,İşi devam mı edecek yoksa, 6 ay daha böyle mi gidecek ve fiyatlar nasıldı.

Ama eşi hiç destek olmadığı için başaramayacağı gözü ile bakıyordu.  Başarılı olacağını düşünmüyordu.  Eşime de birşeyleri başarabildiğimi gösterdim,en güzel yanı buydu.  İşinde büyümek istiyor ama ikinci krediden önce araştırma yaptı,ikinci kredi ilk defa kiva da.

Market araştırması yaptı ve iki firma ile anlaşma yaptı ve buradan temizlik malzemesi alıcak.  Bunun için sermayeye ihtiyacı var ve krediyi nasıl kullanacak.  Yeni aldığı mallarla anlaştığı 2 firmaya satış yaparak daha fazla kara geçicek.  Gelecek için perakende satıştan toptan satışa geçecek.  Mesela,ev hanımlarına tek tek temizlik malzemesi satacağına,endüstriyel yerlere,fabrikalara,galerilere satıcak.  Tülay Hanım,çok hırslı fakat işinde adım adım ilerlemek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bulk wholesale cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize for kenkey.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: United Farmers S H G Group

texts.en:
Richard takes care of ten children at home with his wife. In the recent 2011 season, Richard had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Richard was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices. With income from maize sales, Richard will educate his children and build a house.

Richard is the facilitator of the United Farmers SHG group. As with the majority of people in this part of Kenya, Richard and his group members are farmers who rely on maize for income and food security. Richard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of United Farmers SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. In the photograph above, Richard is pictured with his group members. The field officer is standing on the left side of the photo. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Richard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely is a single man who is 25. For the last three years, he has been selling animal feed to make a living and he employs one person to assist him in his business. Stanely has retained his business because of his hard work. 

Stanely is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy animal feed. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, Stanely has become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Ramon Ignacio

texts.es:
El Sr.Ramón tiene 54 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Sinforiana hace ya mas de 25 años, tienen tres hijos y viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
El Sr. Ramón es mototaxista hace 5 años, su parada la tiene en la rotonda del cruce internacional. Comenta que son varios en esa zona y que está muy peleada su actividad, ya que no puede perder ni un sólo día su turno, ni con lluvia y frió. También recordó que hay mucha inseguridad y que a veces los lugares donde transportan a sus pasajeros son alejados, oscuros y despoblados en donde a peligra su integridad. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos puedan convertirse en personas de bien y de esa manera el pueda cumplir con su compromiso de padre, para que luego pueda dedicarse a otra actividad mas segura. Valora muchísimo la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para la reparación de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Ramón, age 54, has been married to Sinforiana for over 25 years.  They have three children, and they live in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

Ramón has been a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for five years.  He has his stop at the international crossing rotunda.  He says that they are several in this zone, and that the business activity is very competitive.  He cannot miss his shift for even one day, not even with rain or cold.

He also recalls that there is a lot of insecurity.  At times the places where he takes his passengers are far away, dark, and uninhabited where he is endangered.

His greatest desire is that his children are able to become good people.  That way he will be able to fulfill his obligation as a father.  Then he will be able to devote himself to another, safer business activity.

He greatly values the opportunity offered by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

He is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts to repair his mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts to repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and food items.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a young man with three children. Their ages range from 3 years to 10 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. 

Within the same shop, he has introduced a small restaurant in which he serves his customers with meat, soup, and other types of food. He has been involved in this business for five years now. His business is located in a shopping center. 

He describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and insufficient capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase seats to add at the restaurant. His goal is to grow his business and become the supplier of meat around an area called Gilgil. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more seats to be used at the restaurant.

loans.name: Xuraman

texts.en:
Xuraman is 56 years old and is married with three children. For the past ten years, she has bred sheep and cows. She sells her sheep for meat and breeds cows to sell milk and yogurt. These products are very popular among local people who use them in everyday cuisine. 

Xuraman is requesting a loan to expand her business and purchase six sheep and one milk cow.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm fruit and peppers

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 47 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y las vende también.
Se dedica exclusivamente a la artesanía fabricando hamacas, frazadas, colchas etc. Vende sus productos en su propio domicilio otros vendedores ambulantes de la zona. Comenta que cuenta con un buen promedio de clientes ya que sus productos son de primera calidad y los precios son muy rentables para la compra y venta.
Aprendió la profesión de su madre ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la  artesanía y su padre se dedicaba al cultivo haciendo labores de la campo. Fue su mama la que le  inculcó para que se dedique de lleno en la artesanía y a la  venta para que así pueda crecer como persona y como profesional y de la misma forma poder ayudar  a su familia  a crecer económicamente.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y tintes de color para la fabricación de las artesanías que ella elabora. Está muy contenta con la ayuda que le brinda la fundación y kiva, pues es de gran ayuda todo lo que ellos hacen.
texts.en:
Matilde is 47 years old and lives with her three children in the city of Carapeguá.  She makes and sells arts and crafts.

She makes hammocks, blankets, bedspreads, etc. and sells her products out of her home to other mobile salespeople in her zone.  She says that she has a good number of customers because her products are of good quality and very profitable for buying and selling.

She learned this art from her mother who used to be an artisan.  Her father was a farmer.  It was her mother who encouraged her to make and sell her crafts so that she could grow as a person and as a professional, and at the same time help her family financially.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy thread and dyes so she can make her crafts.  She is very happy about the support from Kiva because what they do is very helpful.

loans.use: to by thread and dye.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El Joven Ever tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante empezó a trabajar como ayudante mecánico desde que era niño.
Ahora a los 19 años de edad ya tiene su propio taller mecánico de moto, el cual ha podido montar gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Hoy en día  ya tiene una buena clientela formada y necesita comprar más herramientas así como una compresora de aire. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ahora está ampliando su taller y así podrá mantener su buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de la  compresora de aire que necesita, pues le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
The young Ever is 19 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapegua. Since he comes from a humble family and has the urge to get ahead, he began working as an assistant mechanic when he was a child.

Now, at 19, Ever already has his own motorcycle repair shop, which he has developed, thanks to his efforts and sacrifice. He also has a good customer base and needs to buy more tools, including an air compressor. Thanks to that hard work and effort, he is presently expanding his workshop and that should help maintain his good clientele base.

Ever is requesting the loan to buy the air compressor he needs, because it will be a great help in his business.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor he needs that will be of much help in his business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has 5 dependents.  Abena sells palm oil and kernel oil at Eguafo, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills. Abena will use the loan to purchase palm fruit and kernel nuts. With the new profits, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase palm fruit and kernel nuts

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
La Señora Albina está casada, tiene 2 hijos, es de la ciudad de Encarnación. Ella es pasera, es decir, se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de todo tipo los cuales vende en su barrio a sus vecinos y sobre pedido.
Ella comenta que gracias al los créditos recibidos de la institución  ha podido ir creciendo en su  Micro Empresa. Dice que por medio de este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y con la manutención de sus hijos. El sacrificio que ella hace es por su familia, por ello se esfuerza mucho. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como ser sabanas, prendas, frazadas y demás para que pueda surtirse y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Albina is married and has two children; she’s from the city of Encarnación.  She is a “pasera,” that is to say; she buys and sells all sorts of products to neighbors in her area and on order.

She comments that thanks to the loans from the institution she’s been able to gradually expand her micro business.  She says that through this business she can help her husband with household expenses and to support their children.  The sacrifice she makes is for her family and that’s why she puts such effort into it.

She asks for the loan to buy merchandise like sheets, blankets, clothes and others to stock up and have a good variety to offer her customers.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her because the loan will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy sheets, clothes, blankets and other products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 48-year-old business lady. She is married to Joseph, who is a businessman. They are blessed with five children ages 20, 16, 13 and 9 years respectively. Jennifer has been in the farming business for the past 5 years with a monthly income of 30,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fourth loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Jennifer will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Jennifer's hope and dream is to venture into keeping livestock which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a  single man who is 21. To make a living, he operates a van transport business and has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

Michael is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to maintain his van. In the next five years, he wants to employ more people in his business.

loans.use: to maintain his van

loans.name: Nibal

texts.en:
Nibal is a 48-year-old woman. She is married with two sons and three daughters. Her husband works in selling vintage items and has a low income. He wants to buy a vehicle to help him in selling vintage items in many areas to expand his work. 

Nibal wants to help her husband to get such a vehicle to increase the family income, so she needs to get a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Nibal gets the loan, she will enable her husband to purchase a vehicle that will help him to sell vintage items in many areas and work extra hours to increase his income and offer to his family better living conditions. Nibal is a conservative woman, so her son, who is over 18 years old, is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to sell vintage items.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is single. She has sold kernel oil at Eguafo for the past 3 years. Nora uses her income to take care of herself. She will use the loan to purchase kernel nuts in sacks. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nora plans to further her education.

loans.use: purchase kernel nuts

loans.name: Zulliya

texts.ru: Зуллия жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности она медсестра. Зуллия более десяти лет занимается разведением скота. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа овец.
texts.en: Zulliya is a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 47 years old, married and has three children.  She has a secondary-specialized education and is a nurse.  Zulliya has been involved in breeding livestock for over 10 years.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  Zulliya is requesting this loan for the purchase of sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Nepeita

texts.en:
Nepeita is a very hardworking woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over 3 years. She is 28 years old and married with one child.

Nepeita is a good client. She repaid her first loan well and applied for her second loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Joseph Mbuthia

texts.en:
Joseph Mbuthia is 39 years old, married and has two children. For the last 8 years, Joseph Mbuthia has repaired phones for his clients at Nakuru town. He is faced with the problem of getting genuine accessories for the phones. He wants a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more accessories. 

In five years to come, Joseph Mbuthia sees himself as the major supplier of phones and accessories to new and frequent clients. He describes himself as patient, determined and focused.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Patrick Njai

texts.en: Patrick Njai is a 32-year-old single man. He describes himself as honest and determined. He operates a motorbike, transporting passengers. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a shopping centre in Nakuru. His primary customers are frequent and [he has] new customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as the motorbike breaking down. He will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more spare parts to maintain and service the motorbikes. His business goal is to buy a car which he will be using as a taxi within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to maintain and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase salt, soda, sugar, soap and beer to sell.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
El señor Nazario es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltero, y tiene un hijo. El señor es vendedor ambulante de comidas rápidas (panchos, hamburguesas) y también de bebidas sobre una de las avenidas principales de la ciudad.
Comenta que tiene bastante clientela y muy buena venta, por lo que tiene muy buenos ingresos. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y de esa forma evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Solicito el crédito para comprar mas productos ya que se acerca las fiestas patronales de Santaní y es ahí cuando tiene más ventas. Ademas, adquirió una nueva motocicleta en la cual piensa salir a vender. Don Nazario agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Nazario is from the city of Santaní; he’s single and has a son.  He is a street vendor of fast food (hot-dogs and hamburgers) and beverages on one of the city’s main avenues.  He comments that he has quite a large clientele and sales are good so his income is very good.  He defines himself as a hardworking, determined person.  All of his efforts are to provide his family with a better standard of living to avoid their having to go through any privations.

He asked for the loan to buy more products because Santaní’s patron saint day festivities are approaching and that’s when sales are the best.  In addition, he acquired a new motorcycle that he plans to use to go out selling.  Nazario thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity provided him.

loans.use: to buy hot-dogs, hamburgers and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Rokonka

texts.en:
Rokonka is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. He is a livestock trader and also a maize farmer. He has been doing this for the last five years. 

Rokonka learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. He is a good client and this will be his second loan. He is planning to buy more livestock and buy farm inputs like seeds and chemicals used on the farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to venture into farming and to educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a finicky man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two milking cows.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. She has been running an electronics shop for the last four years to bring up her family. She also rents out houses for extra income. Irene has employed two people to help in the business. In the next five years, she wants to open another outlet of her business. 

Irene has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy televisions and radios for resale.

loans.use: To buy television and radios.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
La Sra. Maximina es de Ciudad del Este, está casada con el Sr. Francisco hace varios años. Tuvieron la bendición de tener 5 hijos, todos ellos aun pesuños en edad escolar.
Maximina y su marido trabajan en la compra y venta  de artículos reciclados, se inició con un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado de otro trabajo que  realizaba y ahora gracias al trabajo de ambos está logrando salir adelante.
Gracias al trabajo de los dos educan a sus hijos y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar, además ayudan a salvar al medio ambiente  Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de aluminio, cobre, plásticos y otros. Ella ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Maximina is from Ciudad del Este and has been married to Francisco for several years.  They were blessed with five children; they are all still young and school aged.  Maximina and her husband work buying and selling recyclables.  She started with a small amount of capital that she had saved from another job she had and now, thanks to both their work, they are getting ahead.

Thanks to their joint efforts they are educating their children and buying what’s needed for their home while also helping to preserve the environment.  She has shown herself to be very responsible and honest with her commitments.

On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy aluminum, copper, plastics and others.  She’s had two previous loans with us and made her payments in an excellent way.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, copper, plastics and others.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en: Sulait is a 35-year-old man married with 3 children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a small retail shop in the village where he sells sugar, salt, soap, and matchboxes to his customers. He is faced with a lack of capital, high taxes, and the high cost of inflation. His personal goals are to build a good permanent house for his family and to provide an education for his children. His business goal is to operate on a large scale. Sulait is asking for a loan to purchase sugar, salt, matchboxes, and soap to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, matchboxes, and soap to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Mirian Ester

texts.es:
La señora Mirian es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, los cuales ella ha criado con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Sus hijos son su razón de ser y el motivo por el cual ella se esfuerza cada día más.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de primera necesidad, como ser aceite, harina, fideos y otros, los cuales trae desde la Argentina. Se dedica a esto hace ya 5 años, por lo que ya tiene una vasta experiencia en el negocio. Nos comenta que ella va a seguir luchando por sus hijos, pues su mayor sueño es que ellos se conviertan en personas de bien, que no sean utiles solo a si mismos, sino también a la sociedad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, fideos, aceite y demás productos de primera necesidad, lo cual tiene mucha salida y lo cual le ayuda a tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirian’s from the city of Encarnación.  She’s a single mother of three children who she’s been raising with much sacrifice and effort.  Her children are her life’s purpose and this is why she strives even more each day.

She buys basic staple items like oil, flour, noodles and others that she brings from Argentina.  She’s been doing this for five years so has vast business experience.  She comments that she is going to continue to struggle for her children because her greatest wish is that they become upstanding citizens who are useful not just to themselves but to society as well.

She asks for the loan to buy flour, noodles, oil and other basic staple items which sell the most and that will help her earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Margaret has a business selling used clothes. She works 6 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products retail at the market. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Semat

texts.en:
Semat is 28, single, and he supports three people. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past eight years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member and has been a good client. He repaid the previous loan well and in good time. He is asking for a new loan to purchase farm supplies including wheat seeds and chemicals, and to hire temporary workers to help with planting. 

He hopes to make a profit and use the money to educate his children and expand the farm. He dreams of prospering as a farmer so he can provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies and hire temporary help for planting on his farm land.

loans.name: Kamalladin

texts.en:
Kamalladin is a 41-year-old man who has grown corn, fruits, and vegetables for the last 20 years. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. His wife actively helps him to run the business. 

His monthly income from crop selling is 250 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). The demand in fresh fruits and vegetables is very high and Azerbaijani people use them in everyday life. Kamalladin applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer as well as working tools.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farming implements.

loans.name: Simana C Group

texts.en:
Judith takes care of four children at home. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest 2.5 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. With income from maize sales, Judith will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

Judith is the facilitator of the Simana C Group. In the photograph above, Judith is pictured with her group members. Judith and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Simana C Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sinoyia

texts.en:
Sinoyia, is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He has been a farmer for the past six years.  

He has been a good client with KADET LTD. and paid his previous loan well. He is asking for a new loan to buy farm inputs including wheat seeds and fertilizers.

With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer and works very hard to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs including wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en: Samandar is 31 years old, and is married with three children. He is the father of three lovely daughters. He is a market vendor and sells food items in his shop in Agsu. Samandar has 5 years of experience in this business. This is the only source of income for the young family. That is why Samandar would like to expand it. His monthly profit is around 250 AZN. Now he has applied for 600 AZN to purchase more food for his store.

loans.use: to purchase more food for his store

loans.name: Nolparakuo

texts.en:
Nolparakuo is a very hard-working woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over three years. She is 28 years old, married, and a mother of two children.

She has been a good client with KADET and she is applying for her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount for use in farming for preparing land and for buying seedlings. 


She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a hardworking business woman, age 34. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She has been practicing both crop and dairy farming for the last two years to support her family. Her potential customers are the local residents. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy cabbages and tomato seedlings.

loans.use: To buy cabbages and tomato seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Rose has a business in selling plastics. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Rose sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. Rose has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more plastics for resale. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Rose include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.  Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for resale

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Alusine, a small businessman in Makeni city. 

Alusine is asking for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to invest in his business. The 35 year old is a native of Kambia town. He is married to a businesswoman and has four children. Alusine sells provisions including milk, sardines, luncheon meat, drinks, biscuits, and bottled water. He has been in business for four years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shop, including milk, sardines, luncheon meat, drinks, biscuits, and bottled water.

loans.name: Simana B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simana B Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Janet is the facilitator of the Simana B Group. In the above photograph, Janet is pictured with her group members. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janet takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to get good teaching. In the recent 2011 season, Janet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janet was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Janet will educate her children and ensure food security.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a businesswoman who has operated a cybercafe for the last two years. Her monthly income is KES 3,000. She is 26 years old and supports her parents. 

Josephine was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member during a marketing campaign in the town of Narok. She is a good client, and she has applied for a loan to buy more computers to expand her cybercafe.

She hopes to generate profits to reinvest in her business. She can do more with additional resources.

loans.use: to buy more computers to expand her cybercafe.

loans.name: Ghinaa'

texts.en: Ghinaa' is a married woman with three sons and two daughters. She and her husband work in agriculture and they have a greenhouse project. Nibal wants to make another greenhouse project to benefit more and increase her income, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ghinaa' gets the loan, she will pay the expenses needed to get another greenhouse project, to enable her to increase the crop and her selling which lead to increase her income and live in better conditions with her family. Ghinaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for making another greenhouse project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a very hard-working woman who practices farming in the town of Narok. She has been farming for over three years. She is 35 years old and married with two children.

Joyce has been a good client with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount for farming, specifically preparing her land and buying seedlings (maize and wheat). 

Joyce intends to use the additional income generated through this loan to reinvest in farming. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to prepare her land and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells the Ghanaian dishes wakye and kenkey at Eguafo. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband works in security.  Abena has been selling wakye and kenkey for seven years. She assists her husband in providing for the family. She will use her loan to buy rice and maize in bulk for preparing the food. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize in bulk for food preparation.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a determined business man, age 39. He is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school.

He has been operating a motorbike transport business for the last two years to support his family. He also does farming to supplement his income. David is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to service his motorbike.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Rose Akinyi

texts.en: Rose Akinyi is a 38-year-old married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 4 to 5 years old. She describes herself as obedient and God-fearing. She operates a salon where she provides services like blow drying, plaiting and general hair makeup. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre in Nakuru town. Her primary customers are frequent and [she has] new customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased price of the hair products. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more hair care products. Her business goal is to open more salons in the same area within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy hair care products like shampoo and hair oil.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Sally has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works six days out of every week. Sally sells her products retail from her home. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  
   
The main business challenges for Sally include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to the university level. Sally lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but she doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children, aged 1 year and 5 years. He describes himself as quiet, obedient, and committed to his work. He operates a shop where he sells household items like sugar, salt, and cooking oil, among other products. He has been involved in this business for 23 years. His shop is located in a shopping center at Nakuru, where he serves frequent customers as well as new ones. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds to add stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stocks of household items. Titus's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tea leaves, and other household items.

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Glodilta takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the 2011 season, Glodilta had a very good maize yield harvesting 4 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Glodilta was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ an acres of land. With income from maize sales, Glodilta will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Glodilta is the facilitator of the Jitegemee Group. In the photograph above, Glodilta is pictured with her group members. Glodilta and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Jitegemee Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Glodilta and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells salted fish and tomatoes at Eguafo and has been doing this for 5 years. She is married, has 3 children, and her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in caring for their children. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish and tomatoes. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fish and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en: Meet Alhassan, a small-scale businessman in the northern city of Makeni. The 29-year-old Alhassan was born in Makeni. He is married to a trader and the couple has one child. Alhassan sells provisions, such as coffee, Peak Milk, sardines, luncheon meats, and other items. He has been running this business for three years now. He has requested this loan in order to stock more goods in his shop, and he will use the funds to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantities to supplement his business.

loans.use: to buy provisions in bulk to stock his shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working woman and has been farming for over 10 years. 

She has been a good client with KADET LTD. in previous loans. She is asking for a new loan to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers for farming. 

She will invest any profit in more farming. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: buy wheat seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more items for her store.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hardworking businessman who is 41. He is married and blessed with three children who are in school. For the last three years, he has been running a grocery business to support his family. 

Paul is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a van to transport grocery products, such as tomatoes and green maize, to the market. In the next five years, he plans to establish his business and to become an employer.

loans.use: to buy a van to transport merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey

loans.name: Ansoumana

texts.fr:
ANSOUMANA HABITE DANS LA REGION SUD DU SENEGAL .AGE DE 32 ANS ,ENSEIGNANT DEPUIS 2001 MARIE D'UNE FEMME IL A 2 ENFANTS lE PLUS GRAND FAIT LE CI ET LE PLUS PETIT EST A LA MAISON AVEC SA MAMAN .
ANSOUMANA A CONSTRUIT SA MAISON DEPUIS 2009 DANS SON VILLAGE NATAL AU NORD DE LA REGION SUD VERS LA FRONTIERE GAMBIENNE .AVEC CE CREDIT IL VEUT FAIRE LA FINISSION DE SON BATIMENT POUR ALLEGER LE COUT DE LA LOCATION .DANS L'AVENIR ANSOUMANA VEUT UNE AFFECTATION POUR REGAGNER L'ECOLE DE SON VILLAGE ET HABITER DANS SA PROPRE MAISON AVEC SA FAMILLE .
texts.en:
Ansoumana is 32 years old and lives in southern Senegal. He is married and the father of 2 children. The eldest goes to elementary school and the youngest stays at home with his mother.

Ansoumana has been a teacher since 2001. In 2009, he started construction on a house in his native village in southern Senegal, near the Gambian border. He is requesting a loan with which to buy supplies so that he can complete construction on his future home, which will also bring down his current expenditure on the location. He hopes one day to be appointed to work at his old village school and to be able to live in his own house with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement to allow him to finish off construction on his home.

loans.name: Afiyakhanum

texts.en:
Afiyakhanum is 53 years old and is married with four children. For the past five years, she has raised and sold cattle and cows. Her husband helps her to run the business and he also works at a butcher. Afiyakhanum's business consists of selling milk and yogurt as well as meat. Her husband's salary is only 50 AZN and the profit generated by cattle breeding is 330 AZN.  

Afiyakhanum is requesting an 800 AZN loan to expand her business by purchasing two cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. He has been operating a motorbike transport business to support his family and he also is a poultry farmer to supplement his income. James has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

James is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a motorbike. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mwalie Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mwalie Group in Western Kenya! Linet  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Linet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Linet was only able to harvest 3 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Linet will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

Linet is the facilitator of the Mwalie group. The photograph shows the members of the group with the Field officer on the far left. 
This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mwalie group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Linet  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorreti lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She takes care of  two additional family members (mother and father). 

She sells green bananas. Gorreti works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children  up to the university level. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Nolmeshuki

texts.en:
Nolmeshuki is a very hardworking woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over five years. She is 28 years old and married; they have two children.

She has a good credit history with KADET LTD. She has applied for her second loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers, and hire manpower to aid in the farm. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. She hopes to develop her farming business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Temakho B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Temakho B Group in Western Kenya! Janerose is the facilitator of the Temakho B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janerose  takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janerose had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janerose was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janerose  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Janerose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Temakho B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en:
Maharram is 47 years old and is married with three sons. For more than 20 years, he has been dedicated to cattle breeding. Maharram is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Milk and meat sales are fundamental to his ability to earn a profit and they bring him a stable monthly income of 160 AZN. However, this is not enough to cover the needs of his children. 

Maharram is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to improve his living conditions and increase income. He will use his loan to purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Chemway Group

texts.en:
Richard is the facilitator of the Chemway group. Richard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Richard takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Richard had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Richard was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Richard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Richard will repair his house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Chemway group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Richard is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells cooked rice and stew at Eguafo. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Adjoa has been selling rice and stew for 7 years. She assists her husband in paying the utility bills.  She will use her loan to buy bags of rice and food items. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bags of rice and food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farming implements.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: El señor Victoriano  que actualmente es solicitante nació  en la comunidad Qollpa del Municipio de Pocona a 150 Km al sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, viven con su esposa que cuenta con una vivienda rustica con paredes de adobe y techo de calamina. La actividad a que se dedica el solicitante es la agricultura que produce los siguientes productos papa, maíz, haba y cereales, las siembras realizan en la parcelas heredades de sus padres de esposo/a. El presente crédito está solicitando para comprar los insumos agrícolas para mejorar sus ingresos en los próximos años y de esa manera obtener la calidad de viva en su familia, como semillas y abono.
texts.en: Victoriano who currently is a borrower was born in the community of Qollp in Pocona Municipality 150 kilometers south of the city of Cochabamba.  He lives with his wife in a rustic abode with adobe walls and a plywood roof.  He is a potato, corn, lima bean and cereal farmer.  He plants on land inherited from his and his wife’s parents.  The loan he’s asking for at present is to buy farm supplies like seeds and manure to improve income in the coming years to obtain quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, seeds and manure.

loans.name: Carmen Francisca

texts.es:
Carmen Francisca tiene 34 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.

Carmen se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol además al comercio de queso huevos y gallinas.

Las compras y ventas lo realiza en Chillanes cada fin de semana, Solicita el crédito para poder comprar animales ( gallinas).
Con la ayuda del crédito mejorará la calidad de vida. El sueño es poder tener un vehículo para transportar los productos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta a diario e sla competencia. En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar, disfrutar del carnaval se considera una persona alegre, trabajadora y solidaria.
texts.en:
Carmen Francisca is 34 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her mother in Chillanes, Bolivar province.

Her communal bank, “La Florida,” is composed of 12 members, male and female, and is located in Chillanes canton, some 5 minutes from our office.

As a farmer, Carmen grows corn and beans, in addition to selling cheese, eggs, and hens. She buys and sells in Chillanes each weekend. 
Carmen is requesting a loan to buy more hens. With the help of this loan, her quality of life should improve. 

Carmen's dream is to have a vehicle in which to transport her products. Competition is among the challenges that daily present themselves. 

In her free time, she likes to rest or enjoy the carnival. Carmen is considered a happy hard-working person with much solidarity.

loans.use: to buy more hens.

loans.name: Sointa

texts.en:
Sointa is a 39-year-old married woman who has three children. She has been a mixed farmer for the past five years. She has a good credit history with KADET LTD. This will be her third loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase wheat seeds (grain) and fertilizers. 

She hopes to generate profits from the loan which she would use to expand her farming from small-scale to large-scale commercial farming. She hopes that in the future she will live a better life and see her children's magnificence.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds (grain) and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in his shop, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram  is a 44 year old farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables.  He also sells home furniture in his shop.  He has three years of experience. 

Ikram is married and has three sons. 

Ikram`s businesses generates a stable income of about 230 AZN per month.  

He applied for a 600 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to enhance his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to enhance his farming business.

loans.name: Katetei

texts.en:
Katetei has been a businesswoman operating a kiosk for the past two years. She is 33 years old, married, and supports three people in her family.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff and applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale. 

She hopes to make a profit and invest the income by expanding her business into a wholesale. She is hardworking woman who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Celline Anyango

texts.en: Celline Anyango is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 to 10 years old. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in Mombasa and her primary customers are frequent and new customers. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a married man with one son and one daughter.  His wife is employed with a decent salary. 

Mohammad runs a taxi service.  He wants to pay the costs to insure and license his taxi; but lack the money to do so.

He needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.  When Mohammad gets the loan, he will pay to insure and license his taxi, and this will make his taxi business legal.

Mohammad will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to insure and license his taxi.

loans.name: Weyomisha Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weyomisha SHG Group in Western Kenya! Christine is the facilitator of the Weyomisha SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Christine takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and One Acre Fund has the best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Christine had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Christine was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Christine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Christine will educate her children and build a house.

In 2012, the members of Weyomisha SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase four calves.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a 58 year old woman who trades and sells home products from her house. 

She is married and has two children. 

This is a very profitable business and Fatma is very polite and friendly towards her customers.  Her permanent customers are women who live in her neighborhood. 

She sells dowry products and has been in business for the last 10 years.  Her profit is 300 AZN.  Her son helps her run the business. 

Fatma applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise in hopes it will increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Teresa Trinidad

texts.es:
Teresa Trinidad tiene 38 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad en  Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
La socia se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de fréjol además se dedica al comercio de papas y chochos.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Pablo y Chillanes cada 15 días.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería y semillas. Con la ayuda del crédito mejoraría la calidad de vida. El sueño es poder dar a los hijos el estudio y que puedan terminar para que sean profesionales.
Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado son: los precios altos y competencia. En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las fiestas de Santa Rita se considera una persona tranquila, honrada.
texts.en:
Teresa Trinidad, 38, is married and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 14 and 17 years old in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.  

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both male and female, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.  She is a bean farmer and also a potato and lupines merchant.  Her purchases and her sales take place every two weeks in San Pablo and in Chillanes.

She is asking for the loan to buy supplies and seeds.  With help from the loan she will improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to be able to provide schooling for her children and that they will finish so that they can become professionals.

The challenges she has faced are high prices and competition.  In her free time she likes to rest and enjoy the Saint Rita festivities.  She considers herself to be a tranquil, honest person.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items.

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf is 33 years old and has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last six years. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them and then sells them for a profitable price in the next five to six months.  His monthly income from his business is 320 AZN.  He sells cattle for meat purposes and this is very profitable business because people in Azerbaijan use meat in everyday cuisine.  To cover market demand Rauf applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will use this loan to purchase one milking cow and three calves.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and three calves.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old. She is married and a mother of two children. She is a farmer and does the farming on her own piece of land. She has been doing this for the last six years. 

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan which she is planning to spend to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house.

Her dream is to be a prominent farmer of wheat and provide a better living for the family. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds.

loans.name: Akikuen Group

texts.en:
Daniel is the facilitator of the Akikuen group. Daniel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daniel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Daniel takes care of 12 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Daniel had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Daniel was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Daniel will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Akikuen group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Daniel  with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 18 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
María se dedica al comercio de granos y harinas.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del tambo y Chillanes.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería (granos), Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida.
El sueño es poder verle al hijo que termine los estudios y llegue a ser profesional. Al desafía que se ha enfrentado a diario es la competencia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita se considera una persona honesta, unida, trabajadora.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 49, is married and has a son.  She lives with her husband and 16-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.  

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton 5 minutes from the office.  María is a grains and flour merchant.  Her purchases and her sales take place in San José del Tambo and in Chillanes.

She asks for the loan to buy grains.  With help from the loan she will improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to see her son complete his schooling and become a professional.  The challenge she has faced daily is competition.  In her free time she likes to rest and enjoy the Saint Rita festivities.  She considers herself to be an honest, united and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Henry Lingie

texts.en: Henry Lingie is a 56 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 23 years to 40 years. He describes himself to be welcoming. He operates a butchery where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located at Changamwe in Mombasa town and his primary customers are frequent and new customers. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy chickens. Henry business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy chickens for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Nailepu

texts.en:
Nailepu is a very hard working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over ten years. She is 37 years old and married, they have five children. 

She is applying for her second  loan. She plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs including maize seeds and fertilizers. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs including maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alibala

texts.en: Alibala is 56 year-old man who has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years. He is married and has two sons. He usually sells his crops in the central bazaar and to the local vendors. His monthly profit is 250 AZN and he would like to increase it.  His elder son helps him to raise crops and sell them in the bazaar. Alibala applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and new land.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 42 year old woman living in Bundibugyo Uganda with 7 children. She has been operating a pub for ten years amidst challenges such as inadequate capital to buy more drinks, customers not paying on time and theft. Her family goals are, providing better education to her children and building a permanent house. Florence's business goals include diversifying her business, hiring employees and moving business to a more permanent location. Florence needs money to buy crates of beer. The man in a jacket is a loan officer who had to appear in the photo so as to have the client's confidence.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique tiene 54 años de edad es casada tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 15 años de casada en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y fréjol además al comercio de animales.

Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en el Cantón Chillanes cada 15 días.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas y urea.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida. El sueño es poder darle el estudio a la hija y que pueda culminarlos.
El desafío que se le ha presentado son los intermediarios. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar boley y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y Santa Rita se considera un apersona alegre.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique, 54, is married and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and 15-year-old daughter in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.  Luis is a corn and broad bean farmer and he also is a livestock merchant.  His purchases and his sales take place every two weeks in Chillanes Canton.

He requests the loan to be able to buy seeds and urea.  With help from the loan he will improve his quality of life.  His dream is to provide schooling for his daughter and that she is able to complete it.  His challenge is middlemen.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the festivities of Carnival and Saint Rita.  He considers himself to be a cheerful person.

loans.use: to buy seeds and urea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like milk, biscuits, fresh up, sweets, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 38 years old married  woman. She has three children who depend on her. She has been a poultry farmer for a period of six years.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. She applied for her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy more chicks for rearing. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a single mother of 4 children aged 3-17, living in Hioma, Uganda. She is the only income earner in the family hence she has to take care of the family needs alone. She owns a boys quarter (servant's quarters) and she lives in it with her family.

For 17 years she has been dealing in the fresh foods business and she hopes her business will grow in the future and become self-sustainable. Robinah needs a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods.

loans.name: Angaro Group

texts.en:
Charles is the facilitator of the Angaro group. Charles and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Charles and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Charles takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Charles had a good maize yield, harvesting 16  bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Charles was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Charles will save for the future and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Angaro group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Charles is pictured with his group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en:
Saruni has been a farmer for the last eleven years. He is 30 years old, married and a father of three children. He learned about KADET  LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. 

This is his second loan which he plans to spend to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and maize seeds and others to buy livestock for fattening. 

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.His dream is to be the best and well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and maize seeds

loans.name: Carmen Bolivia

texts.es:
Carmen Bolivia tiene 47 años de edad es casada tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 15 años de edad en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
Carmen se dedica a  la agricultura  al cultivo de maíz y fréjol además se dedica a la crianza de animales (pollos).
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Chillanes cada fin de semana. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea.
 Con el dinero del crédito le ayudara a suplir necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de vida. El sueño es poder darle a la hija para que pueda culminar los estudios. 
El desafío que se le ha presentado son los intermediarios. En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita se considera un apersona tranquila, unida y solidaria.
texts.en:
Carmen Bolivia, 47, is married and has a daughter.  She lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.  Carmen is a corn and broad bean farmer and she also raises chickens.  Hers purchases and her sales take place every two weeks in Chillanes Canton.

She requests the loan to be able to buy urea.  With help from the loan she will meet her economic needs and improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to provide schooling for her daughter and that she is able to complete it.  Her challenge is middlemen.  In her free time she likes to rest and enjoy the Saint Rita Day festivities.  She considers herself to be a tranquil, united and supportive person.

loans.use: para comprar urea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been a farmer for the last five years. He is 35 years married to Caroline who is a house wife and blessed with three children.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staffs in his area of habitat. Being this is his fourth loan he planned to spend to purchase farm supplies like maize seeds and fertilizers. 

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dreams are to be the best and well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years-old and married with three children.  To earn a living, she runs a hardware shop.  She has been in the business for four years. She works hard so as to provide for her family.  Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has managed to open a savings account and has easy access to loans.  She hopes to grow her business into wholesale.

Elizabeth has requested for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy cement.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Maria Liduvina

texts.es:
María Liduvina tiene 60 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15, 20 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia  de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
María se dedica a la Agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol además se dedica a al venta de confitería.
Las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Chillanes cada fin de semana. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, con la ayuda del crédito mejorará la calidad de vida y la del producto. 
El sueño es poder brindarles el apoyo a los hijos para que puedan culminar los estudios.
El desafío al que se ha enfrentado a diario son los intermediarios.
 Se considera una persona responsable, honrada humilde y trabajadora, le gusta disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita.
texts.en:
María Liduvina, 60, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 15, 20 and 12 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.  María is a corn and broad bean farmer and she also sells sweets.  Hers purchases and her sales take place every weekend in Chillanes Canton.

She requests the loan to be able to buy farm supplies.  With help from the loan she will improve the quality of her life and of her product.  Her dream is to support her children so that they finish their schooling.  Her challenge is middlemen.  She considers herself to be a responsible, honest, humble and hardworking person.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the Saint Rita Day festivities.

loans.use: para comprar insumos agrícolas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like green vegetables, lemons.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Aisha has a business of tailoring.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market, by means of retail.   Aisha  has requested for a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials.  The main business challenges for Aisha include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and also to educate her children up to university.   Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Toro Piru Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad se han unido con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Quieren salir adelante y piensan que el programa de la fundación le será de mucha ayuda.
Una de las miembros de ese grupo es la señora Lidia, quien se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de cerdos, comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, pues siempre tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales para que nos les pase nada ni tomen alguna enfermedad, ya que ella ofrece muy buenos animales. Ella pese a ese esfuerzo quiere poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de cerdos pequeños, como así también alimentos para los mismos.
Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le da la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Santaní, all friends and neighbors from that city, have joined together with the goal of helping each other through their joint efforts.  They want to get ahead and believe that the Fundación’s program will be of much help to them.

One of this group’s members is Lidia who raises pigs for subsequent sale.  She comments that her work is very demanding because she always has to be watchful of her animals so that nothing happens to them or they get sick because she sells very good animals.  Despite the effort required she wants to continue to grow and this is why she’s asked for a loan: to buy piglets as well as feed for them.  She is very grateful for the opportunity the Fundación and Kiva give her.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Sara Magdalena

texts.es:
Sara Magdalena tiene 56 años de edad es viuda tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
