La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
Sara se dedica a la Agricultura al cultivo de maíz y fréjol.
Las compras y las ventas los realiza en Chillanes cada fin de semana. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas.
Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudara mejorar la calidad del producto.
El sueño es poder comprar terreno para aumentar la producción. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta a diario son los intermediarios.
Se considera una persona humilde, tranquila, trabajadora y honrada y le gusta disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita.
texts.en:
Sara Magdalena, 56, is widowed and has two children.  She lives with her children who are 20 and 25 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both male and female, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.  Sara is a corn and broad bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Chillanes every weekend.  

She asks for the loan to be able to buy farm supplies.  Help from the loan will help her improve the quality of the product.  Her dream is to be able to buy a piece of farmland to increase production.  The challenge she faces is the middlemen.  She considers herself to be a humble, tranquil, hardworking and honest person who likes to enjoy the Saint Rita Day festivities.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 43-year-old wife and a mother of 6 sons and daughters. To be able to help her husband who works for one of the governmental entities, that is to help support the family, she started a small home-based retail business selling cleaning material and detergents.

It has been three years now since she started; basically what she does is buy large quantities of detergents and refill them into smaller usable containers.

Now Maha is applying for this loan to buy other types of detergents with different scents.

loans.use: to buy other types of detergents with different scents.

loans.name: Saber

texts.en: Saber is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has owned a coffee cart since 2009 which he installs in a specific place in his town to provide customers with delicious fresh coffee. At the same time, he has been working at a local municipality since 2004 so as to make good profits. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new espresso machine. In the future, he plans to open his own coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new espresso machine

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a barbershop since 2008; and has a previous experience of five years working in the same occupation. With his requested loan of $1700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to improve his business by purchasing added materials needed and redecorating his shop in order to attract more customers. In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: purchasing added materials needed and redecorating his barbershop

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina tiene 70 años, es D. la ciudad D. Paraguarí. Tiene una despensa bien surtida en frente D. una plaza D. la ciudad hace más D. 50 años, está casada con el Sr Crecenciano, ellos viven solos en su pequeña casita.
Tienen una sola hija, llamada Hilda, quien trabaja en Buenos Aires y desD. allí los ayuda con un poco D. dinero. Marina nos cuenta que a lo largo D. los 50 años D. abrir su despensa logró juntar muchísima clientela y gracias a eso tiene un buen ingreso en el negocio, lo cual la ayuda muchísimo.
La Sra. Marina pretenD. utilizar el dinero del crédito para recargar más su despensa, con los productos D. primera necesidad, como ser: fideos, azúcar, harina, panificados y demás artículos. agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues es muy importante su apoyo.
texts.en:
Marina, 70, is from the city of Paraguarí.  She has had a well-stocked store across from a square in the city for over 50 years.  She’s married to Crescenciano; they live alone in a small house.

They only have one daughter, called Hilda, who works in Buenos Aires and helps them out sending them a little money from there.  Marina tells us that throughout these fifty years since she opened her store she’s acquired quite a few customers and thanks to that she earns good income in the business which helps her very much.

Marina intends to use the loan money to restock her store more with basic staple items like noodles, sugar, flour, baked goods and other items.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her because its support is very important.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 28 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
El socio se dedica a la Agricultura al cultivo de maíz y fréjol, las compras y ventas de los productos los realiza en Chillanes cada semana.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del préstamo  le ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida y la del producto.
El sueño es poder comprarse una fI., los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado son los intermediarios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar boley y disfrutar de las festividades de  Santa Rita y se considera una persona colaboradora, trabajadora y respetuosa.
texts.en:
José Luis, 28, is single and has no children.  He lives in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.  

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office. José Luis is a corn and broad bean farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place weekly in Chillanes.  He requests the loan to be able buy farm supplies.  Support from the loan will help him improve the quality of his life and of his product.  His dream is to be able to buy a farm.  The challenge he’s faced is middlemen.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the Saint Rita Day festivities.  He considers himself to be a collaborative, hardworking and respectful person.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Vicente Humberto

texts.es:
Vicente Humberto Tiene 52 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15 y 25 años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
El socio se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol las compras y las ventas de los productos los realiza en Chillanes.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar abonos y fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda del dinero podrá mejorar el producto y con ello el estilo de vida de la familia.
El sueño es poder mejorar y aumentar la calidad del producto. El desafío siempre son los intermediarios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar boley y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita se considera una persona trabajadora, humilde, responsable y tranquila
texts.en:
Vicente Humberto, 52, is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 15 and 25 years old in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.  

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.

Vicente is a corn and broad bean farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in Chillanes.  He requests the loan to be able buy manure and fertilizer.  Support from the loan will help him improve the quality of his product and thus his family’s standard of living.  His dream is to be able to improve the quality and quantity of his product.  The challenge is always the middlemen.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the Saint Rita Day festivities.  He considers himself to be a hardworking, humble, responsible and tranquil person.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jessica Piedad

texts.es:
Jessica Piedad tiene 20 años de edad vive en Unión Libre  tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en la casa de los suegros en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
La socia se dedica al comercio de chanchos y a la agricultura al cultivo de fréjol las comparas y las ventas de los productos los realiza en Chillanes cada semana.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas y urea.
Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida y poder producir en mayor cantidad.
El sueño es poder tener salud y construir una casa.
Los desafíos que ha diario se le presentan es la competencia y los intermediarios.
Se considera una persona muy tranquila trabajadora y honesta le gusta jugar básquet.
texts.en:
Jessica Piedad, 20, is in a common law relationship and has a son.  She lives with her husband and son in her in-laws’ house in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.  

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office.

Jessica raises pigs to sell and is a corn and broad bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Chillanes weekly.  She requests the loan to be able buy seeds and urea.  Support from the loan will help her improve her quality of life and to be able to produce in larger quantities.  Her dream is to stay healthy and to build a house.  The daily challenges she faces are competition and the middlemen.  She considers herself to by a very tranquil, hardworking and honest person; she enjoys playing basketball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and urea.

loans.name: Jorge Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.Jorge ; el tiene 52 años de edad y es  soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de laptops y tambien se dedica al negocio de asesor financiero,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere mejorar el trabajo de asesor financiero y venta de laptops.El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mas repuestos de laptops.
 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge is 54 years old, single, and has one child. He continues to make a living selling laptops, and he also works in the business of financial consulting. He works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Through this job he has given his children a good start in life. Jorge wants to improve his work in financial consulting and selling laptops. He is asking for the loan to buy more laptop parts. 

Jorge is grateful to everyone who is helping him fulfill his dream and promises to make his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy more laptop parts

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 35-year-old Lebanese divorced woman living with her parents. She has owned a female beauty salon since 2009. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. In addition, Rana has three children and contributes in paying their educational fees even if she is not staying with them.  Today, she’s requesting to borrow $2500 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new cosmetics products which will allow her better serve her customers. She is very positive and has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products

loans.name: Veronica Natividad

texts.es:
Verónica Natividad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de un año de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
Verónica se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Chillanes cada semana.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará el producto.
El sueño es poder dar la educación al hijo y pueda culminar los estudios. Los desafíos  que se le presentaron son los intermediarios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita, se considera una persona tranquila, trabajadora y amable.
texts.en:
Verónica Natividad is married and has one son. She lives with her husband and one-year-old son in Chillanes, in Bolívar Province. 

The “la Florida” communal bank has 12 members and is located in Chillanes Canton five minutes from the office. Veronica makes a living in agriculture, planting corn and beans. She buys and sells in Chillanes every week. She is asking for the loan to buy manure and fertilizer. With the help of this loan, she will improve her products. 

Her dream is to be able to provide her son with an education and that he finishes school. The challenge she faces is with middlemen. 

In her free time, she likes to listen to music and enjoy the Saint Rita Day celebrations.  She considers herself to be a calm, hardworking, and friendly person.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge Daniel

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 34 años, es casado, tiene un hijo y actualmente su señora se encuentra embarazada y tendrá mellizos. Es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, vivió más de diez años en la casa de sus suegros, pero hace  aproximadamente un año se mudó y vive en su casa propia con su esposa la Sra. Ilda.
Jorge se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace más de un año, pero ya habia empezado en el mismo ramo hace más de 10 años como cobrador, ya que casi toda su familia trabaja en esto y con el obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual, aparte de que ya cuenta con una clientela formada y varias zonas de trabajo.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de Termos, conservadoras, coleman, etc, ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar sus zonas de venta y obtener un mayor ingreso con lo cual podrá ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 34 years old, married, and has one son.  His wife is pregnant with twins.  He is from Paraguarí and lived with his in-laws for more than ten years, but he and his wife, Ilda, recently moved to their own home.

Jorge is a mobile vendor and has done this for more than a year, but he had started in the same business more than ten years ago as a collector.  Most of the family works in this area and they bring in a good monthly income.  He already has steady customers in the various zones where he works.

He plans to use the money from this loan to buy Thermoses, ice chests, Coleman products, etc.  This will allow him to increase the number of zones where he sells, and increase his income so that he can help his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother). Eseza has a business of a food stall.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Eseza sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Eseza has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more, bunches of bananas, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, and cabbages.  The main business challenges for Eseza include seasonality, transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and also to educate her children up to university. Eseza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, tomatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of goods sold

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has been working as a freelancer home painter for the past 10 years. In parallel, he started to work in a local company six months ago. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses so as to be able to support the heavy demands of life. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools and purchase paints for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the clients and build a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business.

loans.use: renew his business tools and purchase paints for a new project

loans.name: Eda Eveling

texts.es:
Eda   vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Eda, es una mujer casada de 29 años de edad, ella tiene dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, ya que este trabajo le sale rentable y porque le genera ingresos. 
Eda  es una mujer  luchadora,  perseverante y muy responsable con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia. 
Eda  empezó su negocio en el año 2008 , gana semanalmente S/.440 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y 7 días a la semana. Con el préstamo de S/. 3000  soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Eda  invertirá su crédito para la compra de mercadería (camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc).  Su sueño de Eda es tener su puesto propio y expandirlo a nivel nacional, para que pueda generar mayores ingresos y terminar de construir su casa para  poder llevar una mejor calidad de vida, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Eda lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Eda is 29 years old and married.  She has two minor children.  She sells clothing, which generates income and has proven to be profitable.  
Eda is a go-getting, persistent and responsible woman with a lot of desire to get her family ahead.
Eda started her business in 2008.  She makes 440 new soles a week.  She works about 10 hours per day, 7 days per week.  With the loan of 3000 new soles that she will receive thanks to Kiva she will buy merchandise (shirts, slacks, blouses, etc.).  Her dream is to have her own stand and to expand to a national level so that she can increase her income and finish building her house, this way achieving a better way of life.  Her adviser believes that she is an excellent customer and that she will pay her installments promptly.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 53 year old married man. He has 7 children between the ages of 12 and 28. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His store is located in Changamwe, a suburb of Mombasa, and he has both new and returning customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nilo Estuardo

texts.es:
Nilo Estuardo tiene 20 años de edad es soltero vive en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
Nilo se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y fréjol, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Chillanes cada semana.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas mejorar la calidad del producto. Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a aumentar la calidad del producto.
El sueño es poder estudiar y culminarlos y tener una profesión.
Los desafíos en todo negocio es los intermediarios. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar boley y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita, se considera un hombre honrado, trabajador, responsable y colaborador.
texts.en:
Nilo Estuardo is 20 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

The La Florida communal bank is made up of 12 members and is located in Chillanes canton 5 minutes from the office.

Nilo is a farmer, and grows corn and beans. He buys and sells in Chillanes every week.

He is asking for the loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies to improve the quality of his produce. The loan will help him to increase the quality of his produce. 

His dream is to be able to study, finish studying, and have a profession.

The middlemen are a challenge in every business. In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the Santa Rita festivities. He is considered to be an honorable, hard-working, responsible, and contributing man.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to improve the quality of his produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university education fees.

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos.

Él tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la veterinaria básica (practica), ya que sus padres con mucho esfuerzo lo enviaron a estudiar un bachillerato agrícola, pero solo hizo un año y medio, pero por falta de recursos económicos no continuo. En este tiempo aprendió muchas técnicas para desempeñar esta actividad y lo hacia en los animales de su familia, luego se dedico a trabajar de manera individual desde las 4:00 a.m. hasta el anochecer cuando le llaman los clientes.

Álvaro compra la medicina que le va a suministrar a los animales, en el lugar más cercano a su vivienda, pero hay ocasiones en que no encuentra los medicamentos y debe viajar a otro lugar.

Álvaro solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos vacas lecheras de repasto. De esta forma él dispondrá de otra fuente de ingresos para su familia. Álvaro tiene la disposición de continuar aprendiendo veterinaria y estudiar unos cursos, con el objetivo de tener mayor conocimiento y tener mejores conocimientos.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 47 years old and lives with his companion and five children.

He has dedicated himself to basic veterinary services (practice) for 8 years since his parents, with much effort, sent him to study for a bachelor’s.  He only completed a year and a half, as he did not have the financial resources to continue.  During this time, he learned many technical skills to carry out this activity, which he was able to use on behalf of his family’s animals.  Later, he started working independently from 4:00 am until dark when customers called for him.

Álvaro buys the medicines he administers to the animals at the place closest to his house.  There are times, however, when he can’t find what he needs and must then travel to another location.

Álvaro requests a loan from Fundación Campo to buy two milking cows, which will provide another source of income for his family.  Álvaro has the disposition to continue learning veterinary science and to take some classes, with the goal of increasing his knowledge in this arena.

loans.use: buy two milking cows.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is a 52 year old widowed woman. She has 5 children between the ages of 24 and 40. She describes herself as a welcoming and hardworking woman. She operates a store where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in Changamwe, a suburb of Mombasa, and she has both new and returning customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). 

Eseza has a business of poultry farming.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Semu sells her products from home, by means of retail. Semu has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feeds. 

The main business challenges for Semu include seasonality and transportation of chicken feeds. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2,000 chickens and also to educate her children up to university. 

Semu lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of poultry feeds.

loans.name: Evans Tokali

texts.en: Evans is a 22 year old single man. He describes himself as social and welcoming. He operates a retail store where he sells household products. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in Mishomoroni, a suburb of Mombasa, and he has both new and returning customers. He says his biggest business challenge is price fluctuation of the goods he sells. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household products to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more household products to sell.

loans.name: Flores Del Campo Group

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea es casada, tiene 50 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos los cuales no estudian, se dedica a los oficios D. la casa y la atención D. un tienda D. artículos en general, inició su negocio con un poco D. capital con el apoyo D. su esposo, lleva 10 años D. experiencia en ofrecer productos D. tienda.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra D. productos, aguas gaseosa, jugos, golosinas, azúcar, fideo, condimentos D. cocina, etc. Espera en el futuro tener su negocio surtido y granD.. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la atención a tienda, bordado D. blusas, confección D. ropa, venta D. comida, y crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 50 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has six children who are not in school.  Dorotea attends to her household chores and runs a general store.  She started her business with a little capital and her husband's support.  She has ten years experience selling products in her store.

Dorotea set up a group so that she could request a loan which she would use to buy products such as soda, juice, candies, sugar, noodles, seasonings, etc.  She hopes, in the future, to have a well-stocked and large business.  The other members of the group run stores, embroider blouses, make clothes, sell food and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has one child. Nana sells food items in Eguafo, which she has done since two years ago. Her husband is a farmer. Nana uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills.  

Nana will use the loan to purchase more food items for sale. With the new profits, Nana plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for sale.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 27-year-old Lebanese engaged man. He has owned a small shop since 2009, and his job consists of repairing electricA. generators. It wasn’t that hard starting his business alone since he had already seven years of experience working in the same occupation. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase mechanicA. tools and a range of spare parts. He plans to serve more customers in order to gain superior income and therefore, save enough money to be able to get married soon. In the future, he plans to open his own repairing shop.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and a range of spare parts.

loans.name: Purity Masika

texts.en: Purity is a 25 year old married woman. She has 2 children aged 2 and 5. She describes herself as wise and social. She operates a restaurant where she sells food and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in Mishomoroni, a suburb of Mombasa, and her primary customers are students and teachers. She says her biggest business challenge is collecting debts owed by clients. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to open a saloon. Her business goal is to run a hotel and own more restaurants within 5 years.

loans.use: to open a saloon

loans.name: Joseph Charo

texts.en: Joseph is a 34 year old single man. He describes himself as business-oriented and honest. He operates a restaurant where he sells food and snacks. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in Mishomoroni, a suburb of Mombasa, and his primary customers are students and teachers. He says his biggest business challenges are collecting debts owed by clients and insecurity. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to open another restaurant. His business goal is to run three more restaurants within 5 years.

loans.use: To open another restaurant

loans.name: Saida Mwinyi

texts.en: Saida is a 36 year old married woman. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail shop where she sells household goods like drinks, maize flour, detergents, etc. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in Mishomoroni, a suburb of Mombasa, and her primary customers are students, teachers and new customers. She says her biggest business challenges are inadequate capital and the increasing price of goods. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of household goods. Her business goal is to run more retail stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to add to her stock of household goods

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
A sus 25 años de edad, John fredy es un emprendedor que en el futuro espera tener una agencia turìstica reconocida que genere empleo para personas de la zona, por ahora y desde hace tres meses en el municipio de Girardota cerca de Medellìn este joven inició con su negocio en un pequeño espacio en el que ofrece sus servicios de alquiler de fincas. 

Actualmente necesita de un prèstamo para comprar equipos para adecuar mejor su oficina, asì como para realizar publicidad que le permita darse a conocer en la zona y posicionar poco a poco su negocio.
texts.en:
At 25 years of age, John Fredy is an entrepreneur who, in the future, hopes to own a well-known tourist agency which provides work to people in his area.  This young man started his business three months ago, in the town of Girardota, near Medellín.  He works in a small space and offers his services renting out rural holiday homes. 

John Fredy currently needs a loan to buy equipment so that he can better fit out his office and advertise his business so that he can become known in his area and gradually position his business in the market.

loans.use: to buy office and advertising equipment

loans.name: Jennifer Ncororo

texts.en: Jennifer is a 34 year old single woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be businesslady. She operates a retail shop where she sells household goods like drinks, maize flour, detergents e.t.c. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located mishomoroni in Mombasa town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to add stock of goods. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of household goods. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of household products

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
Teresa es una de las socias de Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción, tiene 33 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos, estudiantes de primaria y secundaria,  y con su compañero y padre de los niños. No tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, solamente término la escuela, debido a la condición económica tan difícil en la que vivía su familia, por ello se vio obligada a trabajar desde muy joven para contribuir con sus padres.  
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y con muchas ganas de superarse, realiza varias actividades productivas, como la avicultura, venta de huevos, también vende abarrotes, comestibles y otros productos para  el hogar. El crédito es de mucha ayuda porqué le va a permitir invertir en la compra de materia prima, como gallinas, pollos y alimentos. Sus objetivos son claros, y sus sueños son los que le dan la fuerza para seguir adelante, se ha propuestos; agrandar su gallinero y aumentar la producción de huevos, así como tener una pequeña pulpería en su casa, para colaborar con los ingresos de su hogar, darles estudios a sus hijos,  y en general mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
Con Teresa, están Gerardina, Irene y Nidia que también va a invertir en la Avicultura.
texts.en:
Teresa is one of the members of the 'Mujeres en Acción' Women's Bank.  She is 33 years old and lives with her two children, who are studying at elementary school and high school, and her partner (the children's father).  Teresa didn't have the opportunity to continue her education.  She only finished elementary school owing to the difficult economic circumstances in which her family lived.  She had to work from a very young age in order to contribute towards the household alongside her parents.

Teresa is a very hard-working woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She carries out a number of business activities such as poultry farming and selling eggs.  She also sells groceries, food and other household products.  This loan is very helpful because it will allow her to invest in buying raw materials such as hens, chickens and feed.  Her aims are clear and her dreams are what give her the strength to keep making progress.  Her goals are to expand her hen house and to increase her egg production.  She would also like to have a small grocery store in her home so that she can contribute towards her household income, provide her children with an education and generally improve her family's quality of life.

Together with Teresa are Gerardina, Irene and Nidia who will also invest in poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy hens, chickens and concentrate

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as pants, polo shirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Bwanjuma

texts.en: Bwanjuma is a 23 year old married man. He has a son who is 2 years old. He describes himself to be an enterpreneur. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located mkomani in Mombasa town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation of the charcoal. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal. Bwanjuma's business goal is to run many charcoal stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Dilana

texts.es:
Dilana 
Comercio
150000
	Dilana es una joven de 23 años de edad quién acaba de empezar a vivir en pareja, actualmente no tienen hijos, viven en un barrio de Puntarenas llamado Fray Casiano, su mayor deseo es trabajar y formar su capital para tener una mejor calidad de vida dada las condiciones sociales del lugar donde viven. 
	Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior que comercializa directamente con un importador que vive en San Ramón, ciudad a unos 50 Km de donde vive, él le da un mes de crédito para que ella coloque el producto y recupere el dinero. El objetivo de este préstamo es aprovechar el gran aumento que se da en el comercio por la época de fin de año y adquirir un poco más de mercadería para obtener una mayor ganancia. Dilana sale a vender y cobrar en bicicleta todas las tardes ya que por las mañanas está llevando cursos de computación que imparte la Universidad de Costa Rica.
	Su meta más importante es salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida, ser una mejor empresaria y triunfar en el negocio. Ella dice que los obstáculos son para los conformistas y miedosos una microempresaria tiene que ver para adelante sacar provecho de los problemas ya que estos siempre van a estar presentes.
texts.en:
Dilana is a young woman of 23 who has just started living with her partner.  They do not currently have children.  They live in a neighborhood of Puntarenas called Fray Casiano.  Dilana's biggest wish is to work and create capital so that she can enjoy a better quality of life given the social conditions of the place where she lives.

Dilana's business is selling underwear.  She works directly with an importer who lives in San Ramón: a city 50km from where she lives.  He gives her a month's credit so that she can sell her products and recover her money.  The aim of this loan is to make the most of a large increase in her sales which she experiences during the end-of-year season.  She will acquire a little more merchandise so that she can make more profits.  Dilana goes out on her bicycle to sell her products and collect payment every afternoon because in the mornings she attends courses in computing at the University of Costa Rica.

Dilana's most important goal is to get ahead and improve her quality of life.  She would like to become a better businesswoman and be successful in her business.  She says that obstacles are for conformists and cowards.  A micro businesswoman has to know how to derive benefit from problems as they will always be there.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, mainly underwear, which she distributes in her town

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en: Jamil is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has been working as a car and motorcycle dealer since 2008. On the other hand, he newly started to work in a local company with the intention of earning higher income. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to close a deal and purchase a new car then sell it and make good profits. In the future, he plans to open his own cars and motorcycles show room.

loans.use: purchase a new car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to resume car payments.

loans.name: Odunga Paul

texts.en: Odunga is a single man. He describes himself to be energetic, jovial and respectful. He operates a motorbike transport services where he provides transportation by motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in kisumu and his primary customers are students, passersby and local traders. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity especially at night. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy spare parts. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Pamela Achieng

texts.en: Pamela is married and has two children at age of three and seven years.She runs a boutique where she sells ladies bags, shoes, body oil, etc to frequent and new customers. She has been running this business for four years. Her business faces a problem of lacking a permanent place to work from. She wants a loan of Kshs 15,000 to buy a sewing machine, bags and shoes. In the future, Pamela sees herself as a supplier of school uniforms to schools and other institutions. She describes herself as honest, charistmatic and obedient.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid
Comercio
500000
	Ingrid  tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la zona de Puntarenas en el Pacífico de Costa Rica, ella ha participado con Fundación Mujer en créditos grupales pero esta es su primera experiencia con el crédito individual, ella vive con su esposo e hijo quien está en la escuela, se dedica al comercio y es la herramienta que utiliza para apoyar económicamente al hogar desde hace cerca de 10 años.
	Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y bisutería que comercializa por medio de catálogos.  El objetivo de este préstamo es aprovechar el gran aumento que se da en el comercio por la época de fin de año y adquirir un poco más de mercadería para obtener una mayor ganancia. Sale a vender y cobrar por las tardes una vez que ha terminado las labores de la casa, que es una de la característica principal de las clientas de Fundación Mujer. 
	Su meta más importante es que su negocio crezca, tener un local propio y poder ayudar a que su hijo sea un profesional, aportar más a la casa y tener una mejor calidad de vida. La limitante de dinero es el obstáculo más grande que ha enfrentado, al vivir en una zona pobre no se cuenta siempre con el dinero para invertir y los clientes en ocasiones se pueden atrasar en los pagos por esta misma razón.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 36 years old and lives in Puntarenas, on the Pacific coast of Costa Rica.  She has previously worked with Fundación Mujer group loans but this is her first experience with an individual loan.  Ingrid lives with her husband and her son who is in elementary school.  Ingrid buys and sells products and this is the tool that she has been using to financially support her household for nearly 10 years.

Ingrid's business is selling underwear and jewelry which she sells through catalogs.  The aim of this loan is to make the most of the large increase in sales which she experiences during the end-of-year season and to acquire a little more merchandise so that she can make more profits.  Ingrid goes out to sell her products and collect payment in the afternoons, once she has finished her household chores.  This is pretty typical of Fundación Mujer's clients.

Ingrid's most important goals are to grow her business, to own her own premises, to be able to help her son become a professional, to contribute more to her household and to enjoy a better quality of life.  A lack of money is the biggest obstacle that she has faced.  As she lives in a poor area, she doesn't always have money to invest in her business and her customers are occasionally late in making their payments for the same reason.

loans.use: to buy underwear for men, women and children, and household goods

loans.name: Peter Oduor

texts.en:
Peter Odour is single. He has rendered transportation services to students and staff of the Kisumu polytechnic school in Kisumu town for the last two years. The business is faced with the problem of lacking a place where there's shade when it gets sunny and when it rains. 

He wants a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts. Peter looks forward to expanding his business in the next five years. He describes himself as self-motivated, respectful and honest.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Calamarca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CALAMARCA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Luisa es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos, venta de lana, tienda de barrio, confección de chamarras.

La señora Luisa  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de lana que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de un amigo.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá a las fabricas textileras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “CALAMARCA” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya regional office.  The group has ten members and is run by a board of directors which has Luisa as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: weaving, selling yarn, running a neighborhood store and making jackets.

Luisa tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through an invitation from a loan officer.  She currently has a store where she sells yarn which she has been running for years.  She learned the business from a friend.

The loan that Luisa is taking out now will be used to increase her capital, buying yarn which she will acquire in El Alto and then sell to textile factories.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has two children.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en: Here is a picture of Nanah, a small-scale businesswoman from the city of Makeni, in Northern Sierra Leone. Nanah was born in Makeni, about forty-six years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children. Nanah has been a businesswoman for the past fifteen years now. She sells “Bamaco” cloths and “gara” cloths (fabric dyed with gara leaves/ indigo dye). She also sells provisions – sardines, milk, sugar, butter, etc. With her loan, she is going to expand her business by buying Bamako and gara cloths, as well as provisions in large quantity to add to her present stock.

loans.use: to buy Bamako and gara cloths, and provisions in large quantity to add to her present stock

loans.name: El Cerrito El Carmen Group

texts.es:
La señora Flory Marizela es casada, estudio la educación básica, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la sastrería a la confección D. vestidos para damas, inició su negocio vendiendo ropa y haciendo costuras y al momento lleva 13 años D. experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a ser piloto.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra telas e hilos y tener mas producción, espera en el futuro tener un local propio y suficiente capital. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la tejeduría, venta D. ropa, al comercio y ate4nciob a tienda.
texts.en:
Flory Marizela is married and completed her primary education.  She has four children who are in school.  She works as a seamstress, making ladies' dresses.  She started her business selling clothes and sewing, and has 13 years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is a driver.

Flory Marizela set up a group to request a loan so that she could buy fabrics and threads, and thereby produce more.  She hopes, in the future, to own her own premises and have enough capital.  The other members of the group weave, sell clothes, buy and sell products, and run stores.

loans.use: to buy material for making clothes

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El sr. Francisco, tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, viven en la comunidad de Callapani del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba.
Trabaja en la agricultura, produce papa, cebolla y frejol y los vende en el mismo lugar.
Francisco es una persona responsable en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y la educación de sus hijos.  
El crédito que ha solicitado los va invertir en la compra de más semillas e insumos, aumentar más superficies de cultivo e incrementar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar la condición de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Francisco, 57, is married and lives in the community of Callapani in Mizque Municipality, Cochabamba Department.  He’s a farmer growing potatoes, onions and broad beans that he sells in the same place.  Francisco is a responsible person in his community because of the dedication he puts into his work and into his children’s education.  The loan he’s asked for is to buy seeds and supplies, to increase the surface area under cultivation and to increase production to earn higher income and improve his entire family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Mildred Atieno

texts.en: Mildred is 44 years old and is married to a businessman. They have six children ranging from fifteen to twenty-four years old. She has sold tablecloths for the last seven years to frequent customers at the Kangemi shopping centre in Nairobi. She wants a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy materials for embroidery. Mildred sees herself as a wholesaler of tablecloths. She describes herself as a focused woman.

loans.use: to buy materials for embroidery

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor  Adolfo es chofer propietario afiliado en uno de los  sindicatos de Choferes de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene dos movilidades de transporte de pasajeros en el sindicato ya mencionado. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de nuevas llantas para ambas movilidades que son sus herramientas de trabajo y la fuente de sus ingresos mensuales. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de  Alto Lima II la cual queda ubicada en  la Ciudad de  El Alto. Adolfo es soltero, tiene un hijo el que se queda a cargo de la abuela mientras Adolfo trabaja. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito de Impro y de Kiva.
texts.en: Adolfo is a driver/owner affiliated with one of the city of La Paz’s taxi driver syndicates.  He has two passenger transportation vehicles in said syndicate.  He needs the loan to buy new tires for both taxis which are his work tool and source of monthly income.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Alto Lima II zone.  Adolfo is single and has a son who he leaves in care of his grandmother while Adolfo goes to work.  This is the first time the client gets an Impro and Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy new tires for both his taxis.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica solicita un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto que le esta haciendo falta, ya que tiene cuatro hijos y necesitan su espacio en la casa. 
Necesita comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y arena. Y empezar la construcción. 
Doña Mónica es originaria de Veracruz y trabaja en una fabrica desde hace dos años y su esposo se encuentra trabajando como soldador en la ciudad de Monterrey, quien le esta ayudando con los gastos de sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos cuentan con tres meses de nacidos y son gemelos, por lo cual se preocupa en buscar mayor comodidad y espacio en la casa para ellos ya que solo cuenta con dos cuartos.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica is applying for a loan in order to begin construction of a room since she has four children and needs space in the house. She needs to purchase construction material such as cement blocks, rebar, and sand in order to begin building.

Doña Mónica is a native of Veracruz and has worked in a factory for two years. Her husband, whom she is helping with the expenses for their four children, works installing floors in the city of Monterrey. Two of their children are three month old twins. That’s why she is worried about seeking more comfort and space in her house, for she only has two rooms.

loans.use: to begin construction of a room.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Amparo madre de un hijo y quien trabaja hace un año en su tienda, que en sus inicios se comprendida sólo de la venta de bolis y mekato, quiere salir adelante luego de superar las dificultades economicas resultantes de las deudas que sus clientes anteriores no le cancelaron.

Actualmente la señora Amparo desea comprar surtido con el objetivo de aumentar las ventas y asi en un futuro poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Amparo has a son and has been working for the last year in her store which started out just selling bolis [frozen treats] and mekatos [snacks].  She wants to get ahead after having overcome the difficulties caused by previous customers who did not pay their accounts.  Amparo now wants to buy assorted stock merchandise to increase sales and in future be able to enlarge the store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda
Costura
500000
	Esmeralda  vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, ella tiene 48 años de edad y vive sola, se dedica a la fabricación de ropa y otras prendas que elabora con sus máquinas en un pequeño taller en su casa. Se dedica a hacer trajes de baño, pantalones, camisas, ropa intima, blusas entre otros.
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar materia prima para la elaboración de estas prendas, aprovechar la entrada de la época de verano que incrementa el comercio en esta zona costera. Se realizan ferias y otras actividades sobre una calle llena de turistas que desean adquirir varios productos que allí se ofrecen. Ella se levanta temprano y deja la casa arreglada, realiza luego los encargos de los clientes y  va a distribuirlos por la tarde.
	Entre sus metas destaca el ser positiva ante los problemas de trabajo y económicos que se enfrenta, tratar bien a sus clientes cobrando lo justo y dar lo mejor de sí en cada prenda que elabora. En el trabajo no ha tenido problemas pero si surgen los va a enfrentar con mucho dinamismo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda
Tailoring
500000

Esmeralda lives in the 20 de Noviembre neighborhood in Puntarenas, a place with much poverty and social problems.  She is 48 years old and lives alone.  She manufactures clothing and other garments that she makes on her machines in a small home-based workshop.  She makes bathing suits, pants, shirts, underwear and blouses, among others.

This loan’s objective is to buy more raw materials to make these garments and take advantage of the beginning of the summer season which is when commerce along this coastal zone increases.  Street markets and other activities take place along a street that’s full of tourists who want to buy the various items offered there.  She rises early to straighten up the house and then makes the items she has on order from customers to deliver them in the evening.

Among her goals, staying positive in the face of economic and work problems stands out as well as treating her customers well, charging fair prices and putting the best of herself into each garment she makes.  She’s had no problems at work so far but if they do crop up she will face them with much dynamism.

loans.use: to buy clothesmaking supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his son’s university education fees and cover his other child’s school fees

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 6 dependents. Ekua sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Eguafo, which she has done for the past 15 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase bulk maize for the kenkey preparation. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business

loans.use: purchase bulk maize for the kenkey preparation

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alberto es originario de la ciudad de Veracruz y su esposa es originaria de la ciudad de México. Don Pedro Alberto elabora como guardia de seguridad escolar, y por las tardes El y su familia se dedican a recolectar productos para  reciclar como es plásticos y aluminio, y los fines de semana su esposa elaborar comida mexicano (menudo)  para vender y así ayudar a los gastos familiares, ya que cuentan con cuatro hijos de edad escolar, y desean sacar a delante a sus hijos y que tengan un mejor futuro. 
Solicitan el préstamo para comprar un triciclo, porque el que tiene actual ya esta en muy malas condiciones. Ya teniendo un nuevo podrán trasladar más fácil la mercancía.
texts.en: Pedro Alberto is from the city of Veracruz and his wife is from Mexico City.  Pedro works as a school security guard and in the afternoons he and his family collect recyclables like plastic and aluminum.  On weekends, his wife prepares Mexican food (menudo) to sell and help with household expenses because they have four school aged children and they want to raise their children so that they’ll have a better future.  They request the loan to buy a tricycle cart because the one he currently owns is in very poor condition.  Having a new one will make transporting the merchandise easier.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle cart to use for recycling.

loans.name: Tanutsu Women Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tanutsu Women” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of 1,200,000.00 SLL for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fanta. Fanta is age thirty-seven; she was born in Bo city, in Southern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is residing in Makeni, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For eight years now, Fanta has been selling cloths: cotton cloths. With this loan, she will buy bales of cloths to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of cloths to add to her business

loans.name: Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La joven Leniz Yolanda tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, reside en el Barrio Jesus en el municipio de Juticalpa, y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz.

Leniz se graduó en la carrera de Administracion de Empresas y por varios meses anduvo buscando trabajo y no pudo encontrar alguno. Entonces como ella tenía la urgente necesidad de ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento del hogar, decidió crear su propio negocio y fue asi como se le ocurrió instalar una tortilleria, y aunque al inicio fue algo pequeño al dia de hoy ya cuenta con dos empleadas y tiene dos años de haber inaugurado su negocio. Su horario de atencion al cliente inicia a las 4 am y culmina a las 12 del mediodia. Su principal desventaja es que paga un alquiler muy alto, pero gracias a Dios tiene muchos clientes y nunca a tenido problemas con el pago del local.

El prestamo que Leniz está solicitando lo necesita para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y maseca. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella y sus empleadas podrán seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos que les permitiran cubrir algunos de los gastos del hogar. 

El sueño de Leniz es tener su propia casa y tambien su propio local, ya que gran parte de sus ganancias se van en el pago de alquiler del local. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
The young woman Leniz Yolanda is 24 years old. She is married and has a small son, age 4. She lives in the Jesus neighborhood in the municipality of Juticalpa and makes and sells corn tortillas.

Leniz graduated with a degree in business administration and was looking for work for several months but wasn’t able to find anything. Then, since she had an urgent need to help her family support the household, she decided to start her own business. That’s how she began her tortilla shop, and, although at first it was a small business, today she already has two employees. She began the business two years ago.

Her work day begins at 4:00 a.m. and ends at noon. Her main drawback is that her rent is very high, but, thanks to God, she has a lot of customers and has never had problems paying for the shop.

Leniz needs the loan she is applying for in order to purchase corn, firewood, lime, and corn flour. With the support of this loan she and her employees will be able to continue having a source of income that will permit them to cover some of their household expenses.

Leniz’s dream is to have her own house and also her own shop since a large part of her earnings goes to pay rent. This is her first cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make all her installment payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime, and corn flour.

loans.name: Xenia

texts.es:
Xenia
Pulpería
500000
	Xenia vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, ella tiene 45 años de edad y vive con sus 2 hijos de ellos uno es menor de edad, tiene una pulpería (distribuidora de productos) y además se dedica a la elaboración de comidas típicas costarricenses como tamales y vigorones que vende los fines de semana en su casa obteniendo así ingresos para apoyar a su familia siendo el único ingreso de la casa. 
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las comidas, ya que es tradición de los Ticos comer tamales en la época de Diciembre además de abastecer su negocio con mercadería. Ella tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en estas actividades, pero los problemas económicos hacen que las personas busque el apoyo de instituciones como Fundación Mujer para temporadas especiales y en este caso ella ha trabajado con un grupo en la zona llamado Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas que ha a poyado a otras mujeres con crédito para sus negocios.
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que sus hijos y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar a que su negocio crezca cada día más. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Xenia
Grocery Store
500000

Xenia lives in the 20 de Noviembre neighborhood in Puntarenas, a place of much poverty and social problems.  She’s 45 years old and lives with her two children one of which is a minor.  She has a grocery store and also makes traditional Costa Rican dishes like tamales and vigorón [pork rinds, cassava, cabbage and sauce] that she sells on weekends at home earning income to support her family since this is the household’s only source of income.

This loan’s purpose is to buy raw materials to make the dishes since it’s traditional for “Ticos” [Costa Ricans] to eat tamales during the Christmas season and also to buy merchandise to stock her store.  She has more than ten years’ experience in these activities but economic problems push a person to seek support from institution like Fundación Mujer for special seasons and in this case she has worked with a group in the zone called “Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas” that has supported other women with loans for their businesses.

Among her goals, getting ahead so her children and she can have a better future stands out as well as that they can study and to support her business so that it will grow more each day.  For now, the greatest difficulty she faces is the economy but they have found that this program is a help for their micro businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and to buy ingredients to make traditional Costa Rican dishes.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 35 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales uno, el mayor vive a lado de su padre, mientras que los dos menores de 11 y 10 años viven con ella, ya que son hijos de su conviviente. Juntos habitan en casa de su madre junto a sus dos hijos, su madre y sus hermanos. Ella día a día se esfuerza mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños quienes son su razón de existir. El trabajo de Ana, consiste en la venta de pasamanería de forma ambulante, entre las cosas que vende, ofrece juguetes, collares, aretes, pulseras y otras cosas que usan como accesorios sobre todo para las niñas. Sale a diario en busca de sus clientes para ofrecer sus buenos y novedosos productos. Lleva trabajando con esta actividad por tres años, lo hace sola y aunque ahora esta muy bien preparada para hacer su trabajo, ya que antes tenía muchas dificultades como el de no saber que estrategia usar para llegar al cliente, ahora es muy buena en lo que hace y día a día se supera más y más. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo como ella desea, además que tiene muy buena ganancias ya que gana un promedio del 50% de su inversión. Espera mas adelante poner una tienda, pero por ahora lo que más desea es invertir en su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy emocionada al saber que tendrá un respaldo económico para poder seguir con su inversión, así mismo se compromete en ser muy cumplida con sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mas mercadería, entre juguetes, collares, pulseras y otros accesorios para su venta.
texts.en:
Ana, 35, is a good and friendly woman, the mother of three children.  The oldest lives with his father but the two youngest, 10 and 11, live with her since they are the sons of her partner.  They live in her mother’s house: her two children, her mother and the brothers and sisters.
Every day she puts in a big effort to offer a better quality of life to her children who are her reason for being.  She is a street merchant selling accessories and items such as toys, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, etc, especially for girls.  She goes out daily looking for customers to offer her new and good quality products.  She has been in this business for three years working on her own and now she is well prepared.   In the past she had many problems because she didn’t know how to approach customers, but now she is good at it and every day she gets better.  What she likes most about her work is that it allows her to make her own schedule. She also has good earnings; she gets an average of 50% over the money she puts in. In the future she would like to set up a store, but for now she just wants to invest in her business.  This will be her first loan with MFP. She is very excited knowing that she will have financial support to continue with her business, and she promises to make all the payments on time.  She will use the requested money to buy more merchandise such as toys, necklaces, bracelets, and other accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy toys, necklaces and bracelets

loans.name: Shady

texts.en: Shady is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and only child who is still attending school. He has been involved in the construction field for the past 11 years. In 2008, he started to work independently using his own tractor. Today, he is asking to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to equip his tractor with the needed supplies to facilitate his business operations. In the future, he plans to buy another tractor and hire an employee in order to work on additional projects.

loans.use: equip his tractor with the needed supplies

loans.name: Fady

texts.en: Fady is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He’s the main income provider of the family. He has owned a laundry for the past 26 years. His work is specialized in ironing clothes, textiles, curtain etc, in addition to cleaning them using particular products. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. In that way, he will avoid having any financiA. problem with the school management and will allow his children to pursue their education properly.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen 
Comercio
500000
	Carmen ha sido una líder en la zona de Puntarenas para el apoyo de mujeres que desean superarse y salir a delante, vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, tiene 52 años de edad y vive con sus 3 hijos y tiene un nieto. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijos, una de ellas es enfermera; además de agrupar mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras para apoyarlas con crédito por parte de Fundación Mujer, siendo el único ingreso de la casa. 
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar mercadería, como productos de catálogo y electrodomésticos, que va a comprar a un deposito libre muy conocido en la zona Sur de Costa Rica, aprovechando la época donde hay muchos ingresos por aguinaldo y ahorros y la gente desea comprar artículos ya se para regalar  o para auto regalarse, situación que la clienta, por su experiencia y conocimiento del mercado aprovecha. Carmen también perteneció al Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas que ha apoyado a otras mujeres con crédito para sus negocios.
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que sus hijos y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar a que su negocio crezca cada día más. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Carmen has been a leader in the Puntarenas area in supporting women who want to excel and get ahead. She lives in Barrio 20 de Noviembre in Puntarenas, a place of great poverty and many social problems. She is 52 and lives with her three children and has a grandson. Through a lot of effort and hard work she has succeeded in providing her children with an education (one of whom is now a nurse) and has also brought together hardworking and enterprising women in order to advocate for their loans from Fundación Mujer, since they are often the only income-earners in their households. 

This loan is to buy merchandise, such as catalog products and household appliances, that she is going to purchase in the duty free shopping zone, well known in the southern part of Costa Rica, and take advantage of the season when there are a lot of Christmas bonuses and savings and people want to buy items, whether to give to others or to themselves, a situation that the client, due to her experience and knowledge of the market, knows how to capitalize on.

Carmen also belonged to the Mujer Creciendo Juntas communal bank, which has supported other women with loans for their businesses.

Among her goals, getting ahead stands out, so that she and her children will have a better future; so that they can get more education and she will have support for her business to grow more each day.  For now, the greatest difficulty has been the economy; however she has found support for her small business in this program.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of catalog merchandise and small household appliances.

loans.name: Bety

texts.es: Bety, de 29 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos son mayores e independientes mientras que dos son menores y de 18 y 10 años quienes estudian y aun dependen de ella. Juntos habitan en una casa propia en donde comparten sus días a lado de su conviviente quien se esfuerza mucho al igual que ella para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Bety consiste en la venta de abarrotes, ella se encarga de comprar al por mayor que es cuando le dan los precios más cómodos y los vende al menudeo agregándole un porcentaje a sus precios, además de éste trabajo, ella se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi de los cuales uno maneja su hijo y a otro lo alquila obteniendo así ganancias por cada uno. Lleva trabajando con este negocio ya por cuatro años y lo hace sola, pues su conviviente se dedica a otras actividades. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer y manejar su tiempo como a ella mejor le parece, cuenta que no fue fácil al momento de emprender este negocio ya que las dudas y los temores le embargaban, pero poco a poco fue tomando más fuerza y ahora es muy buena en lo que hace,. Ella se propuso un objetivo, que es ampliar su negocio y brindar mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo numero 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su negocio, Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1600 soles, comprará productos para su tienda, además mandará a arreglar sus dos vehículos para que estén en mejores condiciones ya que se deterioraron por el mal estado de la calles de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Bety, 29, is a good, friendly and very responsible woman. She lives with her partner with whom she has four children, two of whom are adults and independent, while two are still minors and, at 18 and 10 years of age, are still in school and dependent on her. Together they live in their own house where she shares her days with her partner, who works as hard as she does to provide the family with a better quality of life.

Bety’s work is selling groceries; she buys wholesale when she gets the best prices and then sells retail, adding a percentage to her prices. In addition to this, she also rents out motor taxis, one to her son and the other to someone else and receives an income from each one. She has had her businesses for four years and she runs them alone, since her partner works elsewhere.  What she likes about her work is that it permits her to manage and dispose of her time the way she wants. She states that it was not easy to start her businesses for she was overwhelmed by doubts and fears; nevertheless, little by little she worked harder and now she is very good at what she does.  

Her goal is to expand her grocery store and provide her customers with a greater number of products. This will be her 15th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support since she will feel more assured of progressing in her business. She is again committed to making her payments on time. With the sum requested, 1,600 soles, she will buy products for her store and will also send her two vehicles for repair so they will be in better shape since they had deteriorated due to the bad state of the streets in her city.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana
Tienda
500000
	Juana vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, tiene 43 años de edad y vive con sus 3 hijos que estudian actualmente. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo  además del apoyo de Fundación Mujer desde hace más de 15 años ha logrado establecer una tienda donde vende ropa y artículos personales, ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijos, adquirir otros bienes, siendo el único ingreso de la casa. 
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar mercadería, como productos de principalmente ropa de temporada ya que se está en ese cambio en Costa Rica de la época lluviosa a la época seca (verano) por lo que la oportunidad de variar el producto no se puede desaprovechar, situación que la clienta, por su experiencia y conocimiento del mercado realiza con anticipación. Juana también perteneció al Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas que ha apoyado a otras mujeres con crédito para sus negocios pero por el nivel que ella tiene requiere realizar una mayor inversión para su micro empresa.
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que sus hijos y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar a que su negocio crezca cada día más. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, y en parte la competencia que le pueden hacer las personas que venden por catálogo, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento y por su experiencia ha logrado mantener una cartera de clientes.
texts.en:
Juana lives in Barrio 20 de Noviembre in Puntarena, a place of great poverty and many social problems. She is 43 and lives with her three children who are currently in school. Fifteen years ago, through a lot of hard work as well as the support of Fundación Mujer, she was able to start a shop where she sells clothing and personal articles. As the only income earner for her household, she has been able to provide her children with an education as well as acquire other goods.

The purpose of this loan is to purchase merchandise, principally seasonal clothing since Costa Rica is already changing from the rainy to the dry season (winter) and she has the opportunity to vary her product line and wants to take advantage of a season when her clients, based on her experience and knowledge of the market, look forward to buying new clothes. 

Juana also belongs to the Mujer Creciendo Juntas communal bank, which has supported other women with loans for their businesses, however in her case, because of her level of operations she needs to make a larger investment in her small business.

Among her goals, getting ahead stands out, so that she and her children will have a better future; so that they can get more education and she will have support for her business to grow more each day. For now the greatest difficulty has been the economy and, in part, the competition from those who sell by catalog. Nevertheless she has found support for her small business from this program and through experience she has succeeded in maintaining a portfolio of customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the changing season.

loans.name: Jacinta Pamela

texts.es:
Jacinta Pamela es socia nueva y participa en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Jacinta Pamela nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 21 años de edad, ella trabaja como administradora de una empresa de venta de celulares móviles. Ya son seis meses que se dedica al trabajo y le va muy bien gracias al desempeño laboral que pone en la empresa.  Jacinta Pamela y su mama tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de artesanía de tipo cerámica y platería.   

Jacinta Pamela requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambre de plata y otras cosas más.

Jacinta Pamela se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Jacinta Pamela is a new and participative member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Las Palmeras” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Jacinta Pamela was born in Cusco and is 21 years old.  She works as a manager at a mobile phone sales firm.  She’s been in her job for six months and does well thanks to the work effort she puts into the firm.  Jacinta Pamela and her mother have a family business consisting in selling ceramic and silver crafts.  Jacinta Pamela needs the loan to buy supplies like silver wire, for example, and other things.  Jacinta Pamela is grateful for the opportunity given her through this means and commits to make her installment payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies like silver wire and other things.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi, de 40 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, en toda su vida demostró ser una mujer muy luchadora y pujante ya que como es madre soltera, tuvo que criar a sus dos hijos sola, ellos tienen 16 y 11 años, y gran parte de lo logrado hasta ahora por ellos es por que siempre tuvieron una madre buena que siempre trabaja para brindarles lo mejor. Juntos habitan en una casa propia en donde ella les brinda educación y alimentación por que desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Deysi consiste en la cría de aves de corral, en la huerta de su casa, acondicionó un espacio muy amplio en donde tiene su corral y  cría entre 50 y 100 pollos. Cuando están listos para venderlos se va al mercado de su ciudad, para ofrecerlos  a sus principales clientes que siempre están a la expectativa dicho producto.
