Lleva trabajando con esta actividad ya por seis años y le sirvió para poder salir adelante y progresar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo, aunque al principio se enfrentó con muchos problemas, entre ellos el de no saber como el proceso completo o de no saber que tendría que ponerles su vacuna a cada pollo, pero ahora es todo una experta y cada día mejora en la crianza de estos animales. Este será el préstamo número 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará pollitos para iniciar con su crianza y alimento balanceados, además de algunas vitaminas y vacunas necesarias para el buen de las aves.
texts.en:
Deysi, 40, is a good, kind, very hardworking woman.  All her life she’s demonstrated being a very determined, strong woman who as a single mother had to raise her two children by herself.  Her children are now 16 and 11 years old and much of what she’s accomplished has been for them because they always had a good mother who always worked to give them the very best.  They live together in their own house where she provides them with education and food because she wants them to have a better quality of life.

Deysi’s work consists in raising barnyard fowl in her orchard.  She set aside an ample space for her corral and she raises between 50 and 100 chicks.  When they are ready to be sold she goes to her local market to sell them to her main customers who are always waiting for her products.  She’s been in this business for six years now and it's allowed her to prosper and get ahead.

What she likes about her work is that it allows her to manage her own time.  Although at first she faced many problems, among them not knowing the entire process or not knowing that she had to apply certain vaccinations to each chick, now she is quite expert and every day her care of these animals improves.

This will be MFP loan #14.  She is very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because that way she’ll feel sure to make progress with the business.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy chicks to start to raise and will buy nutritionally balanced feed as well as some vitamins and vaccines needed for the wellbeing of the fowl.

loans.use: to buy baby chicks, feed, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Silverio Prudencio

texts.es:
Silverio, es un hombre casado de 40 años de edad, tiene  dos hijos en etapa escolar,  él se dedica  a la pesca, escogió este tipo de trabajo, ya que desde muy niño su Padre lo realizaba.
Silverio es un hombre  luchador,  perseverante y muy responsable con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia.

Silverio,  empezó su negocio en el año 1991 , gana semanalmente S/.300 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y 7 días a la semana. Con el préstamo de S/. 3000  soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Silverio terminará de construir su casa  Su sueño de Silverio es tener su propio auto, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas.

Silverio lives and works in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
texts.en:
Silverio, 40, is married and has two children in school. He is a fisherman, and chose this type of work from a young age, as his father was also a fisherman. He is a hardworking, persevering and very responsible person with a great desire to help his family get ahead.

Silverio started his business in 1991 and makes S/.300 new soles each week. Every day he works about 10 hours per day, 7 days a week. With this loan of S/.3000 thanks to Kiva, he will finish building his house. HIs dream is to have his own car. Silverio's loan officer thinks that he is an excellent client and will make his payments on time.

Silverio lives and works in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

loans.use: to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Derley Del Carmen

texts.es:
A sus 43 años de edad la señora Derley acompañada de sus familiares más cercanos como lo son su prima y su sobrino, trabajan todos los dias en una jornada de 7 am a 9 pm en su negocio en el cual venden pollos a la Broaster. A cargo de su único hijo, la señora Derley trabaja intensamente para salir adelante luego de haber quedado sola con la responsabilidad del negocio puesto que su hermano con quien inicialmente habia comprado el negocio se aburrio y así ella quedó encargada de todo.

Derley sueña con tener otra sucursal de su negocio y tener su propio local. Con el dinero comprará surtido, pintará su restaurante y organizará una humedad que hay en el local; a su vez espera generar un empleo adicional con motivo de la temporada de diciembre que se aproxima con la cual espera aumentaran sus ventas.
texts.en:
At the age of 43, Derley and her nearest relatives, her cousin and nephew, work every day from 7am until 9pm in their business where they sell Broaster-style chicken.  As sole caregiver for her only son, Derley works intensely to get ahead having been left alone with the responsibility of the business because her brother that she initially started it with became bored so she ended up in charge of the entire operation.

Derley dreams with having another branch of her business and to own her locale.  She will use the money to buy supplies, will paint the restaurant and will take care of some dampness that’s in the locale.  At the same time, she hopes to generate an additional job because of the December season that’s approaching which is when sales increase.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to do improvements to the locale.

loans.name: Bombé

texts.fr:
Mme Bombé  est une dame qui parait plus jeune que son âge : elle a 71 ans et habite aux environs de la caisse. Elle est  mariée et mère de famille.
Elle exerce le commerce depuis plus de 2 ans avec la vente de fruits : orange, banane, pomme…
Avec les  bénéfices elle  participe à la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
Mrs. Bombé is a 71-year-old lady who looks younger than she is. She is married with children, and she lives near the credit union. 

She has been selling fruit such as oranges, bananas and apples for over two years. She uses her revenue to help with the daily expenditures

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and apples for resale

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a single parent and has 6 dependents. Faustina has been selling provisions for the past 11 years now at Dompoase.  She uses her income to provide for her children's need. She will use her loan to purchase more provisions for sale.  Flaustina hope to use the profits she makes to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for sale

loans.name: Andrea Estefania

texts.es:
La Srta. Andrea Estefhania de 19 años de edad, vive en la zona de Tahuantinsuyo en el distrito de Comas. Es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho y Ciencias Polìticas, ha iniciado el segundo ciclo de su carrera. Su mayor aspiraciòn es llegar a ser una buena profesional y poder apoyar económicamente a sus padres.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en el pago de las mensualidades de su carrera y algunos libros que le han solicitado.
texts.en: Andrea Estefhanía, 19, lives in the Tahuantinsuyo zone in Comas District.  She is majoring in Law and Political Science and has started the second cycle in her studies.  Her greatest wish is to become a great professional and to be able to help her parents economically.	The requested loan will be used to pay monthly tuition and to buy some required textbooks.

loans.use: to pay monthly tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloths and goods for sale

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Pedro nació en la provincia de Chumbivilca y tiene 45 años de edad, él trabaja en un hotel de mucho prestigiosa en el área de limpieza. Ya son 20 años que trabaja en el hotel y le va muy bien. 

Pedro requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar ósea para la educación de sus hijos. 

Pedro se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Pedro belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Las Palmeras” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Pedro was born in Chumbivilca Province and he’s 45 years old.  He works in a very prestigious hotel in the maintenance area.  He’s been working in the hotel for 20 years now and does very well.  Pedro needs the loan for a family expense; that is, to pay for his children’s education.   Pedro is grateful for the opportunity provided him by this means and commits to make his payments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to pay his children's schooling cost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk maize.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Primavera” es un comité que está integrado por 8 mujeres con muy buena organización, unidas y por sobre todo muy trabajadoras. Estas señoras son D. la ciudad D. Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas y nos comentan que se reúnen quincenalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayudarse unas a las otras para que D. esa forma puedan lograr los objetivos que ellas tienen. Estas señoras están muy animadas para seguir participando en este programa D. microcrédito, pues les ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos y D. esa forma mejorar sus estilo D. vida.
Una D. ellas es la señoras es Vicenta, ella se dedica a las artesanías, ella hace todo tipo D. frazadas, camisas bordadas y demás. Comenta que se ha dedicado a esto hace ya mucho tiempo, y que este ha sido el medio con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Quiere seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra D. tela, hilos, agujas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Primavera” group has 8 members; they are very well organized, united and above all, very hardworking.  These women are from the city of Villarrica; they are all neighbors and friends and they comment that they meet every two weeks to proviD. support for each other and to help each other so that they can reach their goals together.  These women are very enthusiastic about continuing to participate in this micro loan program because it helps them improve their income and through it their standard of living.

One of the women is Vicenta.  She is a craftswoman.  She makes all sorts of blankets, embroidered shirts and others.  She comments that she’s been doing this for a long time now and that it’s been her source of support to raise her family.  She wants to continue growing so has asked for the loan to buy fabric, thread, needles and other things to resupply and continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells corn dough at Dompoase. She has six dependents and has been selling corn dough for five years. Efua uses her income to provide for her family. She will use her loan to purchase bulk maize for the dough. Ekua plans to expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase bulk maize for dough.

loans.name: Chelsea Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Chelsea” group. They are small-scale businessmen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. Previous loans have made a lot of improvements in the business and lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 2,700,000 SLL in order to further expand their respective businesses. 

Gibo is the leader of this two-man group. He was born in the Kambia district of Northern Sierra Leone. Gibo is married and has two children – one in primary school and the other is not of school-going age. Gibo has been a businessman for fifteen years now. He owns a grocery kiosk. He sells drinks, sugar, toothpastes, etc. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy more food stuff to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, toothpastes, etc. to add to his business

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor integrante del Banco comunal “Fuerza de Mujer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de verduras, huevos, condimentos, carbón, entre otros, en un puesto que tiene ubicado en una feria libre. Ahí trabaja todos los días de la semana en un horario de 10ºº a 19ºº horas.
Se dedica a éste negocio desde hace tres años, comenta que le ha ido muy bien y que su clientela va en expansión.
Su mercadería la compra cada 15 días, en diferentes comercios, donde los precios sean convenientes económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará yerbas, condimentos y papas, para abastecer su negocio. 
Las metas para su negocio son habilitar un local en su casa y abastecerlo con mercadería, de esta manera sería más cómodo para ella.  
Leonor vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños a nivel personal son comprar una camioneta que le permita trasladar su mercadería, ya que actualmente debe pagar fletes (alquiler de un medio de transporte para trasladar mercadería) todos los días de la semana. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta que disfruta de las reuniones del grupo del Banco comunal, ya que los integrantes son muy unidos, responsables, en definitiva dice que es un excelente grupo.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido a distribuir sus ingresos y gastos de mejor manera, lo que le ha permitido mantener su negocio organizado. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Leonor, a member of the communal bank "Fuerza de Mujer," lives in the city of Temuco.  She works in retail trade, specifically, selling vegetables, eggs, condiments, coal, and other items in a stall located in a free market.  There she works each day of the week from 10am until 7pm.  

She has had this business for 3 years, and she comments that it is going very well and that her customer base is expanding. 

Leonor buys her merchandise every 15 days from different businesses, where the prices are most appealing.  With this loan she will buy herbs, condiments and potatoes to restock her store.

Her goals are to set up a place in her home for her business and to stock it with merchandise.  In this way, she would be more comfortable.   Leonor lives with her husband and one of her dreams at the personal level is to buy a van that would allow her to transport her merchandise, since now she has to pay freight charges (to rent some means of transport to move her merchandise) every day of the week.

Leonor is very happy and grateful for this opportunity that Fondo Esperanza is providing her to invest in her business.  In addition, she comments that she enjoys the meetings of her communal bank, since the members of her group are very united and responsible.  She says it's definitely a great group.

Through the training provided in the meetings, Leonor has learned how to distribute her earnings and expenses in a better way, which has allowed her to keep her business better organized.  Temuco is the capital of the La Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile.)  In the surrounding areas, there are a number of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica), and very eye-catching flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks. It’s worth pointing out that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous peoples of our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy herbs, condiments and potatoes to stock up her store

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Vilma tiene 36 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 20 años D. dedicarse al destazo D. vacas,  Vilma antes trabajaba para su papá quien le enseño la actividad, pero luego se independizo, por que ya conocía como se distribuía la carne y los clientes también la conocían.

Vilma compra las vacas, en una ciudad del oriente del país y tarda unas tres horas en llegar al lugar. Ella destaza dos vacas por semana y luego distribuye la carne y el hueso en las comunidades vecinas, se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. hasta terminar su mercadería.

Vilma solicita el préstamo, para comprar D. tres a cinco vacas, para destazarlas. Ella quiere aprovechar que en este momento que el precio D. las  vacas ha bajado y comprarlas a buen precio, D. esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias y destazara tres vacas a la semana. Así ella asegurara la alimentación y la educación D. sus hijos.

Ella esta trabajando para tener un buen mercado, para ser la única vendedora D. carne en donD. vive y abarcar a más clientes. Para contar con suficientes ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old, married and has two children. 

She is a hardworking woman and for 20 years has worked butchering cows. Vilma used to work for her father, who taught her this activity. Later she became independent, because she knew how to distribute the meat and the customers knew her as well.  

Vilma buys the cows in a city in the eastern part of the country that takes three hours to reach. She butchers two cows a week and later distributes the meat and bones in neighboring communities. She gets up at 3:30 a.m. and works until her merchandise is gone.  

Vilma is asking for the loan to buy three to five cows to butcher. She wants to take advantage of the fact that at this time the price of cows has gone down and she can buy them at a good price. In this way she will earn more income and butcher three cows a week. In this way, she ensures feeding and educating her children. 

She is working to have a good demand and be the only meat seller where she lives and gain more customers. She does this to have enough income for her family.

loans.use: to buy from three to five cows to butcher.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es:
Edinson, de 34 años, es un hombre bueno, trabajador y con una visión de negocio muy buena, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, todo lo que genera es dedicado a sus padres con quienes vive hasta ahora a lado de su hermana, el dedica mucho de su vida para brindar lo mejor a su familia y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Edinson consiste en la compra de granos como maíz y frejol, al maíz lo procesa para venderlo como alimento para pollos, tiene un pequeño molino que constituyó junto a su amigo y socio, juntos trabajan y distribuyen por el mercado de su ciudad. Lleva haciendo este trabajo por cuatro años, y le permitió independizarse y obtener ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de su tiempo y puede darse el gusto de andar por toda la ciudad. Le esta yendo bien, pues gana un promedio de 15 % de su inversión y lo vuelve a invertir cada tres días. Como todo joven empresario él tiene un objetivo, que es el de tener su propio taller para elaborar alimentos para pollos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más granos de maíz para seguir con su trabajo de procesar alimento para pollos, comprando granos de frejol al por mayor.
texts.en:
Edinson, 34, is a good hard-working man with a good business vision.  He is single and doesn’t have any children yet.  All that he earns is for his parents with whom he is still living along with his sister.  He dedicates his life to offering a better quality of life to his family.

He sells beans and corn and he processes the corn to sell  for chicken feed.  He has a small mill that he built together with his friend and partner.  They work together and distribute the products to the market in the city.  He has been doing this work for four years and it has allowed him to become independent and to have some earnings.  What he likes about the work is that he can make his own schedule and he likes to move around the city.  The business is going well since he makes an average of 15% over his investment and he is able to reinvest every three days.  As with all young entrepreneurs he has a goal and that is to have his own shop to make chicken feed.   This will be his third loan with MFP.  He is hoping for a small loan so that he can fulfill his goals.  He promises to make all the payments on time as he has done with previous loans.  He will use the money to buy corn kernels to continue making the chicken feed, and to purchase beans wholesale.

loans.use: to buy beans wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es: La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” está conformada por 07 integrantes entusiastas D. comenzar a trabajar con el Programa- Prosperidad, siendo Flora una D. las integrantes del grupo. Flora tiene 53 años D. edad es soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente Flora se dedica a la venta ambulatoria D. ropa D. bebe, la cual lleva más D. 12 años trabajando D. esa manera, este negocio le ha permitido a Flora sacar adelante a sus sobrinos ya que con el  fallecimiento D. su hermana, ella quedo a cargo D. sus 02 sobrinos brindado educación y el cariño D. madre. Ella solicito el préstamo para invertir en su negocio comprando polos, chompas y colchas para bebes. Su mayor deseo D. Flora es D. tener su propio local donD. pueda ofrecer sus prendas y seguir apoyando a sus sobrinos la cual han sido su motivo para progresar. La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” agradece el crédito brindado y se comprometen a trabajar bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Flora es la que viste una blusa D. color rojo.
texts.en:
The  “Mujeres Exitosas” communal bank is maD. up of seven members, who are enthusiastic about starting to work with the Prosperidad program. Flora is one of the group members. She is 53, single, and has no children.

Currently, Flora sells baby clothing in the street, which she has been doing for 12 years. This business has allowed Flora to raise her nephews. After the death of her sister, her two nephews were left in her care, and she has provided them with education and a mother's love. 

She applied for the loan to invest in her business, buying polo shirts, sweaters, and baby blankets. Flora's greatest desire is to have her own shop where she can sell her clothing, and continue supporting her nephews, who have  been her reason for moving forward. 

The "Mujeres Exitosas" communal bank is grateful for the loan they have been provided, and are committed to working well with the Prosperidad program. 

Flora is shown in photo wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: To buy polo shirts, sweaters, and baby blankets.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Victoria nació en la ciudad de Casca y tiene 48 años de edad, ella trabaja elaborando tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chulos y chalinas de lana de alpaca y de oveja. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Victoria también se dedica a la venta de fruta de forma ambulatoria.  

Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo frutas y lana de alpaca. 
 
Victoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Las Palmeras" of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco. Victoria was born in the city of Casca and is 48 years old. She works with fabrics making garments such as sweaters, chulos (an Andean style of hat with earflaps) and scarves made from alpaca and sheep's wool. She has been doing this for several years and she is doing well. Victoria also sells fruit as a street vendor.

Victoria needs the loan to buy merchandise such as fruit and alpaca wool.

Victoria is grateful for the opportunity afforded her by this means and likewise agrees to abide with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as fruit and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gari in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, D. 34 años, es una mujer  buena, amable, trabajadora y muy luchadora. Es madre soltera D. dos hijos D. 13 y 2 años, ellos son su motivo D. inspiración y esfuerzo a diario para poder brindarles lo mejor en educación y alimentación, elL. vive en casa D. su madre a lado su hermana y su padre. El trabajo D. Elizabeth consiste en L. venta D. golosinas y otros productos más en su kiosco ubicado en un colegio D. un Asentamiento Humano D. L. ciudad, lo hace recién hace tres meses y trabaja soL. en este negocio. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que tiene tiempo disponible para poder realizar múltiples actividades en su hogar, solo venD. en las horas punta del horario escolar, en las entradas, recreos y salidas D. los turnos del colegio. Por otro lado tiene un negocio en su casa D. venta D. abarrotes que le ayuda su madre, le esta yendo muy bien y espera poder seguir haciéndolo bien como hasta ahora. Este será el séptimo préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura D. avanzar con su negocio o trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas D. cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos para vender en su kiosco, entre las cosas que comprará están, gaseosas, caramelos, galletas, golosinas y mas, ya que desea implementar su negocio para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 34, is a good woman, kind, hardworking and determined. She is a single mother of 2 children, 13 and 2 years of age. They are her inspiration and motivate her to work hard every day to proviD. them with the best in education and food. She lives in her mother's house with her sister and her father. Elizabeth sells candies and other products in a kiosk located in a school in a poor neighbourhood of the city. She has only been doing this for the last 3 months and she works alone. What she likes about the work is that she has time available to take care of the many household chores. She sells only at school peak hours at the entrances, during breaks and changes in shifts at the school. She  also has a buisness in her home selling groceries which her mother helps her with. She is doing very well and hopes to continue doing as well as she is now. This will be her 7th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that financial supprot will be available as she will thus feel secure moving forward with her business or work. On the other hand, she agrees once again to make her repayments as with the other loans she had. With the amount requested, she will buy products to sell in her kiosk such as soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, candies and more as she wants to implement her business so as to have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets, biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Akobwait Group

texts.en:
Francis is the facilitator of the Akobwait group. Francis and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Francis takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Francis will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Akobwait group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Hope Sisters” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 800,000 SLL each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatu is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old is married and has six children, two of whom are in secondary and tertiary institutions. Fatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market food – salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy market food – salt, margi, onions, etc. in wholesale

loans.name: Noee Aldrubal

texts.es:
Don Noee tiene 45 años de edad, es una persona amigable y colaborador, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, es Ebanista desde hace 24 años atras, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y sus hijos a estudiar, y junto a su familia reside en el municipio de Silca. 

Por el año de 1987, Noee aprendió de su oficio iniciando como aprendiz y ayudante en un taller de carpinteria en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. Luego por motivos personales tuvo que trasladarse al municipio de Silca y fue allí donde comenzó a instalar su propio taller y aunque no contaba con muchas de las maquinas que necesitaba no se detuvo. Los trabajos que inició elaborando eran pocos y sencillos por falta de la maquinaria, pero con transcurso del tiempo Noee ha ido ahorrando y poco a poco a comprado sus herramientas electricas. Su horario de atencion es variado, porque en ocasiones no tiene trabajos y en otras si. Su principal ventaja es que es muy dedicado y cuidadoso en sus trabajos y por eso sus vecinos lo prefieren. Su desventaja es el alto costo de la energia electrica.

El prestamo que Noee esta solicitando lo necesita para la compra de madera. Con el apoyo de este prestamo él podrá terminar unos muebles que tiene pendiente de entregar y tambien tendrá un ingreso para cubrir el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio mas grande y fuerte, con varios empleados. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Don Noee is 45 years old and is a friendly and helpful person. He is married and has 3 children. He has been a cabinetmaker for 24 years. His wife takes care of the household chores and his children study. He lives with his family in Silca.

In 1987 Noee learned his trade, starting off as an apprendice and assistant at a carpenter's workshop in the city of Tegucigalpa. Later, for personal reasons, he had to move to Silca and it was there that he started to set up his own capenter's workshop and although he didn't have many of the machines he needed, he didn't falter. At the start, the jobs were few and simple for a want of machinery, but with time Noee saved and little by little bought the electrical tools he needs. His work schedule is varied because sometimes there are no jobs and at other times there are. His main advantage is that he is very dedicated and thorough in his work and for this reason his neighbours prefer to use him. His disadvantage is the high cost of electricity.

Noee needs the loan he is asking for to buy wood. With the support of this loan he can finish a few pieces of furniture pending delivery and also provide an income to cover the upkeep of his family.

His dream is to have a larger and stronger business with several employees. This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he hopes to makes his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a baker at Dompoase. She has 5 children and has been a baker for 12 years. Efua is responsible for the upkeep of her children. She will use her loan to buy flour and sugar for her bakery. Efua plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for her baking

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl se dedica a la albañilería desde hace ya más diez años, su esposo se encarga del cuidado y atención de sus dos hijos. 
Son originarios de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí y tiene más de doce años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Es una familia trabajadora que sean tener mejor patrimonio y saben que trabajando lo lograran. 
 Solicitan un préstamo para comprar el material que es block, varilla, arena y cemento, ya que Don Raúl se encargara de realizar la mejora en horarios adicionales a su trabajo. 
Ya que les preocupa la seguridad de su familia y el patrimonio que han lograda con mucho esfuerzo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Raúl has been a bricklayer for more than 10 years. His wife is responsible for the care and attention of their 2 children. They are originally from the city of San Luis Potosí and have lived for more than 12 years in the city of Nuevo Laredo. Theirs is a hardworking family that wants a better inheritance and knows that by working they will succeed.

They are asking for a loan to buy building materials such as cement blocks, rods, sand and cement as Don Raúl will take care of the improvement  during his spare time from work as he is worried about his family's safety and the inheritance they have managed to achieve for their children with so much effort.

.

loans.use: to build a wall around the house.

loans.name: Angasa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Angasa Group in Western Kenya! Christine is the facilitator of the Angasa group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Christine takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Christine had an excellent maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Christine was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Christine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Christine will educate her children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Angasa group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Christine with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 40 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Esta casada y es madre de tres hijos de 20, 19 y 15 años, quienes son estudiantes y aún dependen de ella para su educación, alimentación y demás necesidades. Tiene una casa propia en que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo, en donde comparte sus días a lado de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo viaja a otros departamentos a realizar trabajos eventuales. El trabajo de Eva consiste en la venta de productos alimenticios como piononos, pan integral, queques a las panderias. En su casa tiene su pequeño negocio, lugar donde se encarga de proveer a sus clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 8 años y lo hace sola, pero Eva es una mujer que no se queda ya que también se dedica a la cría de aves de corral además de sembrar tomates regionales por ciertas temporadas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades y generarse más ingresos asimismo afrontar todas las cuotas programadas. Le gustaría emprender un nuevo proyecto, el de poner un restaurante para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este será el préstamo numero 17  con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más productos para su venta, además de algunos ingredientes y materiales necesarios para incursionar en el negocio de montar un restaurante.
texts.en: Eva, 40, is a good woman, kind and very responsible. She is married and is the mother of 3 children aged 20, 19 and 15, who are students and still depend on her for their education, food and other necessities. She has her own house which she bought with a lot of effort together with her husband and which she shares with children during the day whilst her husband travels to other departments to perform odd jobs. Eva's work consists of cash sales and credit sales of bakery products. She is in charge of placing orders at a wholesale factory that bakes different kinds of products which include sponge cakes, wholemeal bread, cakes. She has a small business in her house where she distributes to her customers. She has been doing this work for 8 years and she does it alone. However, Eva is a woman who is never still as she also raises poultry and also plants regional tomatoes during certain seasons. What she likes about her work is that it allows her to use her time for other activities which gives her a good income and thus she can cover all the scheduled expenses. She would like to undertake a new project which is to set up a restaurant to improve her income. This will be her 17th loan with MFP and as such hopes for your collaboration to pursue her goals. On the other hand, she agrees once again to make her repayments as with the previous loans. With the requested amount she will buy more products for her store as well as a few ingredients and materials to start setting up her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy wholemeal bread, sponge cakes, cakes and other products as well as buy the materials necessary to set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a kenkey (fermented corn dumpling) seller at Dompoase. She has four children. Ekua has been selling kenkey for 10 years now. She is responsible for the upkeep of her children. Ekua will use her loan to buy maize to make kenkey. She will expand her business with the profit she makes.

loans.use: to buy maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a single parent and has five dependents. Nana produces gari (a food made from cassava) for sale. She also sells maize at Dompoase. Nana has been doing this for the past 10 years now. She uses her income to provide for her children. Nana will use her loan to purchase bulk maize and cassava for the gari preparation. She intends to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize and cassava for gari preparation

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Maritza; La socia tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. chompas,ella teje chompas para niños,mujeres y varones,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio D. compra y venta D. cerveza,ella venD. en forma independiente,por medio D. estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. chompas y negocio D. venta D. cerveza . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana,hilos y palitos D. tejer y tambien para comprar cerveza al por mayor.
La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Maritza is the member; she’s 50 years old, married and has three children.  She’s still in business selling sweaters for children, men and women that she knits and she’s also a beer merchant.  She sells independently and through these businesses is able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the sweater and the beer sales so is asking for a loan to buy yarn, thread and knitting needles and also to buy beer at wholesale.  She is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to make her payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy yarn, thread and knitting needles and also to buy beer at wholesale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is married to a farmer and has three children. Doris is a baker. She has done this for 12 years. She assists her husband in paying the utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase flour and sugar. Doris will use her new profit to expand her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, mints, salt, etc. in bulk to add to his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oranges.

loans.name: Francia Elena

texts.es: Francia de 56 años de edad, vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde existe una gran vocación artesanal. Allí,  siguiendo  la cultura de su pueblo, se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas, hamacas y cubre lechos y a la venta de mercancía variada en general, actividad en la que trabaja  desde hace muchos años. Cuando comenzó con su emprendimiento,  pensó en hacer manualidades y venderla entre vecinos amigos en un mercado muy doméstico; posteriormente se dedicó a las ventas de prendas de vestir, perfumería y prendas de oro y plata. Sus principales clientes están ubicados en las ciudad de Cartagena, lugar donde trabajan personas muy cercanas a ella, que le ayudan en la recuperación de su cartera  y también tiene en San Jacinto,  compradores como los profesores y trabajadores independientes,  a quienes les ofrece sus productos, para pagarlo en plazos convenidos. En la actualidad Francia está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 2 años; Desde que ingresó a esta organización los cambios en su vida productiva,  han sido notorios, logrando genera más ingresos para sí misma y para su familia. Su desafío diario es lograr vincular nuevos clientes, para que su negocio crezca, y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará Platería y artesanías para adicionarla a las que ya vende, inversión que sería exitosa pues conoce bien su mercado, se acercan las fiestas navideñas y está enmarcando su inversión en pedidos de sus  mejores clientes.
texts.en:
Francia, 56, lives in San Jacinto, a town in Bolívar Department where there is an extensive crafts tradition.  There, following her town’s culture, she makes backpacks, hammocks and bedspreads and sells assorted general merchandise, an activity she’s been doing for many years now.  When she started out, she thought of making crafts to sell among neighbors and friends in a very domestic market.  Later on she started to sell clothes, perfumes and gold and silver jewelry.  Her main customers are located in the city of Cartagena where people who are very dear to her work and help her recuperate her portfolio.  She also has customers in San Jacinto, buyers like teachers and independent employees, that she offers her wares to on easy payment plans.  

To date, Francia has been affiliated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for two years.  Since she joined this organization changes in her productive life have been significant and she now generates more income for herself and for her family.  Her daily challenge is gaining new customers so that the business will grow and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy silver jewelry and crafts to add to the ones she already sells, an investment that will be successful because she knows her market well; the Christmas festivities are approaching and she’s already earmarking her investment in securing orders from her best customers.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry and crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has five dependents. She sells maize at Dompoase. She has been selling maize for 12 years. Ekua is responsible for the upkeep of her children. She will use her loan to purchase bulk maize. Ekua will expand her business with her profit.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata, âgée de 53 ans est marchande d’arachides, de mais, et d’autres fruits selon la période. Elle exerce ce métier  depuis plus de 15ans. Elle habite un quartier sis dans la région se trouvant à 70km de Dakar
Elle souhaite acheter de l’arachide, du mais pour renforcer son activité de petit commerce.
Avec les revenus de son commerce elle aide son époux dans la gestion de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs Aminata, 53, sells peanuts, corn, and other fruits depending on the season. She's been doing this for over 15 years. She lives in a neighborhood located 70km away from Dakar.
She would like to buy some peanuts and corn to strengthen her business.
With the income from this business, she helps her husband manage the household.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and corn

loans.name: Kahawa B Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Kahawa B group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Patrick will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kahawa B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Patrick is pictured with his group members and the field officer on the left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married with six dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. Adjoa has sold banku (fermented maize served with fish) in Dompoase for the past 10 years now. She supports her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa will use her loan to buy bulk maize and fish for her banku. Adjoa will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize and fish for her banku (fermented maize served with fish).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy weaving materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sango Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Sango group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

John takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have more knowledge and modern technology for his maize production. In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 ½ bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, John will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Sango group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, John is pictured with his group members and the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Andrea nació en la ciudad de Kaspacmarca de la provincia de Chumbivilca y tiene 22 años radicando en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y los despacha al campamento minero de las bambas, ella también se dedica a elaboración de tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chulos y chalinas y el material que utiliza es la lana de alpaca y de oveja. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Andrea requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo verduras y lana de alpaca. 
 
Andrea se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras” (The Palm Trees), which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She was born in the city of Kaspacmarca in Chumbivilca Province. Andrea moved to the city of Cusco when she was 22. She is now 45 years old, married, and has three children. Andrea sells vegetables and delivers them to the Las Bambas mining encampment. She also knits sweaters, caps, and scarves out of alpaca and sheep’s wool. Andrea has been in these businesses for several years and has done very well. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as vegetables and alpaca wool.

Andrea is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Cookery Women Group

texts.en:
Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Cookery Women” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,400,000.00 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu is 40 years old and married with two children who are attending secondary school. Isatu sells cooked rice. She has been in the rice-cooking business for 15 years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil, onions, tomatoes, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc., in bulk in order to enable her to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil, onions, tomatoes, margi, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria, de 52 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive en su casa propia en donde le acompañan dos de sus hijos quienes aportan en la economía y siempre le tratan de dar lo mejor a ella quien a parte realiza su trabajo para no depender de ellos. El trabajo de Hilaria consiste en la venta de abarrotes, inicia todos los días sus actividades cuando apertura su establecimiento, lo limpia y ordena todos sus productos, tiene buenos clientes quienes van a su tienda por que es una de las más surtidas de su cuadra y sus clientes saben que ahí encontraran de todo, tiene cuatro años con su negocio y lo hace a lado de su hijo quien le brinda la ayuda necesaria para las actividades más duras que toca hacer en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su propio tiempo a parte de tener que esperar de nadie para poder tener sus ingresos económicos, cuando empezó tenia muchas dudas, temor de que no le vaya bien, pero comprendió que todo dependía de sus esfuerzo y mucho trabajo y ahora todo le va bien y espera seguir creciendo. Ahora emprende un nuevo proyecto ya que desea empezar con la crianza de pollos. Este será el préstamo numero 12 son MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete nuevamente a ser una socia puntual como en los créditos anteriores en donde demostró porque es una de las socias más queridas y mas respetadas ya que gracias a su puntualidad obtuvo el respeto de todos. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará más mercadería para su bodega, ya que desea implementarse con arroz, azúcar, conservas y otros productos que desea tener en mayor cantidad y mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Hilaria, age 52, is a good woman who is kind and hardworking. She is a widow and has four grown children who are independent. Hilaria lives in her own home with two of her children who help with the finances. She always stives to do her best in her job so that she does not have to depend on them. Hilaria sells groceries. Every day she starts her activities when she opens her store by cleaning and arranging all of her products. She has good customers who come to her establishment because her business is one of the best-stocked stores on the block. Her customers know that they can find everything. She has been in business for four years and her son helps with the more difficult activities required to stay in operation. What she likes about her job is being able to work on her own schedule and not have to rely on anyone in order to generate an income. When she started her business, Hilaria had many doubts that she would not do well, but she understands that all of her results depend on her efforts and a great amount of work. Now she is doing well and hopes to continue growing. Hilaria is now pursuing a new project because she wants to start raising chickens.

This will be her 12th loan with MFP. She waits to receive a small loan so that she can accomplish her goals. Hilaria renews her commitment to be a punctual member just like she had been with her previous loans. She is one of the most loved and respected members. Due to her promptness, she has earned the respect of everyone. The amount of 2500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more merchandise for her store. She wants to acquire rice, sugar, preserves, and other products so that she can have more inventory and greater variety.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, preserves, and other products.

loans.name: Vumilia Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vumilia Group in Western Kenya! Isabella is the facilitator of the Vumilia group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Isabella takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate her children and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Isabella had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Isabella was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isabella and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Isabella will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Isabella is pictured with her members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Edgar Adrian

texts.es:
Edgar Adrian tiene 18 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con la madre en Guaranda sector Cuatro esquinas Provincia Bolívar.
LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.
Edgar se dedica a la crianza de animales (pollos), estudia y se dedica también a tocar en una amplificación de disco móvil.
Las compras y ventas de los animales los realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda. El crédito lo solicita para comprar la alimentación de los animales.
El dinero del crédito le ayudará a mejorar el peso de los animales para obtener mayor utilidad en la venta.
El sueño es poder seguir en los estudios y obtener un título profesional.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta en el negocio es el descuido por ello no tienen una buena contextura el animal y muere.
En los tiempos libres le gusta el deporte en especial el boly, futbol, basket y le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval, navidad.
texts.en:
Edgar Adrian is 18 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother in the Cuatro Esquinas subdivision of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank “Cuatro Esquinas Central” (Four Corners Central) consists of 12 members who live in the Cuatro Esquinas subdivision. They engage in different business activities such as farming, raising animals, retail, and other trades.

Edgar raises animals (chickens), attends school, and also operates the sound equipment for a mobile disc jockey. He buys and sells the animals in the city of Guaranda. The loan will be used to buy feed for his animals. The money from this loan will help his animals gain weight so that they will be more profitable when they are sold. His dream is to finish his studies and earn a professional degree. The challenges in his business include being careful not to neglect his animals or else they become unhealthy and die.

In his free time, Edgar enjoys sports such as volleyball, soccer, and basketball. He also enjoys the festivities during Carnival and Christmas.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio tiene 60 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos,el socio sigue trabajando como profesor en la ciudad de Cusco,y tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de equipos de construccion . El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos para sus equipos de construccion.
     
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member is 60 years old, married, and has three children. He continues to work as a teacher in the city of Cusco. He also has a business that sells construction equipment. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy spare parts for the construction equipment.

The member is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the construction equipment that he sells.

loans.name: Duo Perlas De Cristo Group

texts.es: Duo Perlas de Cristo: este grupo esta conformado por Mayra Janeth,de 30 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos,ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones desde hace 5 años. nos comenta que es una actividad que le a gustado mucho y es una forma de ayudar a sus hijos,es por eso que ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para elavorar refacciones ya que en esta epoca es cuando mas se venden las refacciones,al igual que la siguiente socias esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en: Duo Perlas de Cristo: this group includes Mayra Haneth.  She is 30 years old, has two children, and has been selling refreshments for five years.  She says that she likes doing this very much and it’s a way for her to help out her children.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making refreshments because this is the season when they sell the best.  The other member is also requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty, de 33 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien es madre de dos hijos de 11 y 4 años, ella a lado de su pareja trabajan mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su pareja y dos menores hijos quienes la impulsan a seguir siempre hacia delante. El trabajo de Ketty, consiste en capturar los momentos y sucesos importantes en la vida de las persona por medio de su cámara, ella presta el servicio de fotógrafo en los diversos acontecimientos y eventos de la ciudad, además de realizar este trabajo a donde le soliciten, tiene un pequeño estudio fotográfico que esta ubicado en su casa del cual se hace cargo su esposo, además de realizar revelados, también hacen diplomas, certificado y otras cosas más. Llevan realizando este negocio por 11 años y siempre tuvo el apoyo de su conviviente ya que junto hacen un buen trabajo.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener dos ingresos, el ingreso fijo es gracias al estudio que tiene en su casa y otro es cuando se va a algunos eventos por solicitud de los organizadores. Al principio como todo emprendedor tuvo sus dificultades y temores, pero con el tiempo se fue asentando en su trabajo y ahora es muy buena y reconocida por lo que hace. Tiene como objetivo el de poder ampliar su negocio para así tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de una pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como el préstamo anterior que demostró ser buena y muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará moldes de aluminio, vidrios y materiales para portaretratos, pues las promociones escolares le solicitan.
texts.en:
Ketty, 33, is a good, kind, very hardworking woman.  She has a spouse and they have two children who are 11 and 4 years old.  She and her spouse work hard to provide a better quality of life for their children.  She owns her house where she lives with her spouse and two minor children who push her to always move forward. 

Ketty’s work consists in capturing the important moments and events in people’s lives through her camera.  She provides photography services at various events and happenings in the city.  Besides doing this service wherever she’s asked to she also has a small photography studio at home that her husband runs.  Besides developing film they also make diplomas, certificates and other things.  She’s been in this business 11 years and her spouse always supported her efforts since they work well together.  What she likes about her work is that it allows her to have two incomes: the fixed income thanks to the home-based studio and the other when she goes to various events at the request of the organizers.

At first, like all entrepreneurs, she had some difficulty and fear but with time she settled into the work and now she’s very good at it and well known for her work.  Her goal is to expand the business to have more to offer her customers.

This will be MFP loan #2 and she hopes to get this small loan that will help her reach her objectives.  On the other hand, she once again commits to make her installment payments like she did with the previous loan having been very good and responsible with respect to the payments.  She will use the requested amount to buy aluminum frames, glass and other supplies for picture frames because she has requests for school graduations.

loans.use: to buy aluminum frames, glass and materials for photo albums.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Elizabeth; La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia sigue trabajando como doecente en la ciudad de Cusco y tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de cosmeticos como perfumes,cremas y lapis labiales al por mayor,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cosmeticos y mejorar en su trabajo como docente.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cosmeticos como cremas,perfumes,lapiz labiales al por mayor.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and has two children. She continues to work as a teacher in the city of Cusco. Elizabeth also manages a business in which she sells cosmetics such as perfumes, crèmes, and lip pencils in bulk. Through this business, she is able to help her children get ahead. Elizabeth wants to expand and improve her cosmetics sales business and improve in her job as a teacher. She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics such as crèmes, perfumes, and lip pencils in bulk.

Elizabeth is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, and lip pencils.

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Joy Group in Western Kenya! Silas is the facilitator of the Joy group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Silas takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Silas had a good maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Silas was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Silas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Silas will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Joy group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Milita

texts.es: Melita, de 27 años, es una mujer joven con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte junto a su pareja la alegría de educar a sus hijos y día a día brindarles lo mejor, además de ellos, también vive ahí su padre. EL trabajo de Melita consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, desde muy temprano, se levanta y espera a sus cuatro choferes quienes llevan las motos para trabajar en el servicio de transporte, pues lo da en alquiler y percibe ganancia por cada uno de sus vehículos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años y le esta yendo muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo libre para poder realizar muchas actividades mientras que sus motos generan ingresos adicionales, cuando empezó sólo tenia un mototaxi y ahora esta aumentando cada vez más, menciona que lo malo de este negocio es que sus vehículos se maltratan mucho ya sea por el mal trato de los choferes o por las malas condiciones de las calles de la ciudad, pero bueno es un riego que asume en este negocio, ahora se prepara para poder seguir aumentando su flota, pero primero desea refaccionar bien a sus cuatro unidades. Este será su primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que le darán un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete en ser una socia muy buena y puntual, además espera poder encajar rápidamente en el banco comunal al que pertenece ya que desea no dejar mal a nadie y siempre ser muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará una mototaxi más ya que ahorro durante mucho tiempo un promedio de 100 soles y solo le falta el monto solicitado para poder completar.
texts.en:
Melita, 27, is a young woman with a strong drive to stand out.  She lives with her spouse and they have two children who are 7 and 3 years old.  She owns her house where she shares with her spouse the joy of educating their children and providing the best for them.  Besides them, her father lives there too.

Melita’s work consists in leasing out a mototaxi.  Starting very early she rises to await her four drivers who take the mototaxis to work providing transportation services.  She leases out the mototaxis and earns profits for each one of them.  She’s been in this business for three years and is doing very well.  What she likes about the work is that it leaves her with free time to do many activities while her mototaxis generate additional income.  When she started out she only had one mototaxi but now she’s increasing more each time.  She mentions that the bad thing about the business is that the vehicles are damaged quite a bit due to the poor way the drivers treat them or because of the poor condition of the roads but it’s a risk one must assume in this business.  Now, she’s getting ready to be able to enlarge her fleet but first she wants to service her four existing units.

This will be her first MFP loan and she is very happy to know that she’ll be getting financial support because she feels she can advance with her business.  On the other hand she commits to be a good, punctual member of her communal bank.  She hopes to fit in quickly in the communal bank she belongs to because she wants to be very responsible always and not disappoint anyone.

She will use the requested 800 soles to buy another mototaxi since she’s been saving up all this time and has about 100 soles and all she needs still is the amount she requested to be able to have the rest she needs.

loans.use: to buy another mototaxi.

loans.name: Rosa Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Verónica y su esposo tienen ya más de tres años con su negocio de renta de equipo de cómputo. 
Solicitan un préstamo para compra de inmuebles que son mesas y sillas para colocar las computadoras y así sus clientes estén más como y satisfechos al estar haciendo tareas escolares en su negocio. 
Son personas trabajadoras que desean tener un buen patrimonio para cuando lleguen sus hijos darles lo mejor y una vida con seguridad. 
Con la inversión tendrán mejor instalaciones ya que con las que cuentan no son apropiados para el negocio. Por lo cual tendrán más clientes y así mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Verónica and her husband have managed a business renting out computer equipment for more than three years. She is requesting a loan to buy furniture, such as tables and chairs, on which they can place the computers so that their customers can do their schoolwork while they are at their establishment. This will keep them happy.

Rosa and her husband are hardworking people who want to leave a good inheritance for their children so that they can have a better and more secure life. With this investment, they hope to provide better facilities because the existing ones are inadequate for their business. They want to have more customers and be able to make them more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her computer facility.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Ana; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza y tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa,ella vende en forma independiente,ella la ropa trae de lugares como Arequipa y Lima y luego lo vende en forma independiente,por medio de estos pequeños negcoios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y negocio de venta de ropa . La socia ahora solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes y cremas y tambien para comprar pantalones,polos y blusas al por mayor.
La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She continues with her business of selling beauty products, as well as with her clothing business. Ana works independently. The clothes are brought in from places, such as Arequipa and Lima, and then sold later. Through these small businesses, she is able to help her children get ahead. Ana wants to expand and improve both of her businesses, so now she is requesting a loan to buy beauty products, such as perfumes and crèmes, and also trousers, polo shirts, and blouses in bulk.

She is satisfied with the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, trousers, polo shirts, and blouses in bulk.

loans.name: Siisa  Wg Group

texts.en:
Robai is the facilitator of the Siisa WG group. Robai and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Robai takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed his family and to pay school fees. In the recent 2011 season, Robai had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Robai was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robai and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Robai will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Siisa WG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Robai is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Soledad nació en la ciudad de Sicuani y radica 10 años en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 25 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a reciclar botellas descartables y estos productos los envía a la ciudad de Lima. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Soledad requiere el préstamo para comprar botellas descartables.
 
Soledad se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She was born in the city of Sicuani and has lived in the city of Cusco for 10 years. Soledad is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She recycles disposable bottles, which are then sent to the city of Lima. Soledad has been in this business for several years and has done very well. She is requesting a loan to buy disposable bottles.

Soledad is grateful to the opportunity that has been given to her and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy disposable bottles.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos tiene 44 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Villarrica, vive con sus hermanas y su pequeña sobrinita, hija de una de sus hermanas quine es soltera.
Él se dedica a la cría de gallinas de corral,nos comenta que hace bastante tiempo que se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada. El se define como un hombre muy trabajador, luchador y emprendedor, siempre ha trabajado y no teme a ningún desafío. Dice que gracias a la ayuda de sus hermanas y combinado a su trabajo están saliendo adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio
El señor Carlos solicitó ayuda a la Fundación, para invertir en la compra de gallinas para cría en corral y con ello mejorar sus ingresos y mediante esto alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 and single, and he lives in his own house in the city of Villarrica.  He lives with his sisters and his small niece, who is the daughter of a sister who is a single mother. 

He raises hens.  He tells us that he has been doing this work for some time, so he has a well-formed client base.  He is a man who is hardworking and enterprising, a fighter.  He has always worked, and he is not afraid to take on a challenge.  He says that thanks to his sisters' help and his work, he is getting ahead with a lot of effort and sacrifice.

Carlos is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of hens to raise in his coop so that he can increase his income and attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hens to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Duo Damas Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Marta Julia:de 43 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace 4 años,la lider de este duo es una persona luchadora que poco a poco se a superado en su negocio,ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de calzado y de esa manera seguir con su negocio,al igual que la siguiente socia nececita este credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Marta Julia is 43 years old and has been selling shoes for four years.  The leader of this duo is a hardworking woman who has been succeeding little by little in her business.  She is asking for this loan, as is the other member, because she needs to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory
