loans.name: Estrellas De Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE INGENIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Justina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, tejido.

La señora Justina,  indica que hace seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la 16 de julio y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
Las Estrellas de Ingenio communal bank will start their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal center.  The group is comprised of six members, and it is directed by a board of directors led by Justina.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied.  Selling food, a neighborhood store, selling sweets, and weaving are among their business activities.

Justina says that she has worked with Pro Mujer for six months.  She joined the institution by invitation.  She currently has a business weaving blankets.  She has been working for years, and she learned from her parents.

The loan she will take out is to buy wool, which she will get from the 16 de Julio market.  She will later sell it at her stand.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has one child.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Bellamis Astrid

texts.es: Bellamis de 35 años con su anterior credikiva le fue muy bien, ella está siendo apoyada por su esposo, quien aparece en la fotografia, pues esta dedicado especialmente a la atención de sus clientes.  Ella está muy entusiasmada y necesita invertir de nuevo, especialmente en esta época de mayor repunte  de sus ventas como lo es la de fin de año. Con su segundo credikiva comprará insumos al por mayor para ganar más descuentos y lograr una mejor utilidad. Su mensaje a los financiadores del crédito es el Siguiente:  “Quiero agradecer inmensamente la oportunidad que me dieron de crecer mi negocio con el préstamo otorgado”
texts.en:
The previous Kiva loan that Bellamis, age 35, had went very well for her.  Her husband, who appears in the photo, supports her.  She is especially dedicated to waiting on her customers.  She is very enthusiastic.

She needs to invest in her business again, especially at this time.  There is now a great upturn in sales like there is at the end of the year.

She will use her second Kiva loan to buy wholesale supplies in order to get discounts and get an improved profit.  Her message to the lenders of the loan is the following:  “I want to give you my immense gratitude for the opportunity you gave me to grow my business with the loan you provided.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Muungano A Group

texts.en:
Jacob is the facilitator of the Muungano A group. Jacob and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jacob takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to grow enough to feed his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jacob had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Jacob was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacob and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jacob will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Muungano A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Jacob is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nyumbani Shg Group

texts.en:
Silas is the facilitator of the Nyumbani SHG group. Silas and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Silas takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and in order to ensure food security for his family . In the recent 2011 season, Silas had a good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Silas was only able to harvest 3  bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Silas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Silas will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nyumbani SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Silas is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalía se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo desde hace cinco años tiene  puesto de venta propio en un mercado de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja de lunes a domingo, solicita el crédito compra de Mascotas y alimnetos,  para iniciar una nueva actividad junto a  su esposo la cual según indica doña Rosalía tiene buen mercado, con dicha actividad desean incrementar sus ingresos y para solicitar dicho crédito la primera opción fue nuestra institución lo cual nos muestra la buena confianza para con la institución,  vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres, la cual se encuentra muy cerca a su puesto de venta.
texts.en: Señora Rosalía has been selling chickens for 5 years and has her own stall at the market in the city of Cochabamba. She works Monday through Sunday. She is asking for the loan to buy pedigreed pets and feed to start a new business with her husband who according to Doña Rosalia has a good market for this. They want to increase their income with this new business. Their first choice for a loan was our institution which demonstrates their good faith in the institution. She lives in a house that belongs to her parents which is very close to her market stall.

loans.use: to buy pedrigrees pets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction material to put a roof on his livestock stables.

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
Ema integrante del Banco comunal “Oportunidad” perteneciente a la comuna de Padres de las Casas, ciudad de Temuco. 
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa usada y nueva. Desde hace 2 años.
Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, en los sectores comerciales más populares de la comunidad.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, en las cuales compra fardos de ropa, de acuerdo a las ganancias que obtenga de sus ventas. 
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa para abastecer su negocio. 
Las metas en su negocio son arrendar un local estable para ofrecer y vender su mercadería, de manera más organizada. 
Ema vive junto a su marido, su hijo de 22 y una nieta de 15 años. Sus sueños a nivel personal son prosperar en su negocio, para que le brinde mejores ganancias, de esta manera otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con los demás emprendedores que conforman el grupo, ya que son muy unidos y solidarios. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones de micro emprendimiento, estas le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de contabilidad, sobre todo a cómo distribuir mejor sus gastos e ingresos, de esta manera invertir exitosamente en su negocio. 
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Ema is a member of the communal bank "Oportunidad" which belongs to the Padre de las Casas community in the city of Temuco.  She is involved in sales, mainly of used and new clothing, and has been in business for two years.  Her work schedule is Monday through Sunday in the popular commercial areas in the community.  She buys her merchandise from dealers and purchases bundles of clothing depending on the earnings she gets from sales.  She plans to use the loan to buy bundles of clothing to stock her business.  Her goal is to rent an establishment to be able to sell her goods in a more organized fashion.  

Ema lives with her husand, 22-year-old son and 15-year old granddaughter.  Her personal goals are to prosper in the business so she can make more money and give her family a better lifestyle.

She is content and grateful for the opportunity given her through Fondo Esperanza so she can invest in her business.  She is very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in her group because they are united and supportive.  The micro-enterprise training has taughter her new accounting strategies, especially regarding better distribution of expenses and income, which will help make her business successful.

Padre de las Casas is a community in southern Chile, close to Temuco, in the region of Araucanía.  The name is in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas who defended the natives during the conquest of America.  There are many Mapuche indians in the community.  Its economy is based on  agroindustry and commercial services.

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Quare Group

texts.en:
Vincent is the facilitator of the Quare group. Vincent and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Vincent and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Vincent takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Vincent had a very good maize yield, harvesting 8½  bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Vincent was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Vincent will educate his children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Quare group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Star B2 Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Star B2 Group in Western Kenya!  Silas leads this group as a facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  Like the majority of people in this part of Kenya, the members of Start B2 Group are farmers who rely on maize for annual food security and income.

Silas takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and also in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Silas had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Silas was only able to harvest 14 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Silas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Silas will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Star B2 group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Silas is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marinela

texts.es:
Marinela a sus 27 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad respectivamente, por quienes lucha y trabaja incansablemente para brindarles un mejor bienestar y quienes son a su vez las personas que le dan la fuerza para seguir adelante y continuar con su negocio, una sala de belleza en la cual trabaja desde hace un año desde las 9:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m. Todo el conocimiento adquirido es gracias a su padre quien le paga los estudios para que aprenda todo lo relacionado a este arte de la belleza y así poder ella generar sus propios ingresos.

Marinela espera comprar insumos para su negocio y hacer algunas adecuaciones locativa, ya que debe pintarlo puesto que tiene una humedad la cual esta dando un mal aspecto para su local; de esta manera Marinela espera poder brindar a sus clientes un espacio mas agradable, posicionar su sala de belleza  y aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea tener su propio local donde pueda atender a sus clientes de manera personalizada y así garantizarles a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marinela is 27 years old and the mother of two children, ages 9 and 4.  She works tirelessly to give them a quality lifestyle and they are the ones who give her the strength to get ahead and continue with her business which is a beauty salon.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  All of the expertise she has is thanks to her father who paid for her studies so she could learn all there is to know about the beauty profession and generate her own income.

Marinela wants to buy supplies for the business and renovate the salon.  She must paint it because of the humidity which has caused damage.  Marinela wants to offer her customers a nicer location as well as upgrade the business and increase her income.  In the future she would like to have her own shop and give customers more personalized attention.  This is to provide a better quality of life for her two children.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para su trabajo y hacer algunas adeciaciones locativas en su negocio.

loans.name: Darly

texts.es: Darly, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, con mucho carisma y deseosa de progresar. Vive  con Eduardo, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hermosos hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Darly es la confección de prendas de vestir, de todos los modelos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, oficio que aprendió en un centro ocupacional. A ella siempre le ha gustado esta actividad, en un incio contaba con una maquina de coser a pedal, luego fue creciendo y con mucho esfuerzo se compró una maquina eléctrica, con la actualmente elabora sus confecciones, logrando atender a todos sus clientes. Lleva tres años realizando esta actividad, y gracias a ello puede percibir un ingreso económico para su familia. Mas adelante desea montar una boutique en su casa, para exhibir sus productos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de contar con el apoyo de un crédito para avanzar con su negocio, por eso asegura será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse muy cómoda con su grupo, ya que los considera buenas personas y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la confección, como telas, hilos, elásticos, cierres  y demás.
texts.en: Darly, 36, is a hard-working, cheerful woman with a lot of charisma and a great desire to get ahead.  She lives wtih Eduardo and they have two beautiful children, ages 13 and 7.  They live in their own house.  Darly earns a living as a seamstress and makes all kinds of women's, men's and children's clothes.  She learned her skill at a vocational center.  She has always enjoyed her work and started out with a pedal sewing machine.  As her business grew, and with much hard work, she bought an electric machine which she now uses to make her products and attend to customers.  She has been in business for three years, providing an income for the family.  In the future she would like to open a boutique in her home to exhibit her products.  This is her fourth loan through the MFP institution.  She is happy to be able to count on this loan to grow her business and is committed to paying it back on time.  She also feels very comfortable in her group because she thinks the members are kind and supportive.  The loan she has requested will be used to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, elastic, closures and other items.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic and closures.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Accionistas Group

texts.es: Gloria Elizabeth:D. 46 años D. edad,ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera nececidad(tienda)desD. hace 8 años ella venD. agua gaseosas,frijol,arroz.jabon.etc ella nos comenta que desD. que inicio su negocio poco a poco a agrandado mas su negocio,y lo a surtido mas, por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mas productos D. primera nececidad, ya que su clientes le piden por mayor y ella no les cumple porque no tiene en su negocio,al igual que las siguientes socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mas mercaderia para su venta.
texts.en:
Gloria Elizabeth, 46, has been selling basic household necessities (store) for eight years.  She sell water, sodas, beans, rice, soap, etc.  She tells us that since she began her business she has grown little by little and she has stocked it more.  This is why she is requesting this loan, to buy more necessities, since her customers request wholesale from her and she cannot fulfill their orders because she does not have it in her store.

For the same reason, the other member is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy essential food products.

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUNA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mónica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, producción de pitas plásticas, tienda de víveres, venta de blusas, venta de ropa interior, venta de mantas.

La señora Mónica,  indica que hace seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de herramientas) que adquirirá de la 16 de julio y posteriormente lo venderá en a las vendedoras de las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LUNA" is beginning its first cycle in the Pro Mujer program run by the Los Andes social center.  It is comprised of six members and chaired by Mrs. Mónica.  The members of the communal bank have different businesses, such as: a carpentry, plastic twine production, grocery store, blouse sales, underwear sales, or blanket sales.

Mrs. Mónica has been involved in Pro Mujer for six months and she joined the institution by invitation.  She currently has a carpentry business that she has been in for several years and which trade she learned from her husband.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital to buy tools at the "16 de julio" shopping center.  She will then sell her goods at the tradefairs.  This work allows her to generate income to help support the family.  She has a common-law husband and three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she enjoys the training and and likes the loan terms.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Sanya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sanya SHG Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Dinah is the facilitator of the Sanya SHG Group. She takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to reduce poverty by harvesting more. In the recent 2011 season, Dinah had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dinah was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dinah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Dinah will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.
In the photo above, Dinah is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jany

texts.es: Jany, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida. Es soltera, vive en compañía de su padre y madre, como también de sus dos hermanos de 28 y 22 años de edad,  respectivamente, su cuñada y sus dos sobrinos, habitando todos una casa de propiedad de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Jany es la venta de carne de pollo, su actividad empieza de madrugada, se dirige al centro de acopio de los proveedores y criadores de pollos, donde compra su producto, para luego llevarlo a su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado informal de su ciudad. Ahi se dispone a preparar a los pollos para venderlos a sus clientes tal como les gusta, limpios y bien preparados. Éste fue un negocio familiar, que aprendió de su madre, lleva dedicándose por más de 10 años, ejerciéndola con el apoyo de un joven que la ayuda con la limpieza de los pollo y le paga por día trabajado. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico para sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Este será el préstamo número 20 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero, que a lo largo de este tiempo ha venido recibiendo, desea seguir contando con dicho apoyo, por eso será puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en el arreglo de su puesto de venta, tanto el piso como la mesa, y su implementación como la compra de balanza y demás.
texts.en:
Jany, 34, is a hardworking and determined woman. She is single and lives with her parents, her siblings, aged 28 and 22 respectively, her sister-in-law and her two nephews in a house owned by her parents. Jany's job is selling chicken meat. She begins work early in the morning and goes to the suppliers' and chicken breeders' collection center where she buys her products. She then brings them to her stall which is located in her city marketplace. There, she gets the chickens ready to sell them to her customers the way they like them - clean and well-prepared.

This was a family business which she learned from her mother. She has been doing this job for more than 10 years, with the help of a young man whom she pays for each day worked, for his help cleaning the chickens. What she likes about her job is having an income for her personal expenses and being able to help her parents with the household expenses. 

This will be the 20th loan with the institution MFP. She is grateful for the financial support that she has been receiving. She would like to continue to rely on this support and will therefore be punctual with her repayments. With the amount requested, she will invest in the renovation of her stall - of the floor and the counter - and the installation of a scales among other items.

loans.use: to set up her stall by laying the floor and buying a counter and a scales

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Carlos Alberto es casado tiene dos hijos menores de edad bajo su cargo, el inicio su negocio por la motivación de su esposa ya que necesitaban tener otra fuente de ingresos para la familia. Carlos sale desde muy temprano de su casa a vender su mercadería con un bolso muy grande, lo cual es muy difícil para él, porque es cansado caminar todo el día para visitar sus clientes .el objetivo de su préstamo es para invertir en mercadería como perfume cremas, jabón, colonia de bebe, ropa interior, camisas y  pantalones para la temporada navideña. Ya que quiere lograr vender su producto en esta época por lo cual les agradece su ayuda económica.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is married and has 2 minor children in his care.  He was encouraged to start up this business by his wife, since they needed another source of income for the family.  Carlos leaves his house very early in the morning to sell his merchandise, which he carries in a very large sack.  This is difficult for him, because it is tiring to walk every day to visit his customers.  He plans to use this loan to invest in merchandise such as: creams, soap, baby cologne, underwear, shirts and pants for the Christmas season.  He is grateful for your financial help, because he wants to be able to sell products in the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, soap, baby cologne, underwear, shirts and pants

loans.name: Konyololo Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kunyololo Farmers Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Roswel is the facilitator of the Kunyololo Farmers Group. She takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Roswel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 6 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Roswel was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roswel and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Roswel will educate her children and ensure food security. In 2012, the members of Kunyololo Farmers Group will each plant between half and 1 acre of maize.
The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new wood cabinet to display the fruit and to be buy tubers and vegetables.

loans.name: Duo Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Sara del Rosario: de 27 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de granizadas desde hace 2 años nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque es un negocio que es muy rentable, y gracias a eso su ventas han aumentado mucho ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de una maquina mas para triturar hielo y compra de naranjas para hacer jugos,ya que son muy bendibles.de la misma forma doña Crista ya que las dos se dedican a la misma actividad.
texts.en:
Sara del Rosario, 27, has worked selling iced drinks for two years.  She tells us that she is very happy because it is a very profitable business.  Thanks to this her sales have increased a lot.

She is requesting this loan now to buy an ice-crushing machine and oranges to make juice, since they are very marketable.  The same for Crista, since both work in the same business.

loans.use: to buy an ice-crushing machine and oranges to make juice.

loans.name: C Group

texts.en:
Johnson is the facilitator of the C group. Johnson and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Johnson takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and for early preparation in planting. In the recent 2011 season, Johnson had a good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Johnson was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Johnson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Johnson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of C group will each plant maize plots between 1/2 and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Johnson is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Miramar Femenino 3 Group

texts.en: Ana is the coordinator of Grupo Miramar Femenina 3. The group is made up of five women who have businesses selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics, among other things. Some of them sell door-to-door while others run their businesses out of their homes. Ana is very excited to receive her thirteenth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She's been getting loans from us and investing them in her business. She will use the current loan to buy grocery products for her Colmado, which is a small grocery store where most of her neighbors go to buy their daily meals. The investment will be in rice, beans, cooking oil, canned products, sugar and other goods. Ana is the mother of four children; right now only two of them live together with her and their father. Ana has been married for more than 20 years. In the future, she would like to have land with cattle. She also wants to save enough money and overcome the economic crisis. She enjoys attending church. This group is in the town of Samana, a popular tourist destination on the Atlantic Ocean that's surrounded by a lush, mountainous landscape. The community has few economic resources and services, since it's a very rural area. The main businesses in town belong to the members of this group.

loans.use: To buy grocery products.

loans.name: Weyogonga Group

texts.en:
Chrisostim is the facilitator of the Weyogonga group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Chrisostim takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Chrisostim had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Chrisostim was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Chrisostim and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Chrisostim will invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Weyogonga group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Chrisostim is pictured with his group members. The field officer is standing on the far right.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.es: La señora Ruth es cliente antigua de emprender, se dedica a la confección  de vestidos de novia junto a su esposo el Sr. Zenón, la Sra.  Ruth y su esposo tienen dos hijos, un varón y una niña ambos en edad escolar. Ruth y su familia viven en la zona de Kupini que esta ubicado a veinticinco minutos del centro de la ciudad. Ellos se dedican a la confección de vestidos desde hace mas de quince años y actualmente tiene dos tiendas donde costuran y venden los vestidos de novias, estas tiendas están ubicadas en la zona gran poder. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es apoyar sus hijos para que lleguen a ser profesionales y también poder ampliar su negocio. En esta oportunidad ellos solicitan el préstamo de dinero para la compra de telas para realizar los vestidos de novias, ya que estas fechas tienen gran demanda de vestidos por la cantidad de matrimonios que se celebran en estas fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Ruth is a longstanding Emprender client; she manufactures bridal gowns with her husband, Zenón.  Ruth and her husband have two children, a boy and a girl, who are both school aged.  Ruth and her family live in the Kupini zone located twenty-five minutes from downtown.  They have been making wedding gowns for over fifteen years and currently have two stores where they make and sell the wedding gowns.  The stores are located in the Gran Poder zone.  One of her greatest wishes is to support her children until they are able to become professionals and also to be able to expand the business.  

On this occasion they are asking for the loan of money to buy fabric to make wedding gowns because demand is very high because of the large number of weddings that take place during the end of year festivities.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make bridal gowns.

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS” iniciará su decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Felisa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de chinelas, venta de papas, venta de queso, costura de mandiles, venta de leche, tienda de abarrotes, venta de pipocas, carnicería.

La señora Felisa,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chinelas que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su hermano.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de chinelas) que adquirirá de Desaguadero y posteriormente lo venderá en a las vendedoras de las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el préstamo.

En la fotografía una de las socias no se encuentra a rozones culturales
texts.en:
The “Vicuñitas” communal bank will start its tenth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Felisa.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of activities among which we have: vegetable sales, sandal sales, potato sales, cheese sales, apron making, milk sales, grocery store, popcorn sales and a butcher shop.

Felisa indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for two years and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend.  She currently has a business selling sandals that she’s had for years having learned it from her brother.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital; she will buy sandals in Desaguadero to later resell to sellers in street markets.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she lives unmarried to her spouse and they have five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the program.

Due to cultural reasons, one of the group members does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sandals.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana Milena, de 46 años es la propietaria de una tienda, donde vende al detalle, ranchos, víveres, carnes y productos de la canasta familiar. Su negocio nació hace 6 años en  el municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar, cuando se dio cuenta, de la poca competencia de este tipo de actividad y la gran necesidad de los habitantes de esta población, por lograr obtener en pequeñas cantidades, los productos que diariamente consumían las familias porteñas (Originario de Puerto). Su meta es lograr incrementar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un autoservicio. 
Ana Milena goza de una clientela satisfecha, que cada día crece, por eso su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente y debe comprar en pequeñas cantidades con mucha frecuencia. La ubicación de su tienda hace de este lugar un sitio favorito por lo agradable de su vista, pues se encuentra en un altillo donde se puede observar el paisaje marino y en especial el viejo puerto, un sitio turístico muy visitado por habitantes de la ciudad e Barranquilla y de los municipios del departamento del Atlántico. En la actualidad Ana está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará ranchos víveres, bebidas, refrescos en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos.
texts.en:
Ana Milena, 46, owns a store where she sells snacks, foodstuffs, meat and basic staples at retail.  Her business was born six years ago in the town of Puerto Colombia very near the ocean when she noticed the little competition that existed in this type of business and the great need the inhabitants of this town had of being able to buy small quantities of the products the residents of this port consume daily.  Her goal is to enlarge the business until converting it into a self-service market.

Ana Milena enjoys having a satisfied clientele that grows daily.  Because of that, her working capital turns out to be insufficient and she has to buy small amounts frequently.  Her store’s location makes it a favorite because of its pleasant view since it’s located on a small hill where the marine view, especially of the old port which is a very popular tourist destination for residents from the city of Barranquilla and other cities in Atlántico Department, can be admired.

Ana is asking for her first Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy snacks, soft-drinks and beverages in larger amounts so that she can qualify for discounts.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Esta separada de su esposo, pero vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 7 años, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Diana  es la venta de ropas de diversas variedades y para todos los géneros, para lo cual viaja cosntantemente a la ciudad de Lima, lugar donde consegui la ropa a un menor precio. Sus cartera de clientes están sus amistades, profesores de los colegios, amigos recomendados , dejando a crédito o al contado. Desde hace 6 años que realiza esta activida, tiempo que le valió para ser conocida y ganarse la preferencia de una regular clientela. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ya que estando sola, solo cuenta con la pensión que le pasa su ex pareja. Por otro lado, considera rentable su negocio ya que le deja regulares ganancias y cuenta con una regular clientela, dándole  una rotación constante a sus productos, por eso desea abrir una tienda de venta de ropa en su propia casa. Este será el crédito número 3 con la institución MFP, está muy agradecida con el préstamo recibido para avanzar con su negocio, por esto se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos y para todos los géneros, buscando menores precios, así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Diana, 31, is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She’s separated from her husband but lives with her four children who are 13, 11, 9 and 7 years old in a house that’s her property.  Diana sells all sorts of clothes for both men and women.  To do so, she travels constantly to the city of Lima to buy clothes at lower prices.  Her client portfolio consists of acquaintances, school teachers, friends and referred customers; she sells on credit or for cash.  

She’s been in this line of work for six years and in this time she’s become well-known and has won over the preference of her regular customers.  What she likes about her work is having income to meet household expenses and be able to educate her children because since she’s alone she can only count on the allowance her ex-husband provides.  She considers her business to be profitable because it produces regular profits and she has a regular customer base which leads to constant turnover of stock inventory which is why she wants to open a clothing store at home.

This will be MFP loan #3.  She is very grateful for the loan she got to continue forward with her business so she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She will use the entire amount requested to buy clothes in various styles and for all genders and looking for the best prices so that her profits will be higher.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy essential food products.

loans.name: Edgar Francisco

texts.es: Telica, uno de lo principales municipios de la ciudad de León , donde as calles son de adoquines, casas de adobe y techos de teja  justo ahí es donde es originario Edgar , un sencillo pero trabajador comerciante , de 40 años de edad, padre de familia, casado, tiene tres hijos de  18 ,17 y 6 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos esta estudiando su primer año de la carrera de contabilidad su segundo hijo esta cursando el tercer año de la secundaria y el menor de sus hijos asiste al Kinder Garden, su esposa es ama de casa pero lo ayuda a el con el negocio de  la venta de ropa. Don Edgar alquila un pequeño local cerca de la iglesia del pueblo donde vende ropa de niños, jóvenes y adultos, camisetas , pantalones, blusas, shorts, camisas de varón, todos los días sale de su caso cargando toda su mercancía para acomodarla en su humildes carretones y comenzar a vender para poder reunir el aliento y suplir las necesidades de su familia, el nos cuenta que empezó hace tres años con este negocio lo puso son unos ahorros que tenía el  pues antes el trabajaba en la alcaldía de su ciudad y también laboro para diferentes empresas pero las escases de trabajo se hizo intensa y no conseguía empleo formal así que decidió poner su negocio propio al ver muy pocas posibilidades de conseguir trabajo pues las necesidades de su familia no podían esperar gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien y es así como se gana la vida y saca adelante a sus hijos. El requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa nueva tales como camisas, jeans de varón y de mujer, blusas, fajas, camisetas, pantalones de tela. Pues se acerca la época navideña quiere aprovechar a vender toda su mercadería, así mejorar sus ventas, pagar su deuda e invertir en compra de maniquíes, vitrinas y mas variedad de mercadería para vender, en lo futuro le gustaría  tener su propio local para poner una tienda de ropa y contratar a personas para que lo ayuden a vender.
texts.en:
Telica, one of the principal municipalities of the city of Leon, where the streets are made of cobblestone, the houses of adobe, and the roofs of tile, is precisely where Edgar is from. He is a simple but hardworking businessman, 40 years old, a father of a family, and married. He has three children who are 18, 17, and 6 years old. The oldest of his children is taking the first year of an accounting course. His second child is in the third year of high school and his youngest child attends kindergarten. His wife is a housewife but she helps him with his retail clothing business.

Edgar rents a small place near the town church where he sells clothing for children, juniors, and adults, including pants, blouses, shorts, and men's shirts. Every day he leaves his home carrying all his merchandise to fit it all into his humble carts and begin to sell--to be able to gather his strength and supply for the needs of his family. He tells us that he started this business three years ago with some savings he had, as before that he worked in the city's mayor's office and also worked for different companies. But the scarcity of work became intense and he couldn't get a formal job so he decided to start his own business when he saw very few possibilities of getting work. The needs of his family couldn't wait, and thank God it has gone well for him and this is how he earns a living and gets his children ahead.

He needs the loan to buy new clothing such as shirts, men's and women's jeans, blouses, girdles, t-shirts, and trousers. The Christmas season is coming and he wants to take advantage to sell all of his merchandise, in this way improving his sales to pay off his debt and invest in buying mannequins, display cases, and more variety of merchandise to sell. In the future he would like to have his own place to create a clothing store and hire people to help him sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes such as shirts, men's and women's jeans, blouses, girdles, t-shirts, and trousers.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
La señora Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropa informal, blusas y otras prendas de vestir en el municipio de Rionegro al Oriente de Antioquia, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien realizaba esta función y le enseñó a su hija a trabajar para poder conseguir con este negocio los ingresos familiares. Sandra busca sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Con motivo de la temporada de fin de año que se aproxima, Sandra desea comprar mercancía como blusas,  chaquetas, jeans, entre otras prendas de vestir para toda la familia con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y a futuro aumentar la variedad de productos que vende y tener un mayor número de clientes. Sandra espera contribuir con su negocio al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra sells casual clothing, such as blouses and other items in the Rionegro municipality, west of Antioquia, she learned this business from her mom who used to do the same activity and taught her how to work in this business to generate income for her family.  Sandra wants to get her two children ahead and give them a better quality of life.

Because of the upcoming holiday season, Sandra wants to buy merchandise such as blouses, jackets, jeans and other clothing items for the family to increase her income and in the future have more variety of products to have a larger number of clients.  Sandra hopes to contribute through her business to the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, jackets, jeans, and other clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La señora Susana nacida en Santa Cruz se dedica a la repostería a la elaboración de galletas y panes es casada con el señor Ramón  tienen dos hijos, su domicilio es propio que se encuentra ubicado en la zona el torno,  viven hace 30 años en esta zona, la señora tiene con esta  actividad ya varios años,  la repostería es lo que mas le gusta, vende tortas, queques, etc. a pedidos, además es maestra, el destino del crédito es para la compra de horno y utensilios para  poner un pequeño local para vender sus productos se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la confianza otorgada.
texts.en:
Susana was born in Santa Cruz and she’s a pastry maker; she bakes cookies and bread.  She’s married to Ramón and they have two children.  She owns her house located in El Torno.  They have lived in this zone for 30 years and she’s been in this line of work for several years now.  Pastry making is what she likes best.  She sells cakes, Bundt cakes, etc. on order.  She’s also a teacher.

The loan will be used to buy an oven and utensils to open a small locale to sell her products.  She feels very grateful to the institution for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: to buy an oven and utensils.

loans.name: Nivaldo

texts.es: Nivaldo con su credikiva anterior compró insumos para comidas rápidas, gaseosas, refrescos y otras bebidas, con los que generó mayores uitilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará bebidas y refrescos especialmente, asi como materiles para preparar sus deliciosas comidas. Está inversión planea ser muy exitosa porque es la época futbolera de Colombia y su negocio está justamente muy cerca al estadio metropolitano de Barranquilla donde juega el equipo amado de la costa Caribe y es allí donde se llevarán a cabo las eliminatorias del mundial del 2014 en Brazil. Su mensaje a los financiadores es que se siente muy agradecido con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espera seguir contando con el apoyo económico´para continuar progresando él y su familia.
texts.en: Nivaldo used his previous Kiva loan to purchase ingredients for fast foods, along with soft drinks and other refreshments, with which he generated increased profits. Currently, he is applying for his second Kiva loan, with which he will purchase soft drinks and other refreshments, especially, along with ingredients to prepare his delicious foods. This investment should be very successful, since it is soccer (football) season in Colombia and his business is located right next to the Barranquilla metropolitan stadium, where the local team is beloved along the Caribbean coast, and where qualifying rounds of the 2014 World Cup in Brazil will be played. His message to his financial backers is that he feels very grateful towards Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation], and he hopes to continue counting on their economic support so that he and his family can continue to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and other refreshments, especially, along with ingredients to prepare his delicious foods.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
La señora Demetria tiene 57 años D. edad, esta casada con un hijo.

Ella se dedica desD. hace más D. 15 años a vender tortillas, antes ella realizaba las cortas D. café y los oficios domésticos D. su hogar. Esta actividad la prendió D. su mamá, pero nunca se había dedicado a vender tortillas hasta que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo, y ella busco la manera D. ayudar en el hogar y cuando vio que era rentable, empezó a trabajar más.

El maíz que es la materia prima primordial, para elaborar las tortillas las compra en una tienda D. la ciudad, ella compra por mayor, por que le sale más barato, cuando ya ha comprado el maíz paga para que se lo lleven a su casa, el vehiculo tarda D. 10 a 15 minutos y la dejan a 500 metros D. su casa, luego lleva el maíz cargado en su espalda hasta llegar a su casa.

Demetria solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una plancha, por que tiene intenciones D. vender pupusas. Con eso ella tendrá una nueva herramienta D. trabajo D. la cual obtendrá ganancias para su familia, y la ventaja es que donD. vive no hay competencia D. venta D. pupusas, por lo que tendrá buena demanda.

Demetria piensa continuar trabajando en la venta D. tortillas y pupusas y tener una casa más amplia para vivir con su esposo y con su demás familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Demetria is 57, married, and has one child.

For over 15 years, she has sold tortillas. Before this she harvested coffee and did housework. She learned this work from her mother, but she had never sold tortillas until her husband lost his job. She wanted to find a way to help out, and when she saw that selling tortillas was profitable, she started to work more.

She buys the corn, which is a basic, fundamental ingredient for making the tortillas, from a store in the city. She buys it wholesale, because it is cheaper, and after buying it from the store she pays to have it delivered to her home. The truck takes 10 to 15 minutes to arrive, and leaves the corn 500 metres from her home. She carries the corn on her back to her home.

Demetria is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo for the purchase of a griddle, because she wants to sell pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. With this investment, she will have a new work tool with which to make an income for her family. Where she lives, there is no competition in selling pupusas; this is an advantage, and she will have a good demand for her product.

Demetria plans to keep working selling pupusas. She wants to have a bigger home for her husband and their other family members.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make pupusas.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa integrante del Banco comunal “Oportunidad” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre de las Casas, ciudad de Temuco.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio vendiendo flores en un local que tiene ubicado al frente del cementerio de la misma comuna.
Se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 30 años. 
Su horario de trabajo es durante todos los días de la semana, los únicos días que no atiende es cuando debe abastecerse de flores para su negocio. 
Comenta que las temporadas de más alta demanda son para el día de la madre y diversas festividades. 
Sus flores las encarga y compra directamente en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará flores para abastecer su florería. 
Las metas en su negocio son continuar con su negocio y que le siga brindando utilidades. 
Luisa vive junto a su hijo, su nuera y sus dos nietos de 21 y 14 años de edad. Su hijo también se dedica al mismo rubro y cuenta con una florería.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son descansar del ritmo de trabajo y poder tomarse vacaciones, salir a conocer diferentes ciudades dentro de Chile. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta que disfruta de las reuniones y del grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que son muy unidos, responsables, por lo que Luisa se siente muy cómoda. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para organizar de mejor manera su negocio. 
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Oportunidad” [Opportunity], and lives in the municipality of Padre Las Casas, in the city of Temuco.
She sells flowers in a shop she has which is located across from the municipality’s cemetery.
She has spent thirty years in this business.
Her working hours are during every day of the week. The only days she is not in her shop are when she needs to restock flowers for her business.
She comments that the times with the highest demand are around Mother’s Day and other festival days.
She orders and purchases her flowers directly in the city of Santiago.
She will use the loan to purchase flowers to supply her flower shop.
Her goals for her business are to continue operating and receiving profits.
Luisa lives with her son, her daughter-in-law, and her two grandchildren, who are twenty one and fourteen years of age. Her son also works under the same title and has a flower shop.
Her dreams on a personal level are to slow down the pace of her work and be able to take a vacation, so that she can visit and get to know different cities in Chile.
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza [Hope Fund] has provided her to invest in her business. Additionally, she comments that she enjoys the meetings and her Communal Bank group, since the members are all very united and responsible, and this makes Luisa feel very comfortable.
With respect to the training courses, these have served her well to better organize her business.
Padre Las Casas is a municipality in southern Chile, close to the city of Temuco, in the Araucanía region. Its name was given in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who was a defender of the indigenous peoples during the Spanish exploration of America. A significant Mapuche population lives in the municipality. The economy is based in agro-industry and commercial services.

loans.use: To purchase flowers to supply her flower shop.

loans.name: Marubeni

texts.es: Marubeni, de 37 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive con Digno, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos de 12 y 2 años, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad, la cual lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Marubeni es la venta de comida, como menú y platos extras, contando con un pequeño local que logró ambientar en su propia casa, en donde coloco mesas y sillas necesarias para atender cómodamente a sus clientes. Con sus deliciosos platillos, y la buena sazón que aprendió de su madre, logró ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes desde hace 5 años, tiempo que viene funcionando su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya en los gastos del hogar a su pareja, ya que muchas veces con los ingresos de empleado en una entidad privada no les alcanzaba, fue entonces decidió iniciar su negocio. Sin embargo le reculta muy agotador al termino de cada día de trabajo, pero eso no la desanima y sigue trabajando, deseosa de progresar. Sus planes es crecer su negocio, mejorar el ambiente y variar sus platillos. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en mejorar los ambientes de su local, como el pintado de paredes, arreglos del piso, acabados de los servicios higiénicos, para poder brindar un ambiente más cómodo a sus clientes y seguir teniendo sus preferencias.
texts.en:
37-year-old Marubeni is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She lives with Digno and they have two children aged 12 and 2.  They live in their own home which they managed to buy with a lot of effort.  Marubeni's business is selling food such as set menus and á la carte dishes.  She has a small sales location which she managed to set up in her own home, in which she set up the tables and chairs she needs to serve her customers comfortably.  With her delicious dishes and the good flavor that she learned from her mother, she has gained the loyalty of her customers who she has served for five years.  What Marubeni likes about her business is having an income which she can use to support her partner with the household expenses as he works for a private company and his income often doesn't reach far enough.  For this reason, she decided to start her own business.  However, her work is very exhausting and she is tired at the end of every work day.  This does not discourage her though and she continues working with a desire to make progress.  Her plans are to grow her business, improve her premises and vary her dishes.

This will be Marubeni's fifth loan from MFP.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit which she can use to make progress in her business.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  Marubeni will use the sum of 2,000 soles that she has requested to invest in improving her business premises, painting the walls, repairing the floor and finishing off the bathrooms, so that she can provide her customers with a better atmosphere and thereby keep their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy paint, lay flooring and improve her bathroom infrastructure

loans.name: Miramar Femenina 4 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group Miramar Feminina 4.  Her story is representative of her group and others from the city of Samana, an area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their four children. 

Josefina is excited to be taking her 13th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. Josefina started her business with her first Esperanza loan seven years ago. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a food stand where she sells vegetables, meat, fruits, salads, and other grocery products. She will use the profits to make changes in her business and house, specifically in the structure, by building a small stand next to her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, and grocery products.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto es una persona joven que trabaja con su minibús de siete pasajeros en el servicio de transporte público del sindicato de transportes de la zona de Pampahasi,  Roberto vive junto a su madre y a su hermano menor, Roberto se encarga de todos los gastos de la casa como ser pagos de luz y el agua. Roberto es muy conocido en la zona y por sus compañeros de trabajo como una persona responsable y correcta ya que él como hermano mayor se preocupa por que su hermano menor termine sus estudios. Uno de sus mayores deseos es lograr que su hermano termine sus estudios de colegio y posteriormente estudie una carrera. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo de dinero para la compra de materiales de construcción en la casa de su madre ya que el techo de uno de sus cuartos a tenido varias goteras y quiere realizar la reparación antes que comience la época de lluvias.
texts.en:
Roberto is a young man working driving a seven-passenger minibus providing public transportation services as part of the Pampahasi transportation syndicate.  Roberto lives with his mother and younger brother.  Roberto takes care of all household expenses like electricity and water.  

Roberto is very well known in the zone and by his fellow workers as a responsible, correct person since he, as the older brother, sees to his younger brother and is concerned that he completes his schooling. One of his greatest wishes is that his younger brother completes high school and later on a career.

On this occasion he’s asking for a loan to buy building materials because the roof on one of his mother’s house’s rooms is leaking and he wants to repair it before the rainy season starts.

loans.use: to buy building materials.
